I stopped speaking the moment I heard the voice coming out of my mouth; it definitely was not mine. Feeling the need to find out what was going on; I carefully got to my feet. Some subconscious urge caused me to grab the purse from the table. I started walking towards the exit, stumbling every few feet because I was now wearing boots.

Once out of the library, I made my way to the nearest bathroom; avoiding the panicking kids and adults as I went. Walking into the boy’s bathroom, I went over to the mirror and was shocked by the reflection I saw before me. It was that of an attractive girl with dark blonde hair; she was wearing a skirt and matching top. I immediately recognized the girl as Ashley Johnson; one of the most popular girls in the 10th grade.

Everyone at school knew about Ashley; she was the only child of a middle-aged couple. Her father was a businessman and her mom was a professor at the local college. Being that she was the only child, she was very spoiled and always seemed to get her way. Along with her friends Lisa Martin and Joyce Collins, she was one of the popular girls that every boy wanted to date.

I slowly realized that this was not a dream; that I’d really become a 16-year-old girl. Once I realized I was no longer in my body, I had to figure out what to do next. I left the bathroom a moment later; only vaguely aware of the fact that I was walking perfectly fine in the boots now. As I walked down the hall, I decided my next course of action would be to find Corinne and get us both home safely.

I wandered the halls for what seemed like hours; coming across people in various stages of distress. After a while, I’d yet to find Corinne, but I hadn’t found my body either. I had to wonder where Ashley was; I'd seen no sign of my body and no one had run up to me claiming I was in their body.

It wasn’t long before I found Corinne poking her head out of a nearby stairwell. Running towards her, I yelled, “Corinne!”

Seeing me, Corinne looked at me and said, “I’m not Corinne; I’m Eric Rogers.”

Eric was a kid in Corinne’s grade; he was kind of a nerd. Looking at him, I said, “Eric, I have to find Corinne. Where were you when this happened?”

“I was at home with the flu.” Pausing, looking at his now female body, Eric said, “Who’d have thought that having the flu would be the worst to happen to me this year.”

“Get someplace safe, Eric; people are starting to freak out

“Why are you so concerned about Corinne, Ashley?”

It occurred to me that I had not told Eric who I really was. Looking at him, I said, “With everything that’s going on, I’d hate for anyone to get hurt.”

“Okay.” Pausing, Eric said, “I-I’ll go to her house; I found her keys in her purse and she doesn’t live that far from here.”

Eric proved to be a dead end; as he lived on the other side of town. As I resigned myself to the fact that I would not get to Corinne anytime soon, I began to wonder what I was going to do. Here I was in a girl’s body amidst a world of chaos; I started to worry for my safety.

As I made my way to the front of the building, I began to think of my next course of action. The logical thing to do was to go to my house, but it was 20 minutes away from here and I would be even less safe out there then I was in here.

I am not sure why I ultimately decided not to go home; I mean Eric thought to go to my place, but for some reason, I felt like I should not go there. After a few moments of indecision, I decided that going to Ashley’s place was the best bet. She lived in a gated subdivision about 10 minutes from here; I figured that would give me some protection.

As I walked down the street, I saw all sorts of chaos; car crashes, buildings on fire and people running around in a panic. Thankfully, no one seemed to pay attention to me. I arrived at Ashley’s subdivision a few minutes later; walking through the remains of the front gate.

Hearing screaming and explosions in the distance, I ran the rest of the way to Ashley’s house. With Ashley’s parents out of town, I figured no one would have a problem with me spending the night. Arriving at the front door, I dug through Ashley’s purse and found her keys.

After letting myself into the house, I quickly closed and locked the door. Placing Ashley’s purse on a nearby table, I walked into the family room. Ashley was known for thrown parties at her house when her parents weren’t around, but since I was considered unpopular I never received an invitation. I would never have thought my first time in her house would be when I was in her body.

Looking around the family room, I was mildly surprised by how modest it was. There was a high-end TV on the wall but it looked about 45 inches. On a shelf next to the TV, I saw pictures of Ashley at various ages. Seeing her vacation photos, I started to get jealous of her. I had a crappy home life, my mom worked just enough to provide for my family and I hadn’t been on a vacation in years.

But looking at the photos, I could see Ashley having the time of her life in places like the Bahamas or skiing in the mountains. I couldn’t help but wonder how such a spoiled brat got everything when I had nothing.

Walking into the kitchen, feeling thirsty, I grabbed a water bottle from the fridge. Exploring the house a little more, I eventually found Ashley’s room. It seemed this was where her parents spent most of their money; she had a 40” TV on the wall and a closet full of what looked to be expensive clothes.

I sat down on the bed, which proved to be very comfortable, as I heard explosions and screams in the distance. As I heard those, I realized that I was now in a girl’s body; I had to make sure that I wasn’t in harm's way. After running to ensure that all the windows and doors were locked, I went back up to Ashley’s room.

Lying on the bed, in a way that didn’t involve lying on my breasts, I closed my eyes and fell asleep.
1141322211112.title: Thread Restart

11413222111121.content:
I wasn’t entirely sure how long I’d slept; but when I woke up, I saw that the sun had started to set. Sitting up, I was briefly confused as to why I was in a girl’s room until I remembered what happened.

With more explosions in the distance, I could not help but wonder what was going on outside and if my family was safe. Going downstairs to retrieve Ashley’s cell phone from her purse, I called my house to see if anyone was there. After several rings, all I got was the voicemail. I was about to leave a message when the call suddenly dropped.

Looking at the phone, I saw that I no longer had any service; didn’t take long to realize a cell tower must have been hit. Just then there was a large explosion nearby; followed by screaming. I stood in the foyer, starting to freak out when I heard loud knocking on the front door. Letting out a girlish scream, I went to the window to see what was going on. I was somewhat surprised to see Lisa and Joyce standing on the porch; looking startled.

Opening the door, I said, “What are you guys doing here?”

“We’ve been trying to contact you for hours, but the cell service totally sucks with all that’s happening.” Looking at me, Lisa said, “We hid in a vacant room at the school until things quieted down; we came here because it was closer to school than our houses.

“Come on, get inside.”

Once we were all inside, Joyce looked at me and said, “I’m so glad you’re safe, Ashley.”

After locking the door, I turned to Joyce and said, “I’m not really Ashley, I-I’m Evan Thompson.”
11413222111121.title: Later On

114132221111211.content:
“You’re Evan Thompson; that loser from the astronomy club?” looking at me, Joyce said, “Why are you here in Ashley’s house, loser?”

“It was the closest place I had access to.” Pausing, I said, “I’m the body of a teenage girl; with everything going on, I was afraid people might try to take advantage of me.”

“I guess I can understand that; after all, Lisa and I were hiding at school.” Pausing, Joyce said, “But don’t get any ideas; you may have Ashley’s body, but you’re still a loser.”

“Hey it’s not like I wanted this body; I don’t know anything about being a girl.” Looking at Joyce, I said, “Wait a minute, how come you two weren’t affected?”

“Who knows; but I’m glad I wasn’t.” peeking out the window, Lisa said, “I’d rather die than give up my body.”

Walking into the family room, with Lisa and Joyce behind me, I sat down on the couch. Turning on the TV, which was showing a report about what was going on, I said, “So, uh, what do we do now?”

“Normally I wouldn’t want anything to do with you, Evan. But,” sitting next to me, Lisa said, “Like you said; things are crazy out there and we’re all girls. So I think the best bet would be to stay here where it’s safe.”

“I agree with Lisa.” Looking at me, Joyce said, “Don’t think this means you’re suddenly our friend or anything; once this is fixed, we’re back to shunning you.”

“I understand.”

Once we’d all come to an agreement, the three of us sat down on the couch and watched the news.

**************


After about an hour of watching the news, about what they were now calling the Great Shift, Lisa got up from the couch. “I don’t know about you two, but I’m getting hungry.”

“Me too.” Pausing, I said, “When I was looking around earlier, I saw a container of pulled pork in the fridge; maybe we could have that.”

“Normally I wouldn’t eat that because of my figure. But,” sighing, Joyce said, “I guess I don’t have much choice.”

Looking at me, Lisa said, “Evan, why don’t you help me in the kitchen.”

Getting up, I followed Lisa into the kitchen. “Why do you need my help? The container isn’t that heavy.”

“I know.” Turning to look at me, Lisa said, “I just wanted to talk to you without Joyce in the room.”

“Talk to me?” confused, I said, “About what?”

“I’m sorry if I came across a little bitchy earlier. I guess I let my emotions get the better of me; I didn’t really care about how you were affected by all this.”

“It’s okay; I totally understand why you acted the way you did.”

“To be honest, I only really acted that way because Joyce did. She can be a bit of a bitch at times.” Sighing, Lisa said, “You know how it is with peer pressure.”

“Actually I don’t, but I get your point.”

“Anyway, I wanted to apologize for making you uncomfortable.” Looking at me, Lisa said, “I’m willing to help you deal with being a girl until this is reversed.”

“Thanks.”

After grabbing what we’d need for food, I followed Lisa back into the family room. Looking at us, Joyce said, “What kept you guys?”
“We were just talking.”k
114132221111211.title: Continue

1141322211112111.content:
I woke up the next morning to the sound of Lisa yelling and shaking me. “Wake up Evan!”

Startled by the rude awakening, I shot up from where I’d been lying on the couch. As I sat there, I was momentarily confused by the long hair in front of my eyes; until I’d remembered the events of the day before. Looking at Lisa, annoyed, I said, “Why’d you wake me?”

“Joyce is gone.”

“What?” Surprised, I said, “How?”

“I don’t know, I woke up to use the bathroom but I couldn’t find her.”

Getting off the couch, I said, “Where could she have gone?”

“I don’t know.” Gesturing to the table, Lisa said, “She left her purse and cell phone behind; which isn’t like her.”

“Wait a minute.” Looking at Lisa, I said, “Remember the news report from last night; the one about aftershocks?”

“Yeah, why?” pausing, Lisa said, “Wait; you don’t think she was affected by one of those, do you?”

“It’s the only likely explanation; like you said it’s not like her to leave her purse and phone.” Pausing, I said, “Whoever ended up in her body probably ran off in shock; I don’t know if we’ll ever see them again.”

“But why hasn’t Joyce contacted us?”

“Who knows; maybe she’s in a body that’s incapable of using a phone. Or maybe...maybe she’s dead.”

“That’s not funny, Evan.”

“It wasn’t meant to be; you saw the news reports, people shifting into people driving cars or getting hit by out of control vehicles.” Looking at Lisa, I said, “I know it’s hard to accept, but that could very well be the reason.”

“That’s just great.” Tearing up, Lisa sat on the couch. Looking at me, she said, “First Ashley, a girl I’ve known since Kindergarten, goes missing and now Joyce.”

“Hey, we’ll figure it out.” Sitting down next to Lisa, I said, “I’m still here.”

“Thanks.” Wiping tears from her eyes, Lisa said, “You know, it’s weird to hear such concern coming from Ashley’s body.”

“You think that’s weird; try talking and having a different voice than the one you had yesterday.”

"You're right; I keep forgetting that you're a guy in there."

"Hard to believe, isn't it." gesturing to my new body, I said, "With a body like this, no one would imagine I was a boy."
1141322211112111.title: The Next Morning

11413222111121111.content:
After my little talk with Lisa, the two of us went about doing our own thing; which mostly consisted trying to track down our family. I did not have any luck finding mine; when I called the house, Eric had answered in Corinne’s body and said he had not heard from my mom or Corinne.
Lisa, on the other hand, had better luck; she had found a message on her family’s voicemail from her parents. Her dad had ended up in the body of a pregnant 17 year old in Arizona; while her mom now a college basketball player.
The power went out shortly after we finished our phone calls; so we were once again left with nothing to do. As we sat at the table eating sandwiches, Lisa turned to me and said, “I have an idea for something we could do.”
“Oh really?” pausing, I said, “What’s that?”
“I don’t know if it’s something you’ll be okay with. But,” standing up, Lisa said, “We could go out back and lounge by the pool.”
“Why would I have a problem with that?” chuckling, I said, “All I really need is a...”
Lisa saw the look of realization cross my face. Looking at me, she said, “Yeah, it’s going to involve you wearing a bikini.”
“I’m not sure about that, Lisa; I’m still new to this body.” Pausing, I said, “I haven’t even seen it naked yet; and you want me to wear a bikini in public?”
“First off; don’t talk about seeing that body naked, it’s disgusting.” Looking at me, Lisa said, “Second of all, with everything that’s going on, no one is going to pay attention to two girls lounging around a backyard pool.”
“I guess you’re right.” Sighing, I said, “Fine, I’ll do it.”
“Great.” Leading me upstairs, Lisa said, “Just so I know you’re not doing anything freaky; I’ll watch you get changed.”
“Oh no you won’t; I’m not letting you see me naked.”
“What’s the big deal; it’s not like I’ve never see a girl naked before.”
I quickly realized the futility of arguing with Lisa. I followed her upstairs; nervously awaiting what came next.

I thought about taking Ashley's life for my own for a while. Compared to my old life, hers was much more easy going and her parents gave her anything she wanted, whenever she wanted it. My mother never gives me anything. She makes me work for it. When I wanted a phone, she made me do chores until I saved the money to buy it myself. But Ashley, I could here her barging about her new phone every 3rd month. Just then I was interrupted by a knock at the door. I peeked out the window and saw my old body.

"Great" I told myself. "That's probably Ashely coming to take back her life" I went and opened the door.

"Even, is that you?" Ashely asked.

"Ya, it's me. I thought you would come here sooner or later" I lied. "I thought we should talk about what were going to do about this"

"Well" she started. "Sense your sister is in one of your friends body's, she's taking your clothes, which I'm fine with. I'll just get some new ones. You mom is in your sisters body so she plans on using her clothes. So I thought I'd help you pack my clothes and we could take them to your house. This way you don't have to share with your mom"

"Are you sure?" I asked. "I took a look in your closet and there is too much for just us to carry"

"Don't worry. We can take my daddy's SUV. It should fit all of my clothes" she said.

With that, we started packing her clothes into boxes. I was surprised with how long it took us. I looked at the clock before we started packing and it read 7:30 pm. When we had finished it was 9:43. I thought about weather I wanted her clothes as we packed everything into the SUV. Almost all her tops looked so tight and reveling and most of her bottoms were skirts. She had plenty of jeans to, but they were all skinny jeans. And then there were the shoes. It looked like almost every pair had some sort of heel to it. And the few that didn't were the gym shoes she would wear when she decided she would actually go to gym class. I think she was in my gym class, but she had only been there like once or twice this year, so they were almost all in perfect condition. There were like five pairs of gym shoes, but they were all girly colors like pink and purple. She still had all the boxes for her shoes, so we put them in the correct box that it came in originally.

After packing all of Ashley's clothing into the boxes, I realized that the heeled boots she had been wearing when the shift happened were starting to hurt my feet. I sat on Ashley's bed and took them off. Then I grabbed a pair of her gym shoes. They were black and purple. Just as I pulled them out I herd Ashley say "Hell no"

"What?" I asked, confused as to why I couldn't wear the shoes.

"Those shoes don't go with that outfit" she informed me. She then went to one of the boxes of clothes and pulled something out. "Here, wear these. While I will let you develop your own fashion seance later, right now you still have to look good"

I looked at what she handed me. On top was a white short sleeve under armer tech shirt. Then some black yoga pants that didn't have a makers label anywhere I could see. Lastly she handed me a grey under armed hoody with some purple by the shoulders.

"Put these on" she told me.

"Ok" I said taking the clothes and turning to the bathroom.

"Don't worry about the bathroom. You have my body, I've seen it naked thousands of times" she said.

I thought about it before realizing she was right. I striped down to my underwear and put on the pants first. I looked over at Ashley and saw she was hard. "I see you like the view" I jokingly said. She hadn't realized what I was talking about until she looked down.

"It has a mind of its own" she said. She sounded a little scared that she was attracted to her old body.

"Don't worry, it's just the body" I told her. "Hey this might sound a little weird, but could you cut my hair a little shorter before we leave. It just feels weird by my waist" I asked as I finished getting changed.

"Sure thing, how long do you want it?" She said.

"How about we cut it to say, my shoulder blades" I told her.

"No problem" she said. She took me to the kitchen and sat me down. She then brushed my hair, got some scissors and started to cut my hair. She cut it just below my shoulder blades. She handed me a hand mirror and, I must say, I looked HOT. If I was still a guy, I would totally be hard right now.

"I think that my old body looks better with shorter hair. I can't believe I never thought about it" Ashley said admiring her work.

We finished packing Ashley's clothes into her dad's SUV. I was surprise everything fit. We then made the thirty minute drive to my house on the other side of town. We talked almost the whole ride there. We talked about school, our friends and family. Ashely talked mostly and I just listened to her. I was trying to figure out what life would be like now. My mom now looks like my sister. My sister looks like my best friend. I brushed some of my new long brown hair out of my face and looked out the window.

Ashley noticed the look on my face. "I'm worried to. It's not every day you end up in someone else's body" she said

"It's not just that" I started. "I'm just scared. I mean, I don't know the first thing about being a girl."

"Don't worry. Your mom offered to let me stay with your family until my parents come home and we can all help you adjust to your new situation. And I want to help you through this transition so you can help me" she said.

We arrived at my house and I saw my sister and my best friend Ryan. I had to remind myself that Corinne was really my mother and Ryan was really Corinne.

"How's my "sister" Corinne said, putting emphasis on sister.

"I don't know, how's my "brother" I asked in the same tone of voice.

"Let's not make fun at our situations ok" my mom said. "This is very serious. Let's start unpacking Evans new clothes and put them in his room. Just so you know Evan, we moved all of your clothing to Corinne's room, and all of Corinne's clothes to my room. Ashley, you can sleep in the guest room or Corinne's room, whichever you prefer until your parents show up"

"Like thanks a ton Mrs. Reed. I just like don't feel conferrable being home alone right now. You never know if someone is how they say they are"

"True. How will your parents know to call here?" Mom asked.

"Before we left my house, I changed the answering machine. If anybody calls it will tell them to call my cellphone. My parents have my number memorized, so they will call when they are able to" she said

It was really funny to here my best talking like my sister would and my sister talking like my mom. And my old body, talked like a teenage girl. And now, I sounded like a teenage girl whenever I talked.

We worked hard to get all of Ashley's old clothes (my new ones) in my closet. There was barley enough room in my closet. Then the under-where in the dresser. Then we stacked the boxes of shoes along the wall. Everyone left to go and watch some tv while I sat on my bed and looked at my room. It looked so different now, with the closet filled with clothes and shoes that are considered fashionable in the closet and along the wall. I took a moment to let it sink in. I ran my hand through my hair. Then I stood up and grabbed some sweatpants from my closet that had our school name running down the left leg. I removed the the yoga pants and sweatshirt and then put on the sweatpants. While the yoga pants weren't restricting at all, the sweatpants were conferrable and I could sleep in them if I wanted.

I went downstairs and found everyone in the living room watching the news. "Anything new" I asked.

"No" Ashley said. "They don't know who did this, why it happened, or if it's reversible"

"How about we try and take our minds off things and watch a movie" Corinne said.

"It's a good idea as any" I said.

"How about, Grown ups?" Mom asked.

"Sure" said Ashley. "It's been a while sense I've seen that"

Corinne popped in the movie and sat on the recliner chair. Mom sat on the floor next to Corinne, and I plopped next to Ashley on the couch. As we watched the movie and laughed and had a good time, Ashely and I slowly drifted closer and closer until she had fallen asleep on my shoulder just before the end of the movie. When the credits started, I shook her awake.

"You should probably go to bed" I told her.

"Your pro...bably right" she said as she yawned.

"We should all go to bed" my mom said.

I slowly walked up to my bathroom, opened up a new toothbrush, and brushed my teeth. As I finished, Ashley came in the bathroom.

"Your mom said I could share with you" she said.

"No problem, you want to use a new toothbrush or do you want the one I used before this all happened?"

"Pitch the old one" she said. "Oh hey, before you go to bed, I thought I'd teach you something simple that you can do to make getting ready in the morning easier". She pulled a black hair tie from her pocket. "I've found your hair is a little neater in the morning if you pull it into a ponytail. You need my help?" She asked me.

"I'll take all the help I can get" I said. With that she showed me how to put my hair into a ponytail. With that, I said goodnight to Ashely and went to bed.

Letting myself into Ashley’s house, I was thankful that her parents didn’t seem to have a security system in place; because I certainly didn’t know the code. After I closed the door, I placed Ashley’s purse on a nearby table and decided to walk around.

Ashley’s house was well known at school for being the location of many parties over the years; but since I was considered one of the unpopular kids, I was never invited. Who would have thought the first time I’d see the inside of her house would be when I was in her body.

Walking into the family room, I glanced at a large 60’ TV mounted on the wall. It wasn’t long before I found several photos of Ashley and her parents; from when she was a little girl all the way to the present. Seeing some of their vacation photos, I was jealous of the fact that her family was able to go on such nice vacations.

I mean there was even a photo of her overlooking the Grand Canyon. Things had been rough for my family ever since my dad left; so
I couldn't help but feel a pang of jealously over seeing Ashley and her family happy. “This isn’t fair; she’s one of the most stuck up girls I’ve ever met and she gets to experience all of this fun adventures.”

Walking upstairs, it didn’t take long to find Ashley’s room. Looking around I saw many expensive items; a 40’ TV on the wall and a walk in closet full of what looked to be very pricey clothes.

As I sat down on Ashley’s bed, I found my hatred of her growing by the second. She was such a spoiled brat; she didn’t deserve anything her parents gave her. Granted my life wasn’t terrible; but it was nothing compared to hers.

Lying down on the bed, I heard what sounded like explosions in the distance. As I closed my eyes for a bit, I wondered what my next course of action was going to be.
1141322212.title: Inside the house

11413222121.content:
I wasn’t entirely sure how long I’d slept; but when I woke up, I saw that the sun had started to set. Sitting up, I was momentarily confused as to why I was in a girl’s room until I remembered what happened.

With more explosions in the distance, I couldn’t help but wonder what was going on outside and if my family was safe. Going downstairs to retrieve Ashley’s cellphone from her purse, I called my house to see if anyone was there. After several rings, all I got was the voicemail. I was about to leave a message when the call suddenly dropped.

Looking at the phone, I saw that I no longer had any service; didn’t take long to realize a cell tower must have been hit. Just then there was a large explosion nearby; followed by screaming. It suddenly dawned on me that I was now a teenage girl; if someone got into this house and found me, I would have a hard time defending myself.

Making sure the door was locked, I ran upstairs to Ashley’s bedroom and closed the door. After ensuring the blinds were closed and the door to Ashley’s porch was locked, I sat down on the bed.

********************************


I stayed like that for what seemed like an eternity; until I figured it would not be helpful to cower in fear. Getting up, I decided once again to look around Ashley’s room; since it seemed like it was going to be mine for the time being. Walking into her closet, I saw that her close were indeed very pricey; which didn’t surprise me one bit. Ashley was known to be a very fashionable girl; and she would not be caught dead in cheap clothing.

Walking out of the closet, I passed a full-length mirror and caught a glimpse of Ashley’s reflection in it. Turning to look at the mirror, it finally dawned on me that I was in the body of the most popular girl in school. Everyone, even the unpopular kids like me, considered Ashley to be very attractive. Looking at her reflection, I could see why everyone thought that; she had an almost perfect body.

It didn’t take long for me to realize that I was now inhabiting this body; which meant I was now the most attractive girl in school. I couldn’t help but feel weirded out by the idea of boys finding me attractive; I was however surprised to find myself somewhat turned on by the idea.

Shaking those thoughts from my head, I realized that I was getting hungry. Walking downstairs to the kitchen, I spent the next 15 minutes making myself a quick dinner before heading into the family room to watch TV. Turning on the TV, I wasn’t surprised to find that the only thing on TV was live coverage of what people were calling the “Great Shift.” No one seemed to know what caused them or how to reverse them; which meant I was probably going to be like this for the foreseeable future.

After a while I got bored of watching the news, so I decided to watch a DVD inside. As I watched the movie, a strange idea occurred to me. I found myself thinking how nice Ashley’s life was compared to mine; she was popular, her parents were still together and they seemed to have a fair amount of money.

Sitting on the couch, as the movie played in the background, I was surprised to find myself actually considering stealing Ashley’s life and pretending to be her. Getting up to put the dishes away from my dinner, I walked passed a mirror in the hallway.

I couldn’t help but look at it; realizing that I could easily pretend to be Ashley, since the news said there was a small portion of the population who weren’t affected. Of course that would all hinge on the hope that the real Ashley didn’t blow my cover. Looking down at my body, I realized it would be nice to be considered popular and attractive; although being a girl would take some getting used to.

“I guess I’m doing this then.” Placing my hands on my waist, as I had seen the real Ashley do often, I said, “I guess its goodbye Evan Johnson; say hello to the new Ashley Sawyer.”
11413222121.title: Making A Major Decision

114132221211.content:
I did not expect anything earth shattering to happen when I declared that I was taking Ashley’s life for myself. After putting the dishes away, having gotten bored of the movie, I walked upstairs to what was now my room.

“Well since this is my life now, I guess I should educate myself a little.” Closing the door, I said to myself, “People might be suspicious if I suddenly forget some major part of Ashley’s life; or forget names of family members.”

It did not take me long to find where Ashley kept her diaries. I was about to start reading one of them when I felt the urge to use the bathroom. “It’s about time; I was wondering when I’d have to pee in this body.”

With the diary in hand, I walked across the hall to the bathroom and sat down on the toilet. It took a few moments but I eventually figured out how to pee using female plumbing. In the meantime, I passed the time by reading the diary.

Among other things, I learned the names of her cousins and extended family and the fact that Ashley’s sister from her father’s first marriage was going through a nasty divorce. Once I’d finished on the toilet, I walked back into the bedroom and sat down on the bed.
Looking at the clock, I saw that it was almost 8:00; with nothing better to do, I figured it was time to go to bed.

Given that it was now my body, I still felt a little anxious about seeing it naked. It did not take long, thankfully, for me to overcome the anxiety and change into a pair of flannel pajama pants and a tank top.

Turning off the lights and closing the blinds, I climbed into bed and closed my eyes; wondering what tomorrow would bring.
114132221211.title: Continue

1141322212111.content:
After a somewhat restless night of waking up every time I rolled over onto my breasts, I slept in until around 8:30. Getting out of bed, I walked to the bathroom to relieve myself; immediately noticing that I had a bad case of bed hair. As much as I wanted to avoid that for the time being, I knew the best way to fix this was to take a shower.

Almost immediately after entering the shower, I was overwhelmed by new sensations as the water hit my newly sensitive skin. I chose to avoid washing around my chest because I knew that would be too much. Eventually I finished in the shower and got out.

After drying myself off, I remembered what Corinne did with her hair in the morning. I quickly found a hairdryer and went to work. It was not long before my hair was presentable; at least enough that I could go outside if I wanted to. As I walked back to the bedroom, it dawned on me that I was suddenly becoming worried about my appearance when going outside. I wondered if I was gaining some of Ashley’s mannerisms.

With school canceled for the near future, I didn’t have anything to do today. With that in mind, I settled on a causal outfit to wear; consisting of a pair of Capri pants and a top. Once I was satisfied, I decided to continue reading Ashley’s diaries for information.

*****************************


A short time later, I was reading a recent entry about a date Ashley had with the captain of the football team. I wondered if I had to keep dating him to keep up appearances; I did not even know if he was still in his own body. Just as I was about to get a new diary to read, I heard the doorbell. I froze briefly as I wondered if it was Ashley returning home.

Putting the diary down, I went downstairs to see who it was. Peeking through the window, I was surprised to not only see Aaron, Ashley’s boyfriend but also Corinne. Putting on my best Ashley face, I opened the door and said, “Aaron, Corinne; like what are you two doing here?”

“Ugh, it’s like bad enough that I’m in this losers body; now I have people actually thinking that I’m her.” Pausing, ‘Corinne’ turned to me and said, “It’s me, Allison; I got shifted into the body of that Corinne Thompson.”

It took all my strength not to lash out at Allison for saying that about my sister’s body; because I knew that would definitely give me away. Looking from me to Allison, in a feminine tone, ‘Kevin’ said, “At least you guys are still girls; it’s like totally weird being a boy.”

“Erin, is that you?” making sure to stay in character, I said, “You’re totally in my boyfriend’s body.”

Evidently that wasn’t something to be discussed; as Allison turned to me and said, “Don’t bring that up; she’s weirded out by that you wouldn’t believe.”

I looked passed them, relieved that they seemed to believe that I was Ashley, and noticed an approaching storm. “Come on inside, guys; there’s a storm coming.”

Once in the living room, Allison and I watched as Erin struggled find a comfortable seating position. “You guys think this is so funny, don’t you.” Seeing the grins on our faces, Erin said, “How would you guys feel if you were suddenly turned into a boy; and I made fun of you?”

“We wouldn’t like it one bit.” Sighing, I said, “Sorry; we’ll work on that.”

As I sat down, I noticed Erin briefly glancing at my cleavage. Ignoring that for a moment, I said, “So what are you guys doing here?”

“Well with the phones down, and the power out in parts of the city, we wanted to see if you were alright.” Glancing at Erin, Allison said, “Even Erin agreed that walking here as a football player was a good idea.”

“So like what happened after the Shift; where’d you guys go?”

“We stayed at my house, since it was closer to school.” Sighing, Erin said, “My parents were shifted with the newlywed couple down the street; I guess I’m going to be a big brother soon, because my dad is now 6 months pregnant.”

“That sucks for him.” Turning to Allison, I said, “How about your folks?”

“They weren’t affected at all; which is like so weird.” Pausing, Allison said, “I guess only like 10% of the world was unaffected.”

“I guess I was one of the lucky ones then.” Leaning back, unaware that I was giving Erin an even better look at my breasts, I said, “I haven’t heard from my parents at all; I hope they’re alright.”

“They’re probably fine; but just can’t get in touch just yet.”

************************************


We continued talking for a while; I was confident that I was successfully fooling them into thinking I was Ashley. As we talked, I couldn’t help but be amused to hear Kevin’s voice talking about how cute the captain of the swim team was.

After a while, I got up and said, “Are you guys hungry?” pausing, I said, “I think there’s still some sausage pizza left over from my dinner last night.”

“Sure, that sounds fine.” Exchanging a glance with Erin, Allison said, “I’ll help you with it.”

I walked into the kitchen with Allison behind me. I was about to open the fridge when she suddenly grabbed me and spun me
around. “What the hell, Ally?”

“You can drop the act, we know you’re not really Ashley.” Pushing me against the fridge, as Erin walked into the room, Allison said,
“Who are you; and why are you pretending to be Ashley?”

“Okay fine, you got me; I’m not really Ashley.” Sighing, I said, “I’m Evan Thompson.”

“That loser from the astronomy club?” looking at me, Allison said, “Why are you like pretending to be Ashley?”

“It’s a long story.” Pausing, I said, “If you guys sit down, I’ll tell it to you.”
1141322212111.title: The Next Morning

11413222121111.content:
I spent the better part of an hour explaining everything that happened to me since the Shift; from how I ended up here to my decision to become the new Ashley. Once I was finished, I turned to Erin and Allison. “I bet you guys have a lot of questions.”

“No, not really; what you said actually makes a lot of sense.” Looking at me, Allison said, “You may not have been the most popular kid at school; but everyone knew about your shitty family life. There were a couple times that I considered asking if you wanted to hang out; since I knew what you were dealing with.”

“Really?” surprised, I said, “Why didn’t you?”

“I guess I let my need to be popular cloud my judgment.” Wincing, Allison said, “For what its worth, I always thought you handled things pretty well.”

“Thanks.” Pausing, I said, “All that aside; are you guys really okay with me taking Ashley’s life for my own?”

“No, we’re not really okay with it.” Glancing at Allison, Erin said, “Allison, Ashley and myself are...I mean were the most popular girls in the 10th grade; how could we possibly be okay with a nerd like you taking her life?”

“Don’t mind, Erin; she’s not used to testosterone yet.” Looking at me, Allison said, “We’ll make a deal with you; if you’re interested.”

“Okay, what’s the deal?”

“We’ll teach you everything you need to know in order to pass yourself off as Ashley; how to flirt with boys, fashion, etc.” sighing,
Allison said, “We won’t tell anyone the truth about who you are; unless you do something that affects are popularity.”

“Okay, that seems fair.” Breathing a sigh of relief, I said, “One thing I can’t figure out though...how come the real Ashley hasn’t come here yet.”

“Who knows.” Shrugging, Erin said, “Maybe she didn’t end up in your body; and can’t get back here.”

“I guess that makes sense; I guess I just figured if I ended up in her body that she would end up in mine.”

“I hope that’s not the case.” Pausing, Allison said, “No offense, but I don’t much like the idea of your sister being in my body.”

“Okay, now I have to say something,” turning to Erin and Allison, I said, “If you guys don’t want me to make you unpopular; please stop calling me or my sister losers.”

“Fair enough.” Pausing, Allison said, “Now let’s head upstairs; I think the first thing we should work on is your fashion sense.”

“What’s wrong with my fashion sense?” glancing at my outfit, I said, “I thought this looked good.”

“Ashley wouldn’t be caught dead wearing an outfit like that.”
11413222121111.title: Evan Tells His Story

114132221211111.content:
Even with help from both Allison and Erin, it was well into the afternoon before I felt I was ready to test my newly learned fashion skills. I’d spent the last several hours sitting in the chair as Allison and Erin took turns showing me how to do my makeup and hair. After that came the part where they taught me a bit of girl’s fashion; what clothes I should and shouldn’t wear as well as what shoes went with what outfit.

“Okay guys, I think I’ve had enough lessons for one day.” Sighing, I said, “With all this stuff about makeup and hair, I’m trying to remind myself that I used to be a boy.”

“You’re not a boy anymore, Evan; that ended the moment you decided to take Ashley’s place.” Looking at me, Allison said, “Now Erin and I are going downstairs to see what we can do for dinner.”

“Okay, I’ll meet you downstairs once I get dressed.” Getting up, I said, “One thing though; I have to know what gave it away that I wasn’t Ashley.”

“When you said you had a sausage pizza last night.” Turning to me, Erin sad, “Ashley’s been a vegetarian since the 7th grade.”

“I guess that’s why I was on the toilet for a bit last night; this body isn’t used to that food anymore.” Smiling, I said, “Anyway, I’ll be down shortly to show you what I’ve learned.”

***********************


It took me a while to make a decision; but I finally settled on a cute tennis outfit that Allison said Ashley had just bought. After putting it on, I could not help but admire the way it hugged my new figure.

Once I’d selected a pair of matching shoes, I sat down at the vanity to do my hair and makeup.

Once I was all finished, I stood in front of the mirror and admired my handy work; having trouble seeing anything that said I used to be a boy. “Damn, I’m one good looking girl.”

Walking downstairs, I heard Erin and Allison talking in the kitchen.
As I got closer, I heard Erin said, “I don’t think I can stand being around Evan for another second.”

“Why; because he lied to us and pretended to be Ashley?”

“That’s part of it.” Pausing, Erin said, “The biggest part is the way my body is acting when he’s around.”

“If you want to break up with me, Erin; just say so.” Walking into the kitchen, I said, “There are plenty of boys, and girls, who would love to date a girl like me.”

Both Allison and Erin looked at me with shocked expressions on their faces. Allison was the first to speak; walking over to me as she said,
“Wow; I guess you weren’t kidding when you said you were a quick learner.”

“There are advantages to being a nerd.” Chuckling, I said, “Although I can see many more advantages to being one of the most popular girls in school.”

Looking at me, Erin said, “You look pretty good, Evan; I have to say you picked out a really nice outfit.”

“I’m pretty sure you think I look than pretty good.” Gesturing to Erin’s crotch, I said, “I think you like what you see very much.”

“Do you mind not teasing me about that constantly?” blushing, Erin said, “It’s bad enough that I want nothing more than to kiss you; I don’t need you two teasing me about it every chance you get.”

“Okay fine; we’ll stop teasing you.” Giggling, I turned to Allison and said, “So whats for dinner?”

“I don’t know.” Pausing, Allison said, “The three of us were watching our figures for cheerleading; but I guess Erin doesn’t have to worry about that anymore.”

Looking at us, Erin said, “How about we just have whatever leftovers are in the fridge?”

“I guess that works.”
114132221211111.title: Continue

I told them it helped that I had known Ashley for years.

After 3 days they were confident that I could fool everyone, including my new parents, into thinking I really was Ashley. That proved somewhat challenging due to her resistance and the fact that my body was attracted to hers.

Allison was another problem entirely; she resented the fact that she was now in the unattractive body of my sister.

It had been four days since the Shift; while Erin was on the phone trying to get in touch with her family to tell them that we were all safe, I found myself working as a counselor for Allison. I found her crying in my closet; curled up underneath my clothes.

Walking over to her, I knelt down and said, “Ally, what’s wrong?”

“It’s not fair, Ev...Ash.” looking at me, tears in her eyes, Allison said, “Why couldn’t I have gotten your body instead of this one.”

“I guess it was like random or something.” Looking at her, I said, “At least you’re still a girl; Erin and I are dealing with being different genders.”

“I guess that’s true.” Sitting up, Allison said, “It’s just that I worked so hard to make my...old body look good; and it was all for nothing.”

“I wouldn’t say that; you could easily remake Corinne’s body into a more attractive one.”

“I thought you didn’t want anyone insulting your sister’s body?”

“She’s not my sister anymore; and I guess I’m slipping into the role of Ashley a little easier than expected.” Chuckling, I said, “If you could teach me to act like Ashley in three days, I don’t see why you couldn’t improve your new body.”

“I guess you’re right.” Smiling, wiping the tears from her face, Allison said, “Do you mind if I wear some of your clothes; she may be a plain girl but Corinne’s the same size as you.”

“Sure, go right ahead.” Getting up, I said, “I’ll be downstairs with Erin.”

“Don’t do anything funny, you two.”

Walking downstairs a few minutes later, I saw Erin walking out of the kitchen with the phone. Looking at her, I said, “What’s up?”

“Evan...I mean Ash, it’s your father.”

Getting into character, I grabbed the phone and said, “Daddy, is that you?”

“Hi princess, it’s me.” A woman’s voice answered. “I’m glad to see you weren’t affected by this; but as you can see I’ve switched bodies with your mother.”

“Why haven’t you guys called?” surprised by how emotional I was getting, I said, “You really scared me, daddy.”

“I’m sorry, princess; but cell service was just restored by us.” Pausing, Ashley’s dad said, “Are you doing alright?”

“I’m doing fine; I’m here with Allison and Erin.”

“I don’t want you girls going outside unless you have to, okay?”

“Okay daddy, I promise.”

“Good; we’ll try to be home in a few days.”

“Bye daddy.”

As I hung up the phone, a shocked look on her face, Erin turned to me and said, “Wow, you really sounded like Ashley just now.”

“Thanks.” Shrugging, I said, “At least it was good enough to fool her parents.”
1141322212111111.title: A Few Days Later

"So what do you suggest we do about it?"

“I don’t know if I want a relationship with you; but...if you’re okay with it, I would like to at least kiss you to see what it’s like.”

After Allison left with one of my bikinis, I turned to Erin and said, “So, uh, what did you think?”

“It was...nice.” blushing, Erin said, “I can see why Ashley...you are so popular with the boys; you’re a good kisser.”

“Thanks.” Blushing, I said, “If you want; maybe after things settle down we could...have a date?”

“I think I’d like that.” Smiling, Erin said, “Anyway, I’m going to grab one of your dad’s swimsuits; I’ll meet you downstairs.”

I was looking through my dresser a few minutes later when Allison walked in, wearing a nice bikini that showed off Corinne’s figure.
Looking at me, she said, “I have to say, I’m surprised you guys waited as long as you did.”

“What do you mean?” pausing, I said, “It was just a casual kiss between friends.”

114132221211111111.title: Later That Day

1141322212111111111.content:
The next few days proved interesting; as I not only continued to adjust to being Ashley, but also adjusting to having her parents around. Erin and Allison had been okay with my occasional slip up, but I didn’t want to slip up around Ashley’s parents. I also had to get used to calling them ‘my’ parents; because I was now technically their daughter.

Under that guise, I helped my mom teach my dad about how to dress and act like a woman. He was hesitant at first; because he was hoping all this was temporary. After a while we managed to convince him that if it wasn’t permanent, he would have to learn all this anyway.

It was 9:00 in the morning on a Thursday; just over a week since the Shift occurred. I woke up to an alert on my cell phone; looking at it, I saw it was a text with Allison. It read “We’ll be there at 10:00; make sure you’re ready.”

“Just getting up; I’ll start getting ready now.”

Climbing out of bed, I remembered today was the day the local school district was having a meet and greet at all the schools in the district. This way they could re-register everyone that shifted; while allowing them to see their friends. I did not have to re-register of course, but Allison and Erin did.

**********************************


I spent the next 20 minutes in the shower; shaving my legs and all that fun stuff. Ashley always amazing when she was at school; I knew people would know something was wrong if I came to school with hairy legs.

After getting out of the shower, and drying, I walked to my room to get dressed. Having gotten the hang of picking out outfits, I found a nice skirt/top combo that I thought looked nice. Once that was done, I did my hair and makeup and went downstairs with my
purse and shoes in hand.

My parents were awake at that point; both of them in the kitchen having breakfast. As I walked in, I saw my dad wearing what seemed to be one of my mom’s robes as he cooked breakfast on the stove. My mom was sitting at the table drinking coffee and reading a week old newspaper.

I started to wonder if this was how life had been before the Shift; Ashley’s dad cooked while Ashley’s mom sat around. Pushing those thoughts aside, I walked over and kissed my dad on the cheek. “Morning, daddy.”

“Morning princess.” Smiling, dad said, “Where are you going in such a hurry?”

“The school is re-registering everybody; even those that didn’t get shifted.” Grabbing an orange, I said, “Allison and Erin are picking me up in a few minutes.”

“Stay safe out there, honey.” Looking at me, Mom said, “There’s people out there that might try and hurt you.”

“Don’t worry, mom.” Smiling, I said, “I don’t know if you noticed; but Erin’s like really big and strong now, she’ll protect us.”

Just then, I heard the honking of a car horn. After saying good bye, I ran outside.
1141322212111111111.title: A Few Days Later

“That’s what confuses me; why would she be so quick to give up this life?”

“Who knows.” Shrugging, Allison said, “We were friends; but Ashley never really confided in me that much.”

line. I had to struggle to hear but, when she was asked her name, I was shocked to hear her say Ryan Anderson. I stood in line, shocked, as I heard that. “Oh my god; Ryan’s now the sluttiest girl in school?”

I tried my best to ignore it and it was rather easy. The same scene of confusion and panic was everywhere, on everyone's faces. I guess a lot of people had poured out into the hallways, too. I could've asked them what was going on but right now, I was more intent on getting back to Tomlin's class. I'd seen these body switch stories that show up in everything, so if I was in Nia's body, then she must've been in mine! I figured it would've been a good idea to try and sort things out.

Walking back to the camera, I turned it off and wondered what to do next. I quickly realized the best thing for me to do was to get the report back to the station as soon as possible.

12311.content:
The 15-minute drive to the station was difficult enough with the burning cars and screaming people; it was made even more so by the fact that I’d never driven before, let alone in heels. When I finally reached the station, I parked the car and made my way to the front door.

I’d no sooner stepped inside when I was greeted by who I thought was Dominic Greene, the morning traffic reporter. “I’m so glad to see you, Elaine.” Grabbing my arm, he said, “I’ve got no reporters, and both my anchors are nowhere to be seen.”

I quickly realized that the person in front of me wasn’t Dominic. Pulling my arm free, I stopped in a hallway and said, “I-I’m sorry, but who are you?”

“Oh right, sorry.” Looking at me, he said, “It’s me, Paul Donahue.”

I knew who Paul was from a field trip I’d taken here in 6th grade; he was a producer here. The body he found himself in was an improvement over the last time I’d seen him. Looking at him, I said, “I-I can’t believe that’s you, Paul.”

“Hard to believe, isn’t it.” Spotting the tape in my hand, he said, “What’s that?”

Handing him the tape, I said, “It’s a report I made from Town Hall, about the events going on in the city.”

“You’re the best Elaine.” Heading down the hall, he said, “Follow me; you can watch it from the Control Room.”

I quietly followed Paul down the hall, wondering if I’d gotten myself in over my head. My feet killing me from the heels, I sat down as Paul told one of the techs to air the report. I watched as the report I’d made at Town Hall was broadcast; somewhat unsettled by the idea that it was me controlling Elaine’s body.
12311.title: At The Station

123111.content:
Once the report finished airing, Paul walked out of the control room and down the hall. Sensing an opportunity to come clean, I followed after him. The ‘click’ of my heels on the floor served as a reminder of the situation I was currently in.

I managed to catch up to Paul outside of what I suspected was his office. “Paul, there’s something important that I need to tell you.”
Looking up from his computer, Paul said, “What is it, Elaine?”

Walking into the office, I sat down in one of the chairs. “This may…”

Before I could finish my sentence, I was interrupted by Paul’s ringing cell phone. Paul quickly stepped into the hallway; although I could still see him in the window. With a moment to myself, I started thinking about everything that happened. While my situation was far from unique, I was under no illusions that there weren’t people who had it worse than me.

I found myself thinking about my family when Paul walked back into the room with a smile on his face. “That was the parent network.” Looking at me, he said, “They saw your report and want you at the studio in New York to report nationally.”

“What?” shocked, I said, “Why me?”

“It seems that whatever this is affected most of the planet.” Looking at me, he said, “After they saw your report, they realized they needed someone like you to keep people calm.”

Before I realized what I was doing, I said, “When do we leave?”
123111.title: A Surprising Phone Call

1232.content:
The last thing I remembered, before blacking out, was being in Mr. Tomlin’s geometry lecture. So you can imagine my surprise when I regained consciousness and found myself on the floor of a bathroom.

As I regained my senses, I could hear screaming in the distance along with what I could only imagine were explosions. Sitting up, I realized I felt strange. Looking down, I quickly realized why – I was wearing an elegant purple dress and heels. What the hell?

In an attempt to figure out what was going on, I decided to look in the mirror over the nearby sink. Reaching up, I grabbed the sink and started to pull myself up. I quickly got to my feet, but I wasn’t used to standing in heels. Using the sink for support, I stood up and got my first look at my new body.

Whatever had caused me to blackout had put me inside the body of Elaine Sato; a well-known reporter for the local news. Bringing a hand up to my face, I tried to convince myself that I was dreaming, but that became difficult when I saw the reflection copying my every move. I was overcome with shock when I looked down and saw a modest amount of cleavage poking through the dress I was now wearing. “This can’t be possible.”

Before I could dwell on that, I was interrupted by the sounds of more screams outside the bathroom. I quickly decided to see if I could help anyone. I took my first, unsteady, steps in heels as I walked to the door. Thankful that I didn’t fall, I opened the door to find the area in chaos.
1232.title: Thread Reboot

12321.content:
There were people screaming all over the place; outside a nearby window, I saw smoke from several car fires. As I looked around the room, I quickly realized where I was – I was at Town Hall.

Feeling an overwhelming urge to help, I made my way outside. Once I was outside, standing on the steps of Town Hall, I looked around at the chaos before me. People were running all over the place; many of them calling out for help or searching for loved ones.

As I made my way towards the parking lot, I spotted a station car that I assumed Elaine and her crew had arrived in. Moving closer, I saw that a camera was set up, but there was no one around. I made a decision to take the car and go home, but I was stopped by a young pregnant woman who came running up to me.

“Please, you’ve to help me.” Panicking, the woman said, “My wife ended up in my body; she’s got a real nasty cut on her leg.”

My sense of self-preservation was quickly overtaken by an urge to help. “Okay, take me to her.”

I quickly followed the woman around a nearby corner, where I found a man leaning against the wall with a large cut on his leg. Walking over to him, I said, “Can you hear me, ma’am?”

“Yes.” Wincing, the man said, “Can you help me?”

I’d taken a few First Aid courses over the summer, in the hopes of getting a job as a lifeguard. Looking at the pregnant woman, I said, “Go find something I can use as a tourniquet.”

As the woman ran off, I turned my attention to the man. It wasn’t long before she came back with what looked like a towel. Before I could do anything, a young boy came running up to us. “I’m a doctor, I can help.”

I quickly stepped aside to let the doctor work. Looking around, I spotted the pregnant woman standing nearby; crying hysterically. Walking over to her, I said, “What’s your name?”

“Ll-Lloyd...Lloyd Simmons.”

“It’s nice to meet you, Lloyd, I’m Elaine.” Looking at Lloyd, I said, “Are you alright?”

“Of course I’m not alright!” in shock, Lloyd said, “I was taking wife my to her OB appointment when everything went dark; I wake up and find that I’m in her body!”

“Everything’s going to be alright, Lloyd.” Trying to calm him down, I said, “That boy over there is a doctor; he’s going to sure your wife’s injuries aren’t too severe.”

“Sh-She can’t die.” Looking at me, Lloyd said, “I-I can’t be a single mother.”

“She’s not going to die, Lloyd.”

It took a few more minutes, but the doctor managed to get Lloyd’s wife stabilized. Getting her into the back of a nearby car, with Lloyd climbing in with her, he got some bystanders to take them to the hospital. The doctor ran off before I could thank him for his help; leaving me alone in the parking lot.

It was only then that I was finally able to process what happened to me; I’d gone from being a 15-year-old sophomore to a woman in her early 30s. As I looked around at the chaos, I realized I needed to do something.
12321.title: Walking into Chaos

123211.content:
I don’t know what possessed me to do so, but I suddenly felt the need to report what I was seeing.

Walking back to the news car, I managed to turn on the camera. Once I was sure it was working, I hit record and walked in front of the camera. “Hello, this is Elaine Sato; reporting for Channel 7 News.” Pausing, I said, “I’m here at Town Hall, as citizens all over town have somehow swapped bodies.”

I couldn’t tell you why I did it, but that was the second time in 5 minutes that I’d used Elaine’s name instead of my own. As the chaos continued around me, I recounted the events that I’d seen up until now. As I finished up the report, I said, “I encourage everyone to find a safe place to stay until further notice.”

Walking back to the camera, I turned it off and wondered what to do next. I quickly realized the best thing for me to do was to get the report back to the station as soon as possible.

**********************************


The 15-minute drive to the station was difficult enough with the burning cars and screaming people; it was made even more so by the fact that I’d never driven before, let alone in heels. When I finally reached the station, I parked the car and made my way to the front door.

I’d no sooner stepped inside when I was greeted by who I thought was Dominic Greene, the morning traffic reporter. “I’m so glad to see you, Elaine.” Grabbing my arm, he said, “I’ve got no reporters, and both my anchors are nowhere to be seen.”

I quickly realized that the person in front of me wasn’t Dominic. Pulling my arm free, I stopped in a hallway and said, “I-I’m sorry, but who are you?”

“Oh right, sorry.” Looking at me, he said, “It’s me, Paul Donahue.”

I knew who Paul was from a field trip I’d taken here in 6th grade; he was a producer here. The body he found himself in was an improvement over the last time I’d seen him. Looking at him, I said, “I-I can’t believe that’s you, Paul.”

“I can’t believe it myself, but here we are.” Looking at me, he said, “I guess you got lucky.”

I wanted to tell him the truth; but instead, I said, “I made this report from Town Hall, about the events transpiring around town.”

“You’re the best Elaine.” Taking the tape, he said, “Follow me; you can watch it from the Control Room.”

I quietly followed Paul down the hall, wondering if I’d gotten myself in over my head. My feet killing me from the heels, I sat down as Paul told one of the techs to air the report. I watched as the report I’d made at Town Hall was broadcast; somewhat unsettled by the idea that it was me controlling Elaine’s body.
123211.title: Report the News

1232111.content:
After watching the report air, I finally decided to it was time to come clean with Paul. Walking over to him, I said, “Paul, there’s something I need to tell you.”

With concern in his eyes, Paul said, “What is it, Elaine?”

Before I could answer, I heard a phone ring nearby. The technician answered it and quickly turned to Paul. “Paul, it’s the station manager; he wants to talk with you.”

I watched as Paul took the phone and had what appeared to be an exciting conversation. It was then that the stress of the situation became too much; I started to feel nauseous. Running out of the control room, I quickly found the bathroom and ran inside. I barely made it to the toilet before I threw up.

After sitting there for a moment, catching my breath, I got up and walked over to the sink. Looking at my reflection in the mirror, I thought about what happened to me. In the last hour, I’d gone from being a 15-year-old High School Sophomore to a reporter in her early 30s. I began to wonder how many others found themselves in similar situations; or if there were those in worse situations.

I started thinking about my family and whether they were safe or not. In all the chaos out there, I didn’t even know how to begin to find them. Before I could dwell on that too much, there was a knock at the door. Walking over to the door, I opened it and found the control room technician standing there. “Can I help you?”

“Paul needs to see you in his office.” Pausing, he said, “Something’s come up.”

I made my way down the hall to Paul’s office; intent on coming clean about who I really was. But once again I was interrupted.
As soon as I walked into the room, Paul said, “Elaine, that was the Station Manager.” Looking at me, he said, “A helicopter is on its way here; to bring you to the Capital.”

“The Capital?” confused, I said, “Why?”

“The Governor is going to hold a news conference in an hour.” Pausing, Paul said, “All three local stations are sending reporters, and the Manager wants to send you.”
1232111.title: Continue

12321111.content:
I sat down in a chair in shock; thinking I’d gone too far with this. Looking at Paul, I said, “Paul, I-I can’t...”

“It’s okay, Elaine; you’ll do great.” Placing a hand on my shoulder, he said, “Just try and relax.”

“No, it’s not that.” Sighing, I said, “I’m not Elaine, my name’s Evan; I’m a sophomore in High School.”

Paul looked at me in stunned silence for a moment. “Wow, I never would have guessed that if you hadn’t said anything.” Pausing, he said, “That report you did was classic Elaine.”

“I’m sorry for not telling you sooner, but I guess I was just overwhelmed.” Getting up, I said, “I suppose, now that you know, you’ll want me to leave.”

“I think you should stay.” Getting up, Paul blocked my path to the door. “For whatever reason, you’re now Elaine Sato. We can sort this all out later; but right now, we need her out there keeping people calm.”

Sitting back down in the chair, I thought about the crazy situation I found myself in. Looking up at Paul, I said...
12321111.title: Coming Clean

123211111.content:
“Someone has to report on this...whatever it is.” Sighing, I said, “I guess I don’t have much of a choice.”

“You’re doing the right thing, Elaine.”

Looking at Phil, raising an eyebrow, I said, “Please don’t call me that, I’m not Elaine.”

“The public needs you to be Elaine Cho.”

I felt overwhelmed by the gravity of the situation I now found myself in. If I went along with this, I’d not only be reporting on what was going; I’d also be pretending that I was the real Elaine. Looking at Phil, I said, “I guess I don’t have much of choice, do I?”

“A helicopter will be here shortly to fly us to the Capital.”
123211111.title: I'll Do It

123212.content:
The last thing I remembered, before blacking out, was being in Mr. Tomlin’s geometry lecture. So you can imagine my surprise when I regained consciousness and found myself on the floor of a bathroom.

As I regained my senses, I became aware of screaming in the distance. Sitting up, I realized that I felt strange. Now I’d never worn woman’s clothes before, so you can understand that I was a little shocked to see myself suddenly wearing a skirt and heels. What the hell is going on here?

Looking around at my surroundings, I noticed that I wasn’t in any bathroom I’d ever seen before. Seeing a sink nearby, I decided it was probably best to look at see what was going on. It took some effort, but I managed to stand up and face the mirror. I was understandably shocked by what I saw in front of me.

Whatever had caused me to blackout had somehow caused me to swap bodies with Elaine Sato, a local morning news anchor. Bringing a hand up to my face, I tried to convince myself that I was dreaming, but that became difficult when I saw the reflection copying my every move. A quick glance downward revealed a pair of breasts showing the top of the dress I found myself wearing. “This can’t be possible.”

Suddenly I was interrupted by someone knocking on the door. Before I could reach over and open it, a young woman came into the room. Seeing me, she said, “Thank god you’re alright Elaine.” Looking at me, she said, “Diane and Keith are nowhere to be found, I need you to take over as anchor.”

I was in too much shock to argue; otherwise, I probably would have said no. Looking at the woman, I said...
123212.title: Reboot

1232121.content:
If I’d had the time to think about my options, I probably would have said no. Unfortunately, the woman was in a hurry. “Okay, I’ll take over.”

“That’s great.” Looking at me, she said, “Take a few minutes to freshen up; then meet me in the studio.”

Once I was alone again, I realized what I’d just gotten myself into. I was about to go on TV pretending to be Elaine Sato. After splashing some cold water on my face, I left the bathroom; not noticing the discarded pregnancy test lying on the floor by the sink.

Walking out into the hallway, I was confronted by chaos – as people were running around in a panic, many of them screaming that they weren’t in their own bodies anymore. I eventually found my way to the studio; where I saw the woman standing by a camera with a pair of headphones on her head.

Walking up to her, I said, “I’m here, what do you need me to do?”

“Just have a seat behind the desk.” Looking at me, she said, “I’ll have someone come over and fix your makeup before you go on the air.”

As I wondered what I was getting myself into, I looked at the woman and said, “Who are you anyway?”

“Right, I probably should have told you.” Looking at me, she said, “As weird as it sounds, I’m Phil Donovan.”

I knew who Phil Donovan was from a field trip I’d taken here in 7th Grade; he was one of the station’s producers. Looking at him, I said, “Phil? Is that really you?”

“Yeah, it’s me.” Pausing, Phil said, “I ended up in the body of Grace Swanson, that intern from accounting.”

“If you’re in Grace’s body, then where’s yours?”

“I’d rather not think about that right now.” Losing all color, Phil said, “I was driving into work when I blacked out.”

It didn’t take a genius to figure out what Phil meant. As I walked over to the news desk; I hoped that Grace, whoever she is, was alright.
1232121.title: I'll Do It

12321211.content:
I sat behind the desk for a few minutes until a young man came walking over to me. As he got closer, I saw he was wearing a Pizza Hut uniform; and looked to be no more than 18 years old. Judging from how he walked, I assumed that he had formerly been a woman.

I assumptions were proven correct when he said, “Hey Elaine; it’s me, Heather.”

I had no idea who Heather was, but I didn’t want to be rude. Looking at her, I said, “Hey Heather, how are you?”

“I’m doing well, all things considered.” Touching up my eyeliner, Heather said, “You should consider yourself lucky that you got to keep your body.”

If only you knew.

After Heather finished up with my makeup, she handed me a mirror to see the finished product. I was surprised to admit that I made an attractive woman. Looking at her, I said, “You’re a miracle worker, Heather.”

Phil walked over just as Heather was leaving. “I’ve just received word that Channel 3 & Channel 5 lost their broadcasting capability a short time ago.” Looking at me, he said, “That means the entire region is going to be looking to you for information on this event.”

“So there’s no pressure then.” Looking at Phil, I said, “I hope I can do this.”

“You’ll do fine, Elaine.”

After making sure that my earpiece was working, Phil walked over to the cameras. Looking at me, he counted down from five with his fingers. As I saw him get closer to one, I wondered if I could do this. Everyone here thought that I was the real Elaine Sato.

All my fear and anxiety vanished when Phil reached one. Turning towards the camera, as if I’d done this many times before, I said, “Hello, this is Elaine Sato reporting for Channel 7 News.” Pausing to look at the teleprompter, I said, “As you’re all no doubt aware, an unusual event has occurred in the area; causing people to suddenly find themselves in another person’s body.”

Over my earpiece, I could hear Phil said, “You’re doing great, Elaine.”

A faint smile formed on my lips as I continued speaking. “What you may not be aware of is that this is not a localized event; we’ve received reports that whatever this was has affected the entire planet.” Taking a breath, I said, “As a safety precaution, the police are suggesting that you stay where you are. If you’re outside, please find a safe place indoors. We’ll give you more information as we receive it. Once again, this is Elaine Sato reporting for Channel 7 News.”

Once Phil said to go to commercial, he walked over to me and said, “You did great, Elaine; I knew you could do it.”

“That makes one of us.” Taking the microphone off my dress, I said, “I’ve never been so nervous in all my life.”

“Why don’t you take a few minutes to calm down.” Looking at me, Phil said, “That report will broadcast on a loop until we have something new to report.”

“That’s a good idea.” Standing up, I said, “I’m going to go outside and catch my breath.”

“Be careful; there might be looters running around.”
12321211.title: Reporting As Elaine

123212111.content:
Once I found my way to an exit, I walked outside to find the area in total disarray. The streets surrounding the station were littered with crashed and overturned vehicles. I could hear people screaming all around me. It was then, for the first time since this started, that I became concerned for my family. Oh God, I hope they’re alright.”

As I stood outside the building, I heard someone approaching. Turning in the direction of the noise, I saw a young woman around 19 years old. I didn’t know her, but she seemed to know me. “Elaine! Is that you?”

I wanted to say no, but something compelled me not to. Looking at her, as she got closer, I said, “Yeah, it’s me.”

“Oh thank God!” running up to me, the girl wrapped her arms around me and hugged me. “The last thing I remember, I was talking to Phil in his office; when suddenly I black out and find myself on the floor of a Starbucks in this girl’s body.”

Putting two and two together, I looked at the girl and said, “Diane? Is that you?”

“Yeah, it’s me.”

Diane Griffin was the co-anchor of the morning news; she was in her late 30s. It seemed she’d gotten an upgrade when she switched bodies. Looking at her, I said, “Thank god you’re here; Phil was worried when he couldn’t find you or Keith.”

“I can only imagine; it’s pretty crazy out there. It’s a miracle I made it back here in one piece.” Digging through her purse, or rather the Starbucks girl’s purse, she said, “Has Keith made it back yet?”

“No, I don’t think so.”

“I can’t only hope that he ended up switching with one of those young, 20-something bimbos that always seem to hang around him.” Looking at me, Diane said, “That lecher deserves to be taken down a peg.”

I could only watch as Diane kept rummaging through the purse; thankful that she seemed too preoccupied to notice my surprise. I’d never really followed the news very closely, but I remembered I always had Keith and Diane’s morning news show on before she left for work. Keith and Diane had been known as the town’s sweethearts for years; to hear her talking about him that way was surprising.

“You won’t believe what this girl was doing before the swap, Elaine.” Diane continued digging through the purse and until she found what she was looking for. “Ah! Here it is!”

It took me a moment to figure out exactly what I was looking at, but I soon figured it out. “A pregnancy test?”

“Yes!” pointing to a small window, she said, “Look what it says.”

Looking closer, I realized what the marks meant. “It’s positive?”

“Can you believe it?” smiling, clearly excited about the news, Diane said, “I never thought I’d get a chance to have kids after...well, you know.”

I didn’t know what she was talking about, but I decided to play the part of an understanding friend. Looking at her, I said, “I’m so happy for you.”

“So what did yours say?”

“Mine?” getting confused, I said, “What do you mean?”

“You told me this morning you were going to take one.” Looking at me, she said, “What did it say?”

I started to panic on the inside as I realized what Diane was talking about. “You know it’s been such a crazy day, I haven’t had a chance to do it yet.” Looking at her, I said, “I was about to take it when Phil came in and told me he needed me to anchor.”

“Was Phil affected by this?”

“Yeah, he ended up in the body of one of the interns.” Looking at her, I said, “That petite girl, Grace Swanson, from accounting.”

“Old Phil in Grace’s body; that’s too funny.” Pausing, Diane said, “Come find me after you take the test. It’d be awesome if we could both be pregnant at the same time.”

“I’ll find you when it’s done.” Trying to control myself, I said, “Why don’t you go check in with Phil; I’m sure he’ll be happy to know you’re alright.”

Diane and I walked into the station together; while she went off to find Phil, I made a beeline back to the bathroom where this had all started.

Reaching the bathroom, I looked around for the pregnancy test I hoped that I wouldn’t find. I felt a lump in my throat when I found it against the wall by the sink. Kneeling down to grab it, I turned it over to look at the results.

I immediately felt an overwhelming wave of nausea when I saw what the results were – Pregnant. Making my way into the nearest stall, I barely made it over the toilet before I threw up. As if it wasn’t bad enough that I’d ended up in the body of an older woman, to top it all off, I was now pregnant.
123212111.title: Outside

1232121111.content:
I sat on the floor of the bathroom stall for what felt like an eternity; trying to come to grips with everything that had happened to me. I’d gone from being a 15-year-old boy to a pregnant 32-year-old woman in a matter of hours.

After sitting there for a few more minutes, I decided the best thing for me to do was to get up and move. As I stood up in the stall I realized I was getting better at standing in heels; the thought of which scared me.

Once I’d composed myself, I walked out of the bathroom. Hearing voices coming from the control room, I decided to head there. Walking into the room, I saw Diane sitting at one of the consoles in the back. Spotting me, she got up and ran over. “So what did the test say?”

“I-I’m pregnant.”

“That’s great!” hugging me, Diane said, “We can help each other out!”

Before I could say anything, Phil walked into the room. Seeing me, he said, “There you are, Elaine; we need you to go back on the air.” Handing me some papers, he said, “The Governor just announced a mandatory curfew.”

Grateful for something to take my mind off the pregnancy test, I took the papers and said, “Great, I-I’ll be on there in a minute.”

“Are you okay?” looking at me, Phil said, “You don’t look too good.”

Oh you have no idea. “Yeah, I’m fine.”

“Are you sure? I can have Diane take over for you.”

“No, it’s fine; I can do it.”

With the paperwork in hand, I walked through the door leading to the newsroom. As I walked behind the desk, I heard Phil said, “We’re going live in 5…4…3…2…1.”

As soon as Phil said 1, I turned to the camera and said, “This is Elaine Sato for Channel 7 News.” Pausing, I said, “The Governor has just announced a mandatory curfew; set to take effect at 4:30 PM. Local police ask that if you can’t make it home, that you make your way to the library or police station; where they’ve set up emergency shelters.”

*******************************


It had been 20 minutes since I’d finished the broadcast; I was sitting at what I’d earlier discovered to be Elaine’s desk. Having found her cell phone, I was frantically trying to get a hold of my mom and sister. Unfortunately, I couldn’t get a call out; figuring the cell towers must be down.

I threw the phone on the desk in frustration as Diane walked into the room. Pulling up a chair, she sat down and said, “So Phil just said the police want to evacuate the area.” Looking at me, she said, “He managed to get us some police escorts to take us home.”

“That sounds really good right about now.” Chuckling, I said, "Especially if it's true about the rioting and the looting."

“Phil’s staying with me; if you want to join us.” Chuckling, Diane said, “We could have a girl’s night.”

“As much fun as that sounds, I’d think I’d rather go to my place.”

“I can understand that.” Getting up, Diane hugged me and said, “Please stay safe; remember, you’re responsible for two lives now.”

Hugging Diane, I said, “Same goes for you.”

After Diane left, I grabbed my...Elaine’s purse and phone from the desk and walked out of the room. As I walked down the hall, I thought about how strange my day had been; and how it was likely to get even stranger.
1232121111.title: Continue

12321211111.content:
During the 15 minute ride to Elaine’s condo, I spent the time looking out the window. The more I saw, the more grateful I was for the police escort. There were people fighting and looting all over the place; I could only imagine what they would do to me if they got a hold of me.

I was pulled back from my revere by the officer, a young man in his mid-20s. Looking at me, he said, “You must consider yourself pretty lucky, ma’am; getting to keep your own body.”

I wanted to say that I had switched bodies, that everyone at the station was too focused on what was happening to realize I wasn’t Elaine. But I didn’t. Looking at him, I said, “I guess you could say that.” Pausing, I said, “How about you?”

“I wasn’t so lucky.” Swerving to avoid a car fire, the officer said, “I was going to retire next week, after 25 years on the force. Now I’m suddenly in the body of a rookie who started only 3 months ago.”
“I can’t imagine how that must feel.”
