The officer and I talked for a few minutes until we arrived outside Lake Crest Condominiums. I’d gone by the complex a few times, but I never anticipated that I’d end up living here. Parking the car in front of the building, the officer said, “Do you need an escort, ma’am?”

“No, I’ll be fine.” Grabbing Elaine’s purse, I said, “Thank you for the ride.”

Looking at me, he said, “My pleasure, ma’am.”

As I walked towards the building’s entrance, I dug through the purse until I found Elaine’s keys. Using the keycard on the ring, I let myself into the building. I’d learned from Elaine’s license that she lived in #304; so I decided to go there.

Not wanting to risk getting stuck in an elevator if the power went out, I decided to use the stairs. By now I was getting pretty good at walking in heels, but I was looking forward to when I could finally take them off.

I soon found myself outside Elaine’s place. After fumbling for the right key, I was able to let myself inside. After closing the door, I quickly removed the heels and kicked them aside. Taking my first steps without heels, I let out a sigh of relief. “Why do women wear these things? My feet are killing me.”

I looked around as I walked further into the condo. The more I looked, the more I realized that Elaine had expensive tastes; as was made evident but what looked to be an expensive bottle of wine sitting in a wine cooler on the counter.

I was tempted to pour myself a glass; when I remembered I was pregnant now. “Just great, my first chance to drink some wine and I’m pregnant.”

Continuing further into the condo, I found myself in the living room. Looking for a chance to get off my feet, I sat down on the couch. I’d no sooner sat down when I started to feel tired; the stress of the day’s events finally catching up to me. Resting my head on the pillow, I was asleep in moments.
12321211111.title: Arriving at Elaine's Place

123212111111.content:
I don’t know how long I was asleep, but it was dark outside when I woke up. As I sat up on the couch, I wondered why I was in a strange apartment and why there was a hair in my eyes. Getting up to look around, I felt a weight on my chest. Looking down, I saw a pair of breasts underneath a dress; causing my memories of the day’s events to come back.

Walking out onto an enclosed porch, I looked around and saw chaos everywhere. There looked to be several large fires nearby; I could also hear screaming and what sounded like gunshots in the distance. Despite finding myself in the body of an older woman, I was grateful to be in a safe location rather than outside in the chaos.

Walking back into the family room, I decided that it would be a good idea to change into something a little less feminine than the dress I was wearing. I quickly found the bedroom and made my way to the closet. Opening the closet, I was disappointed to find it held nothing but dresses and skirts. Please tell me there’s something else for me to wear.

Turning my attention to the dresser, I was relieved to find a pair of flannel pajama pants. After grabbing a t-shirt to wear, I made my way to the adjoining bathroom. Looking in the mirror, I was keenly aware that I was about to see a woman’s naked body; I just would’ve preferred not being in the body in question.

Once I’d taken the dress off, I decided there was no harm in looking at the mirror. Turning to face the mirror, I was immediately confronted with the naked body of Elaine Sato. I thought she was attractive the few times I saw her on TV, I just never figured I’d get such an up-close and personal look.

I examined my new body for a few minutes; deciding that it was best to stay away from the waist area. Once I’d had enough, I put the sweat pants and t-shirt on. With that accomplished, I walked out of the bathroom. It was only then that I realized I was starving; I hadn’t eaten anything since this all started.

Walking into the kitchen, I scrounged through the fridge to find something to eat. After finding an almost empty box of frozen burgers in the freezer, I decided to finish off the box.

It took 20 minutes to cook the burgers, as well as some fries. Once I was finished, I took the food back into the living room. Sitting down at the couch, I turned the TV in the vain hope there was something on TV. Having seen the conditions outside, I wasn’t surprised to find nothing to watch.

Turning off the TV, I said, “Guess I’ll just sit and eat in silence.”
123212111111.title: Waking Up

1232121111111.content:
I woke up in the bedroom the next morning; after enduring a restless night. Having never had to sleep with breasts until last night, I couldn’t find a comfortable position to sleep in that didn’t squish them.

Getting out of bed, I walked over to the window and looked outside. The fires I’d seen last night were gone, although I could still see some smoke coming from where they’d been. Feeling the sudden urge to use the bathroom, I made my way to the bathroom. As I sat down on the toilet, I realized I had no idea how to pee in a woman’s body. After sitting there for a moment, I simply relaxed and felt myself start to urinate.

Having accomplished that, I walked out to the kitchen to make some breakfast.

**********************


I was sitting at the counter, eating some eggs when I suddenly started to feel nauseous. Putting the plate down, I ran to the bathroom. Let me tell you, seeing eggs come back up is almost enough to make me swear them off for good.

The vomiting finally stopped after about 10 minutes. I was washing my hands and face when I heard a knock at the door. As I made my way to the door, I heard a man’s voice said, “Elaine, are you in there?”

Standing at the door, I looked through the peephole and saw a younger man standing there. He looked to be in pretty good shape; much better than I’d been before this. “Who’s there?”

“It’s Gloria Palmer from down the hall.”

I had no way of knowing if the man was telling the truth. But something compelled me to open the door. Looking at her, I said, “Gloria, what happened to you?”

“The same thing that happened to most everyone else.” Looking at me, she said, “I was grocery shopping when suddenly I blacked out; when I came too, I was on the floor of the men’s shower at the gym.”

I quickly realized Gloria had a more traumatic experience then I’d had. That’s not to say waking up in a woman’s body wasn’t traumatic, but she woke up in a naked man’s body. “You look like you’ve been running. Are you alright?”

“I and a few others spent the night at the gym.” Pausing, Gloria said, “Once the sun came up, I realized I was only a few miles away so I decided to make my way back here. I was hoping you still had a copy of my keys; since mine are with my other body.”

I honestly had no idea whether Gloria’s keys were here or not. Stepping aside, I said, “I think they’re here somewhere, why don’t you come in and look.”

Walking into the apartment, she said, “Thank you, Elaine.”

Closing the door, I followed Gloria into the kitchen. “I was just finishing breakfast; I think there are still some eggs left over if you want some.”

Suddenly Gloria looked at me with suspicion. Walking over to me, she said, “So, Elaine, do you remember last month when I introduced you to my nephew Robert?”

I started to feel a little nervous; wondering if Gloria had figured out that I wasn’t really Elaine. “Of course I do.”

“You’re not really Elaine, are you.” Looking at me, she said, “Who are you?”

“What are you talking about? Of course, I’m Elaine.”

“If you were really Elaine, you’d know that last month I introduced you to my niece Samantha.”

“Okay fine, you’re right.” Sighing, I said, “I’m not Elaine; my name’s Evan.”

“Well Evan, do you mind explaining why you’re in Elaine’s condo pretending to be her?”

Realizing that I’d been caught, I proceeded to spill the beans. I told Gloria everything; from waking up in Elaine’s body at the station to reporting on the air in her body. When I was finished, I said, “How did you know I wasn’t the real Elaine?”

“You mentioned having eggs for breakfast.” Looking at me, Gloria said, “Elaine is allergic to eggs.”

“I guess that explains the bout of nausea I had before you showed up.” Pausing, I said, “I just figured it was a side effect of being pregnant.”
1232121111111.title: Caught Red Handed

12321211111111.content:
I sat on the couch as Gloria helped herself to the rest of the eggs I’d made. Once she was finished, she walked over and sat next to me. Looking at me, she said, “Let me get this straight; no one at the station realized you weren’t the real Elaine?”

“Not a single one; they all thought I was really her.” Sighing, I said, “I figured they were too caught up with everything to realize I wasn’t her.”

“This must be quite a shock for you.” Pausing, Gloria said, “When you woke up yesterday, I bet you didn’t imagine something like this would happen.”

“I can’t say the idea ever crossed my mind.”

“You mentioned earlier that you thought the nausea was from the pregnancy.” Looking at me, with concern, Gloria said, “Are you...rather is Elaine pregnant?”

“Yeah, she’s pregnant.” Taking a deep breath, still having a hard time accepting it, I said, “I-I found a pregnancy test on the bathroom floor; the real Elaine must’ve dropped it when she blacked out. I found it and saw that it said PREGNANT.”

The fear I was feeling must’ve shown on my face; because Gloria quickly reached over and hugged me. “Oh honey, it’ll be alright.” Looking at me, she said, “I’m sure things will be back to normal soon.”

Looking at Gloria, fighting back tears, I said, “You think so?”

I’d been a woman for barely a day and I was already becoming an emotional wreck. Taking my hand, she said, “I’m sure there’s some scientist out there trying to reverse this. I’m sure we’ll all be back in our rightful bodies soon.”

“What am I supposed to do in the meantime?” looking at her, I said, “I don’t know the first thing about being a woman.”

“I’ll help you with that.”

We hugged for a few more seconds before slowly pulling back. Wiping my tears, I was about to thank her when there was a knock at the door. Looking at Gloria, confused, I said, “I wonder who that could be.”

With Gloria following behind me, I walked to the door and looked through the peephole – seeing the cop from last night standing there. “Ms. Sato, are you there?”

Opening the door, I looked at the officer and said, “What can I do for you, officer?”

“I was asked to bring you back to the station, ma’am.” Pausing, he said, “I believe they want you to go on the air again.”
12321211111111.title: Chatting with Gloria

123212111111111.content:
The trip back to the station wasn't quite as horrific as the trip to Elaine's home, but it had its own horrors. Overturned cars and burned-out buildings were everywhere. "It looks like a war zone half an hour after peace was declared," I said. "But at least the rioting has let up."

"Yeah," the officer said. "The official story from headquarters is that most people have gotten the panic out of their systems, and now it's time to figure out how to deal with whatever's happened. Unofficially, they give a lot of the credit to you. People could see you were scared, but you were trying to hold it together."

******************************


When I got to the station, the director from last night was still there. He must have slept in some quiet corner in the building. "Glad you're back, Elaine," he said. "We've got some information on the Great Shift."

"They know what caused it?"

"Okay, maybe not that much information. But we've got a scientist who can tell us how widespread it is, and that's more than the competition has."

From behind the director came a girl of about 16 or 17. Her hair was shaved in back and on the sides, and dyed pink on top. Her face was full of piercings. "Ms. Sato," she said, offering a hand, "I'm Dr. Jason Boller. I know that sounds hard to believe."

"Not after yesterday," I replied, shaking the doctor's hand. "Believe me, any light you can shed on this will be a big help."

"I never gave a TV interview before, and, under these circumstances,... "

"Just think of the camera as a colleague who you want to impress."

She shrugged. "You're the professional."

You have no idea, I thought.
123212111111111.title: Continue

123212111111112.content:
Trying my best of not freak out, I turned to the Officer and said,
“Thank you, Officer...”

“Office Kirkland, ma’am.”

“Officer Kirkland.” With a fake smile, I said, “Can you give me 20 minutes or for me to get ready?”

“Of course, ma’am.” Nodding, Officer Kirkland said, “I’ll be downstairs waiting.”

Once he was out of earshot, Gloria turned to me and said, “You really aren’t a woman, are you.” With a smirk, she said, “It’s going to take you more than 20 minutes to get ready.”

“Why?” confused, I said, “What exactly do I need to do?”

“You need to take a shower, get dressed, as well as do your hair and makeup.”

Starting to panic, I said, “But I don’t know how to do my hair and makeup.”

“Just go take a shower, sweetie, I’ll help you with the rest.”

*******************************


Showering in Elaine’s body was an unreal experience. If this was ever reversed, I hoped she wouldn’t be upset about me seeing her body naked. Once I was finished in the shower, I dried myself off and went into the bedroom.

It was there that I found a red dress lying on the bed. Seeing that, I yelled out, “Gloria!”

Running into the room, Gloria said, “What’s wrong?”

“I’m not wearing that.” Pointing to the dress, I said, “Doesn’t Elaine have something less feminine to choose from?”

“I’m sorry Evan, but I’m afraid she doesn’t.” walking over to me, Gloria said, “Elaine was a very feminine woman; I rarely saw her wearing something that wasn’t a dress.”

“I can’t believe this is happening.” Sighing, I said, “Of all the people to switch with, why did it have to be Elaine.”

“You can complain about this later.” Picking up the dress, Gloria handed it to me and said, “Right now, we need to get you ready.”

As I took the dress, I looked at Gloria and said, “Why are you helping me?”

“What do you mean?”

“We barely know each other.” Pausing, I said, “Why are you going out of your way to help me.”

Without saying a word, Gloria grabbed a framed photo from the dresser and handed it to me. Looking at it, I realized it was a photo of Elaine and her parents. Judging from the photo, I figured it was Elaine’s college graduation. Looking at me, Gloria said, “Elaine’s parents died in a fire 4 years ago, barely a month after that photo was taken.” Pausing, she said, “I know what it’s like to deal with the loss of one’s parents, especially at that young age. I helped her through it and we became a sort of surrogate family.”

“So you’re helping me because I’m in Elaine’s body?”

“In a way, yes.” Looking at me, Gloria said, “Mostly it’s because you’re also dealing with a life-altering change.”

I started to tear up a little when I heard that. Looking at her, I said,
“What about you?” wiping tears from my eyes, I said, “You’re now in the body of a man whose young enough to be your son.”

“Just how old do you think I am, Evan?” feigning insult, Gloria said,
“I’m only 43 years old, or at least I was.”

I leaned forward and gave Gloria a hug. Looking at her, I said,
“Thank you.”

“You’re welcome, sweetie.” Smiling, Gloria said, “Now go get dressed, it’s been 10 minutes and we still have to do your hair and makeup.”
123212111111112.title: Getting ready

1232121111111121.content:
As it turned out, my guess of 20 minutes wasn’t even close. By the time Gloria had finished getting me ready, it had been almost 40 minutes since Officer Kirkland had arrived. I was standing in front of the mirror, admiring Gloria’s handiwork when she walked into the room.

Seeing me looking at the mirror, she said, “What do you think?”

“I look...wow.” moving around, looking at every angle, I said, “I can’t believe that’s really me.”

The dress I was wearing was tight, but not nearly as revealing as the one I’d ended up in yesterday. Gloria had done a great with my makeup, although I was surprised that she’d used so little. When I’d asked about that, she explained that it was important to use just the right amount of makeup. Standing next to me, Gloria said, “You don’t look half bad if I do say so myself.”

Turning to Gloria, I hugged her and said, “Thanks for the help.”

“No problem, sweetie.” Smiling, Gloria said, “In time you’ll be able to do this by yourself.”

“Let’s hope that this situation is reversed long before then.” Pushing a strand of hair from my eyes, I said, “Despite appearances, I’m still a guy.”

“If you say so.” Smiling, Gloria handed me Elaine’s purse. “You should probably get going; you don’t want to keep Officer Kirkland waiting.”

“You’re probably right.” Taking the purse, I said, “Why don’t you come along? It would be nice to have someone around who knows who I really am.”

“I’d love to, Evan; but I’ll have to pass.” Looking at me, Gloria said, “I’ve been wearing the same sweat-soaked clothes for almost 16 hours now; I’d like to take a shower and get changed into something else.”

Hearing that, I wondered if Gloria knew what she was getting into. I had a hard enough time showering in Elaine's body, I figured she'd be dealing with the same issues. “I understand.” Hugging Gloria again, I said, “I’ll stop by when I get back.”

“Good luck; I’m sure you’ll do fine.”
1232121111111121.title: Continue

12321211111111211.content:
The trip back to the station wasn’t nearly as bad as last night’s trip; although it was still pretty bad. There were overturned cars and burnt-out buildings everywhere. “It looks like a warzone out there.”
Sighing, I said, “On the plus side, at least the rioting and looting seems to have let up.”

“Officially my bosses are saying the people must’ve gotten the panic out of their systems.” Looking at me, Officer Kirkland said,
“Unofficially, they’re giving you a lot of the credit.”

“Me?” shocked, I said, “Why?”

“A lot of people saw your broadcasts yesterday.” Moving to avoid a downed pole, he said, “People could see that you were scared, but that you were trying to hold it together.”

I sat in silence for a moment; processing what I’d just heard. I hadn’t realized until that moment how much of an effect I could have on people in town. Turning to Officer Kirkland, I said, “Have you managed to get in contact with anyone?”

“There’s no one for me to get in contact with.” Sighing, Officer Kirkland said, “I never had any kids, and my wife divorced me 15 years ago.”

“I-I’m sorry to hear that.”

“It’s alright, ma’am; I’ve learned to accept it.” Pausing, Officer Kirkland said, “How about you?”

I wanted to mention how I’d failed to contact my mom and Corinne, but I didn’t want to arouse suspicion. “Unfortunately I’m in the same situation as you.” Taking a breath, I said, “My parents in a fire 4 years ago; shortly after I’d graduated from Grad School.”

“In a way, maybe that makes us the lucky ones.” Sighing, Officer Kirkland said, “With no loved ones to worry about, we can move on quicker.”

******************************


Once Officer Kirkland and I arrived at the station, I walked inside to find the place nowhere near as chaotic as the day before. After making a quick stop at Elaine’s desk, I went off to find Phil.

It didn’t take long to find him in his office; with Diane and a girl in a school uniform. I quickly put two and two together and realized who the other girl was. “That skirt is very becoming on you, Kieth.”

“Very funny, Elaine.” Scoffing, Kieth said, “We can’t all keep our bodies as you did.”

Think again, buddy. Sitting next to him, a smile on her face, Diane said, “If this doesn’t prove karma exists, then I don’t know what will.” Turning to Keith, Diane said, “I can’t think of a better punishment for your sexist attitude then to end up in the body of a Catholic school girl.”

That’s when I realized I’d recognized the logo on Keith’s blouse; it was for St. Ann’s School, a private Catholic school on the outskirts of town. At the moment Phil finally had enough. “Can we get down to business here?” turning to me, Phil sighed and said, “As I was telling these two before you arrived, we’ve gotten some new information about what happened.”

“What kind of information?” excited, I said, “Have they figured out what caused it?”

“Not yet, but they’re working on it.” Taking a breath, Phil said, “For now they’re saying this Great Shift has affected approximately 90% of the planet.”

“That’s a very original name.”

Before anyone could respond, a girl no older than 12 ran into the room. I quickly realized she must’ve been an employee because she was wearing a headset and mouthpiece. “Our specialist just arrived, Phil.”

“That’s great, Mark; send him in.”

Once Mark ran off, I turned to Phil and said, “What’s going on?”

“We managed to track down a scientist who might be able to explain what happened.” Looking at me, Phil said, “His name is Dr. Jackson Webber.”

Just then I heard footsteps out in the hall. Turning around, I looked at the door just as Dr. Webber walked in - inside the body of ____.
12321211111111211.title: At The Station

123212111111112112.content:
Given everything that’s happened over the last 24 hours, I suppose I shouldn’t have been surprised to see a woman in nurse’s scrubs walk into the room. Looking at her, I figured she was only a few years younger than I was now.

“It’s a pleasure to meet you, Dr. Webber.” Standing up, I extended my hand and said, “I’m Elaine Sato.”

Taking my hand, Dr. Webber said, “The pleasures all mine, Ms. Sato.”

As Dr. Webber and I sat down, Diane turned to her and said, “If you don’t mind my asking, what was it like for you to find yourself in this woman’s body?”

“It was quite the shock,” looking at everyone in the room, Dr. Webber said, “You see, before all this, I was a 65-year-old man with a bad back.”

“I guess you could say, then, that things worked out pretty well for you then?”

“You could say that.” Nodding, Dr. Webber said, “Although I would’ve preferred to have ended up in a woman’s body.”

So would I, doc. “What can you tell us about this Great Shift before we go on the air?” pausing, I said, “I’d like to know why some people, like me, weren’t affected.”

“I’m afraid I don’t know the answer to that, Ms. Sato.” Smiling, Dr. Webber said, “One can only assume it was purely by chance that you weren’t affected.”

Phil walked back into the room at that moment, having stepped out a minute earlier. “They’re almost ready in the studio.” Looking at me, he said, “Elaine, you’re going to be conducting the interview.”

Before I could say anything, Keith stood up and said, “Are you kidding me Phil?” gesturing to me, he said, “I know you see potential in her, but Elaine has practically no experience.”

“Shut up, Keith.” Although they were now roughly the same height, Phil was doing his best to be menacing. “The entire region saw Elaine’s broadcasts yesterday; seeing her calm despite everything going on kept them calm.”

Even with what Officer Kirkland had told me, I was rather surprised to hear the effect my actions had on the people. Turning to Phil, I said, “If you want me to do it, Phil; then I’ll do it.”
123212111111112112.title: Meeting Dr. Webber

1232121111111121121.content:
I was sitting at Elaine’s desk waiting for Dr. Webber to leave the ladies' room. He’d been in there for the last 20 minutes with Heather and Diane. I had no idea why until I saw him walk out wearing a skirt suit and heels.

He had about as much experience in heels as I did; I watched him stumble a few times as he made his way to my desk. Standing up, I said, “You look lovely, Dr. Webber.”

“If you say so.” Pausing, he said, “I never imagined I’d be wearing something like this; let alone that I’d have the figure for it.”
Raising an eyebrow, I said, “Let me guess, that was Diane who said that.”

“Correct.” Trying to adjust the skirt, Dr. Webber said, “She said this was one of her backup outfits; it’s not exactly the right size, but she said it’ll do fine.”

“Why don’t we get ready for the interview?” Gesturing to the studio, I said, “I realize that we don’t have a lot of information about this shift, but whatever you can give the viewers would be a great help.”

“You’re the professional, Ms. Sato; I’ll defer to your judgment.”

**********************


I was sitting at the news desk, with Dr. Webber sitting to my right. Looking at him, I said, “You’ll do fine, Dr. Webber.”

“I haven’t been this nervous since med school.”

With Diane and Keith standing behind him, Phil counted us down. Once he’d reached zero, I looked at the camera and said,
“Hello everyone, I’m Elaine Sato of Channel 7 News.” Pausing, I said, “With me in the studio today is Dr. Jackson Webber, a neurologist at Colebrook College.”

Chuckling nervously, Dr. Webber said, “I-It’s a pleasure to be here, Elaine.”

“What can you tell us about what people are calling the Great Shift, Doctor?”

“There’s not much that I can tell you that your viewers don’t already know.” Pausing, Dr. Webber said, “About 90% of the world’s population, including myself, found themselves suddenly in someone else's body.”

“We’ve heard rumors about so-called aftershocks.” Pausing, I said, “What do you know about those?”

“Very little, I’m afraid.” Taking a breath, Dr. Webber said, “All I know for sure is that there have been several instances, after the main event, where smaller groups of people would swap bodies again.”

“I’m sure my viewers, especially those in new bodies, would like to know if this is reversible.” Looking at Dr. Webber, I said, “Is there hope for those affected to be returned to their rightful bodies?”

“I don’t want to speculate on that, Ms. Sato.” Looking at the camera, Dr. Webber said, “For now, people can hope for it to be reversed; but should be prepared in the event that this can’t be fixed.”

“Thank you for speaking with us, Dr. Webber.” Turning to the camera, I said, “We’ll bring you new information as we receive it.
Until then, this is Elaine Sato for Channel 7 News.”

Once the broadcast had ended, Phil came on set. Looking at the two of us, he said, “You two did great.”

“I just hope the viewers couldn’t tell how nervous I was.”

Looking at Dr. Webber, I said, “You did fine, Dr. Webber.”
1232121111111121121.title: The Interview

12321211111111211211.content:
It was just after 11:15 and I was in the break room having lunch; or what passed for lunch given what food was available in Elaine’s fridge. I made a mental note to, once things got back to normal, go shopping for some groceries.

I was eating a roast beef sandwich when Diane walked into the room with Officer Kirkland. I was surprised to see him here, as I’d thought he would have left after dropping me off. As I watched them from my corner table, I saw them sit down and start talking to each other.

My curiosity peaked; I got up and walked over to them. “It seems like you two have gotten off on the right foot.”

“It’s nothing like that, Elaine.” Gesturing to Officer Kirkland, Diane said, “Roger and I were just talking about our lives before the Shift.”

“Oh?” sitting down, I said, “Did anything interesting come up?”

Glancing at Diane, Roger said, “It turns out that my ex-wife used to babysit Diane when she was a kid.”

Smiling, I said, “Talk about a small world.”

I continued chatting with Roger and Diane for a few minutes until I started to get the feeling they wanted me to leave. After saying my goodbyes, I walked out of the room.
12321211111111211211.title: Lunch Chat

12321211111111211212.content:
About twenty minutes had passed since my interview with Dr. Webber. I was sitting at Elaine’s desk eating a granola bar; while everyone else was doing their own thing. Despite the events going on around us, there wasn’t a whole lot to do other than wait for another development.

To that end, Diane was in the break room talking with Roger; while Phil was in his office listening to Keith complain about me doing the interview. I had just finished the granola bar when I heard footsteps behind me. Turning around, I saw Dr. Webber awkwardly walking out of the woman’s room; stumbling in the heels he was wearing.

He must’ve realized I was looking at him because he started walking towards me. “I don’t know how you do it, Elaine.”

I didn’t know what he was referring to. Looking at him, I said, “I beg your pardon.”

“I don’t know how you, or any woman for that matter, can walk in these heels.” Sitting down at the adjacent desk, he said, “I feel like I’m walking a tight rope or something; I have to watch my every step.”

I got used to it, I’m sure you can too. “It takes practice, but I’m sure you’ll get the hang of it eventually.”

“I’d rather not get the hang of it.” Sitting back, he said, “I’d like to have my old body back.”

It was only then that I realized I could see up Dr. Webber’s skirt. That brought me back to this morning when Gloria had to remind me to cross my legs. Looking at Dr. Webber, I said, “Here’s a friendly piece of advice, woman to woman.” Leaning forward, in a hushed tone, I said, “You might want to cross your legs; because everyone can see up your skirt.”

Realizing his mistake, Dr. Webber quickly crossed his legs. “Thanks for the tip.” Blushing, he looked at me and said, “I guess I have a lot to learn about womanhood.”

You and me both, doc. With a smile, I said, “I’m sure there’s going to be plenty of men in your position now.”
12321211111111211212.title: After the Interview

123212111111112112121.content:
I walked Dr. Webber to the door. "Thanks for your help, Elaine," she said.

"Thanks for coming," I replied. "Let us know when you have more information." We hugged, and she left.

Phil came my way. "I've heard back from more of our team."

"That's a relief," I said. "What's the good word?"

"Most have switched. Our evening and nighttime anchors are now a 5-year-old boy and a pregnant teenager."

A lot of that going around, I thought, given Diane and myself.

"Our chief meteorologist is now a teenaged boy with cerebral palsy who communicates through an electronic device. And our political correspondent has become an African-American woman. But there are a couple like you."

I wasn't sure at first what Phil meant, until it hit me. "They're still themselves?"

Phil nodded. "Unfortunately, members of their families aren't. There's now a Catholic schoolgirl in the body of Bill's husband. And Dante was making love with his wife when she started screaming."

"That's a fine how-do-you-do, as my grandparents used to say. So, that's everyone accounted for?"

"I wish. We're still a few short." She leaned in close. "I try not to think about them too much. This body doesn't have my sobriety chip, but I still want to keep it in spirit."
123212111111112112121.title: Crew Updates

123212111111112112122.content:
Dr. Webber and I talked for a few minutes; about whatever came to mind. I had to be careful about how I responded to some of Dr. Webber’s questions, but it was clear that she was still coming to terms with her new gender. Looking at her, I said, “If you don’t mind my asking, have you heard from the person whose body you ended up in?”

“No, I haven’t yet.” Pausing, Dr. Webber looked at me and said, “Given everything that’s happened, it’s bound to be a few days before I hear anything.”

“I certainly hope that she’s alright.” Pausing, I said, “If you were shocked to end up in her body, then I’d imagine she felt the same.”

“Actually, I think she might’ve been more shocked then I was.” Blushing, Dr. Webber said, “You see, I was...being intimate with my wife at the time.”

It took me a moment to process what she’d said. But when I did, my eyes bugged out. “Oh...I-I can see how that might be a surprise.”

“How about you, Elaine?” looking at me, Dr. Webber said, “I know you were one of the lucky ones to remain in their own body, but what were you doing when everything happened?”

I wanted to explain that I was in a math class, but I decided that it wouldn’t be a good idea. Moving a stray strand of hair away from my eye, I took a breath and said, “I was in the ladies' room...taking a pregnancy test.”

That wasn’t the answer that Dr. Webber was expecting. Looking at me, she said, “What were the results?”

I was still coming to terms with the results of the test. Taking a breath, I said, “I’m pregnant.”

“Congratulations.” With a smile, Dr. Webber took my hand in hers. “You and your boyfriend must...”

I was confused when Dr. Webber stopped mid-sentence. Looking at her, I said, “Are you alright, Dr. Webber?”

“Yeah, I-I’m fine.” Looking at me, she said, “It just occurred to me that you probably haven’t heard from your boyfriend since this started. I’m sorry if it came off as insensitive.”

I’d been so caught up with ending up in Elaine’s body; I hadn’t stopped to think about the idea that she must’ve had a boyfriend. Making a note to talk to Gloria, I looked at Dr. Webber said, “It’s alright.” With a smile, I said, “I haven’t heard from him yet, but I’m sure I will eventually.”

“I hope you hear from him soon.” Looking at a clock on Elaine’s desk, she stood up and said, “I should probably get going.”

Standing up, I said, “Do you have a place to stay?”

“Yeah, I do.” Nodding, she said, “Apparently the former occupant of my body just moved here. She doesn't have a place yet, but another nurse offered to let me stay with her..”

I walked Dr. Webber to the door, I saw a police officer waiting next to a running car. Turning to Dr. Webber, I said, “I hope I get to see you again, Dr. Webber.”

“Elaine, please call me Jackson.” Hugging me, she said, “I’m sure you’ll be seeing me again.”

I was taken aback by the hug; if only because it was unexpected. We’d only known each other for a short time, but I felt a kinship with Dr. Webber. Maybe it was because we’re now roughly the same age, or perhaps because we were both women now.
Whatever it was, I considered her a friend. Reciprocating the hug, I said, “Stay safe, Dr. Web...Jackson.”

“You too, Elaine.” Getting into the police car, she said, “Please tell Elaine I’ll return her outfit when I get the chance.”

“I’m sure she won’t mind if you keep it for a while.” Smiling, I said, “Besides, I think it would be a little big on her new body.”
123212111111112112122.title: Chatting with Dr. Webber

1232121111111121121221.content:
After walking back into the station, I started to make my way back towards Elaine’s desk. I barely made it down the hall, when I saw Phil walking towards me. He looked rather uncomfortable in his outfit; which made me wonder why I wasn’t uncomfortable in the outfit I was wearing.

Walking up to me, Phil said, “So I was able to get in touch with more of our co-workers.”

“That’s a relief.” Pausing, I said, “Anything good?”

“Most of them were switched; our evening and primetime anchors are now in the bodies of a 5-year boy and a very pregnant teenager.”

Given how Diane and I were both pregnant, I thought about how others might be in a similar situation. “There seems to be a lot of that going around.”

“Our Chief Meteorologist is now a teenage boy with non-verbal autism. Our political correspondent has become an African-American woman.” Sighing, Phil said, “On the plus side, there are a few that are like you.”

I wasn’t sure what Phil meant at first until it suddenly hit me. “They’re still in their own bodies?”

“Unfortunately, members of their families weren’t so lucky.” Pausing, Phil said, “An 11-year-old boy is now in the body of Bill’s wife, and Patrick was taking a shower with his wife when she suddenly started screaming.”

All things considered, I guess I was pretty lucky. Looking at Phil, I said, “Have you heard anything from Grace?”

Looking at me, Phil said, “No, I haven’t heard from her yet.”

Placing a hand of Phil’s shoulder, I said, “I’m sure she’ll turn up soon. Phil.”
1232121111111121121221.title: An Update From Phil

12321211111111211212211.content:
It was just after 2:00 when I left the station; only this time I had a different police escort – it seemed requested that he escort Diane back to her house. Walking out of the station, I saw Phil getting into the car with Diane and Roger, while the rest of the staff got into other cars.

Making my way down the sidewalk, I saw a woman standing in front of a police cruiser. Walking up to her, I said, “I take it you’re my ride home today?”

Nodding, she said, “That’s right ma’am.”

The ride back to the condo was quiet compared to this morning; this officer wasn’t as chatty as Roger. Once we arrived at the condo complex, I stepped out of the car. Before going inside, I leaned through the window and said, “Thank you for the ride, Officer.”

“You’re welcome, ma’am.” Quick and to the point, she said, “I’ll be back tomorrow at 7:45 to pick you up.”

After the officer drove off, I made my way into the building. With all the reports of violence and vandalism, I was glad to see that the building was unscathed. Walking up the stairs, I was about to enter Elaine’s condo when I changed my mind. Turning around, I walked across the hall and knocked on Gloria’s door.

When I didn’t hear a response, I tried the handle and was surprised to find it unlocked. Walking into the condo, I saw that it was very modest compared to Elaine’s. There were still some expensive looking items, but it seemed that Gloria’s tastes weren’t as expensive as Elaine’s. Making my way into the living room, I called out, “Gloria?”

I soon heard footsteps behind me. Turning around, I saw Gloria walking out of the bedroom naked. “Evan!?” grabbing a towel from a nearby chair, Gloria quickly covered herself. “W-What are you doing here?”

“I just got back from the station.” Trying to get the image of Gloria’s naked body out of my mind, I said, “W-What are you doing?”
“After you left, I came over and fell asleep.” Pausing, Gloria said, “I woke up a little while ago and realized I needed to take a shower.”

“Do you realize your door was unlocked?” looking at her, I said, “I know things have calmed down a bit, but what if someone decided to sneak in?”

“As I said, I came over and fell asleep.” Shrugging, Gloria said, “I guess I just forgot to lock the door.”

************************


I was sitting on the couch when Gloria walked out of the bedroom 10 minutes later; having just gotten dressed. She’d mentioned that her nephew had left some clothes behind. Walking over to the couch, Gloria sat down next to me. “So how was your second day at the station?”

I proceeded to explain everything that happened today; from Keith in the Catholic girl’s body to my chat with Dr. Webber after the interview. When I was finished, I said, “Considering everything that’s happened, I guess today was pretty normal.”

“Has anyone figured out that you’re not the real Elaine?”

“Not that I know of.” Pausing, I said, “I think they’re still too focused on what’s happened to realize I’m not her.”

Getting up, Gloria said, “Would you like something to eat?”

“I could go for some lunch.” Nodding, I said, “All I’ve had today is a granola bar, and I am eating for two now.”

As Gloria walked into the kitchen, she said, “So are you going to ask me the question, or what?”

“What question?”

Looking at me from the kitchen, Gloria said, “The question you’ve been dying to ask me since you came home.”

I quickly realized what Gloria was referring to, although I hadn’t yet figured out how she knew. Getting up, I walked over to the counter and sat down on one of the chairs. “Dr. Webber...I mean Jackson, asked if I’d heard from Elaine’s boyfriend.” Sighing, I said, “I guess what I want to know is...is there a boyfriend?”

“There was a boyfriend.” Grabbing a loaf of bread, Gloria said, “But they broke up over a month ago.”

“What caused them to break up?”

“Elaine never told me exactly what happened, all I know is there was a fight and they broke up.”

“So if the boyfriend isn’t the father, then who is?”

“After the breakup, Elaine was pretty upset. She went to a broadcasting convention and had a one-night stand with one of the attendees.” Walking over with a sandwich for each of us, Gloria said, “From the sound of things, I think he is the father of your...I mean Elaine’s baby.”
12321211111111211212211.title: Returning Home

123212111111112112122111.content:
Gloria and I spent the next few hours talking; mostly about our former lives. Prior to the Shift, Gloria worked as a paralegal. When I’d asked why she’d been at the grocery store instead of work, she explained that she was out sick with pneumonia.

We hung out until around 5:45 when I decided it was time for me to leave. As I made my way towards the door, I stopped and looked back at Gloria. “How you noticed anything odd since the Shift?”

“You mean besides ending up in a man’s body?” looking at me, Gloria said, “Not really, why?”

“There were a few times today where I did something without realizing it.” Sighing, I said, “It’s not anything major; I would just cross my legs when I sat down, or I’d move a strand of hair from my face.”

“I’m sure that’s nothing to be concerned about.”

“I hope you’re right.” Taking a breath, I said, “I guess I was just worried that I was starting to act like a woman.”

“If it worries you, Evan; then why not talk to the doctor you interviewed today.”

“That makes sense.” Nodding, I said, “I’ll talk to her tomorrow about it.”

“I’ll see you tomorrow, Evan.”

After saying goodbye to Gloria, I walked across the hall and let myself into Elaine’s condo. Closing the door, I leaned up against it and started to wonder if there was a reason I was starting to like a woman without thinking. I started to panic a little until I managed to calm myself. “Gloria’s right, I should just talk to Jackson about this.” Taking a deep breath, I said, “Maybe this will all pass in time.”
123212111111112112122111.title: At Gloria's

1232121111111121121221111.content:
That night, Gloria and I ate supper together. I fixed it, and Gloria said I did a good job. Then, we watched a movie together and called it a night.

***********************************


The next morning, Gloria came over again to help me with my hair and makeup. She also held my hair when morning sickness hit. Long story short, I was ready when the officer knocked on my door.

I opened the door. "Good morning, Officer... " I looked at her nametag. "Perkins. Shall we go?"

As we made our way to her cruiser, Officer Perkins said, "I finally remembered where I know you from."

"Other than on TV?" I asked.

"Before the Great Shift, I was a crime reporter. I found myself in this body. Lucky for me, her wife is helping me with my hair and makeup. Anyway, you and I met and knocked boots at the broadcasting convention in Vegas."

I cringed at the choice of words. "That was you?"

"Yep. I thought I recognized you last night, but I wasn't sure where I knew you from. And I couldn't ask you, 'cause you'd have just said I knew you from TV." She opened the back door of the cruiser. "So, how've you been?"

As I slid into the back seat, I told her, "I'm pregnant."
1232121111111121121221111.title: The Next Morning

12321211111111211212211111.content:
Officer Perkins looked like I had just told her she was the one who was pregnant. It took her a while to find her words. "P-pregnant? Y-you're sure?"

I nodded. "I can't keep breakfast down anymore. I'm constantly emptying my bladder. And there's the pregnancy test I took the other day."

Officer Perkins climbed behind the wheel. "I don't know what to do," she said. "Two days ago, I was the picture of a confirmed bachelor. If... If I knew then, I'd know exactly what to do. But... " She looked at the ring on her finger. "I can't explain it, but I feel something for this woman's wife. I'd have to speak with her about this, decide together how we should handle this. You know what I mean?"

"Yes, I know." I did, indeed. A memory came rushing back, of a dream I had the night before. As in reality, I had walked into Gloria's apartment to find him naked. In my dream, though, I reacted by pulling off my clothes. The two of us made love right there on the floor, and I woke up feeling disappointed that it was just a dream. I definitely needed to talk to somebody about what I was feeling.
12321211111111211212211111.title: Reaction

123212111111112112122111111.content:
When we arrived at the station, I asked Officer Perkins, "So, what are your duties, now that you're on the force?"

"Headquarters has the more experienced officers working on serious problems," she explained. "People like me, who got thrown into the bodies of officers, have been assigned to 'babysitting detail,' as they call it. No offense."

"None taken. So, you're assigned to babysit me?"

"That's right."

"Well, I'm going to see about putting in a short day, so maybe we'll both be home before lunch."

Once I was inside, I saw that Dr. Webber was there, but someone else was missing. "Where's Keith?"

"The parents of his new body tracked him down," Diane replied. "They said he might have been Keith Houseman before, but she's Mary Katherine Loftus now. And, since none of her nine brothers and sisters are on TV, there's no reason why she should be. So I guess it's back to St.Anne's for her." I

"From skirt-chaser to Catholic school girl," I said. Turning to Dr. Webber, I asked, "So, I guess you've got some more information to share?"

"I do," she said, "but Phil wants to break the news to everyone here herself. She had to take a call, she should be out soon."

She was, but that call she had to take had shaken her up. She had been crying, and looked like she might start again any moment. "Grace is dead."

In response to Dr. Webber's quizzical look, I explained, "Grace was the intern whose body Phil's in."
123212111111112112122111111.title: Bad News

1232121111111121121221111111.content:
I put my arm around Phil. "What happened?"

"She was in my body, and she panicked," Phil replied. "I had been driving, and she crashed. She was in and out of consciousness for the past couple of days, but, last night,... "

I didn't need further details. I just let Phil cry on my shoulder. Turning to Diane, I asked, "How's your old body?"

"She's fine. The barista is in it. She said she had planned to make an appointment to terminate the pregnancy before the Shift hit, but, if I want the baby, it's all mine."

As Phil's crying let up, I turned my attention back to her. "Phil, do you want to go to the hospital? The officer who's babysitting me is waiting for me to finish up here, we can - "

"No," she sniffled. "Losing Grace hurts, even more than my boobs hurt, but she was a good newswoman in the making. She didn't let anything get in the way of her job, and I want to honor her memory. I'll be here. We've got more important stories to break to our viewers."

"That must be the information you asked Dr. Webber to come down here for. Can you tell us what it is?"

Phil nodded and wiped the tears from her eyes. "I've been talking to the top scientists in Washington. They say... they say the Shift is permanent. Whatever body you're in, it's yours, now."
1232121111111121121221111111.title: Continue

12321211111111211212211111111.content:
Diane must have seen something in my face. "You're such a good person, Elaine," she said. "Concerned for everybody, even though you're in your own body."

The hell I am, I thought. A week ago, I was a 15-year-old boy. Now, I'm a 30-year-old pregnant woman. And I'm stuck that way.

"We need your strength, Elaine," Phil said. "You pulled this city out of panicked rioting, now we need you to prevent more."

As I pulled myself together, I nodded. "Alright. But I'll need to call it a day early. Morning sickness."

"Absolutely. We'll run it on repeat all day."

*******************************************


Phil counted us down, as usual, and I began. "Good morning. This is Elaine Sato with the latest on the Great Shift. Authorities with the U.S. government have confirmed that the switch of bodies is permanent. Whether you are in your own body or someone else's, there is no going back.

"With us now is Dr. Jackson Webber, to discuss this announcement. Thank you for joining us again, Doctor."

"Thank you, Elaine, although I may be changing my name, in light of this. As you said, the circumstances that resulted in the Great Shift cannot be reversed. However, there are other developments which the official statement has not touched upon."

"Can you explain?"

"Those of us who have switched have noticed that certain traits of our new bodies' previous owners bleeding through into our own personalities. Usually, this means that, for example, a man in a woman's body becomes more feminine, or a woman in a man's body becomes more masculine. However, sometimes, there are other changes in personality. For instance, a person who has never smoked before may find themselves in the body of a chain smoker, and now they crave nicotine. The important thing to remember is, all of us are going through the same thing."

"Thank you, Doctor. For Channel 8 News, I'm Elaine Sato."

With that done, I began to gather my things, when I felt a hand on my shoulder. "May we speak privately, Elaine?" Dr. Webber asked.

"I suppose. Come this way." I led her through the bullpen and into the conference room.

Once inside the conference room, I asked, "What's on your mind?"

"I think I should ask that question of you, Elaine," she said. "The government report has you awfully upset. Why is that?"

I sighed. "I suppose I might as well tell you. I'm not really Elaine Sato."
12321211111111211212211111111.title: Breaking the Story

123212111111112112122111111111.content:
"I see," Jackson said. "And who are you really?"

"I was a 15-year-old boy named Evan."

"Why didn't you admit this sooner? Like, as soon as you found yourself in Elaine's body, for instance?"

"Panic, I guess. Everyone here needed Elaine. They needed me to be Elaine. I couldn't think of anything else I could tell them, except that I was who I appeared to be."

"And you've decided to tell me now, why, exactly?"

"Because I recognized myself in what you said in our interview." I indicated the clothes I put on today. "I picked this outfit out myself. I'm much more comfortable in women's clothing than I was that first day. And I've begun to have certain... feelings."

"And the rest of your fashion expertise?"

"My neighbor, Gloria. Though he says I should be doing my own hair and makeup soon."

Jackson stood up. "Well, if you're looking for absolution, I would suggest you look elsewhere. You lied to me. You lied to everyone in that newsroom. I have half a mind to expose you to everyone here, see how you like what happens after that."

I rushed to stop her, but our drama was interrupted by another. As we entered the newsroom, so did a pair of police officers, carrying a baby. "Excuse us," one of the officers said. "Is one of you here in the body of Grace McKinnon?"

Phil stepped forward. "That would be me, officers. What seems to be the problem?"

The other officer walked up to her and placed the baby in her arms. "This little guy is now yours. His name's Luke."
123212111111112112122111111111.title: Confessions and Repercussions

1232121111111121121221111111111.content:
"A... a baby?" Phil was as surprised as I was when I read the results of that pregnancy test. "How... Where did this come from?"

"We don't have all the details," the officer explained. "From what we were able to reconstruct, Ms. McKinnon had her mother babysit for her when she was at work. When the Shift happened, this woman was switched, and whoever wound up in her body took one look at the baby and left. Neighbors heard him crying and called us. Earlier today, Grace's mother called us to check on her former grandson, and we put two and two together."

"Now, just a minute," Phil said, handing the baby to me. "Do you expect me to believe... "

I honestly don't know what was said after that. All my attention was focused on the baby in my arms. What if I dropped him? What if I was walking along, and a door opened and hit his head? What if he can't get into college? What if he doesn't like me?

While all these thoughts and more ran through my head, Luke just stared at me. I began to wonder what was going through his little mind. Is there something he wants, but can't tell anybody?

This question, at least, got an answer, when Luke began crying. And someone said, "Yep, that's your baby, Phil."

I looked. Phil's blouse had two wet spots, right over her nipples.I

Taking Luke back, Phil said, "If anybody here used to be a nursing mother, I could use a little help."
1232121111111121121221111111111.title: Grace's Baby

12321211111111211212211111111111.content:
As Phil went off to a private place to learn the ins and outs of breastfeeding, Dr. Webber made her goodbyes. She didn't out me, as she said she would, but I was sure the discussion between us wasn't over. I got into the back of Officer Perkins's cruiser and went home, leaving her to check in with headquarters and, eventually, talk to her wife about the fact that I was pregnant.

Back at the apartment, I had just gotten in the door when Gloria called, "That you, Evan? C'mon in."

I went into Gloria's apartment, where he was making a couple of sandwiches. "How was your day?"

"Awful. The Shift is permanent. And my feelings are completely haywire."

"What's wrong?" he asked, putting an arm around me.

"Everything. I'm stuck as a pregnant woman twice my age. I told Dr. Webber who I was, and she's mad at me. And I'm starting to think like a woman." I turned to him. "I... I feel... " Before I could get any further, I kissed Gloria on the lips.

I don't know how I expected Gloria to react, but he wound up kissing me right back.

We headed for the bedroom, taking our clothes off as we went. By the time we reached the bed, we were naked, and we started going a lot further than kissing.

A lot further.

I won't titillate you with intimate details about my first experience with sex - not just as a woman, but ever - but I will tell you that my eyes rolled back in my head, I made a lot of incoherent noises, and I experienced it several times from that one session.

**********************************


After that, Gloria went back to the kitchen to bring us back the sandwiches. "Was it good for you?"

"I... I don't know," I replied. "Everything's changing for me. A few days ago, I was an ordinary teenage boy. And now,... "

"Did we rush it?"

"I don't know. I don't know what I'm feeling about anything anymore. I held a baby today, and, the way I worried about that baby, you'd think it was mine." I put my hand over my womb. "I'm pregnant. In a few months, I'm going to start getting bigger. And it's going to start kicking. You'd think I'd be scared out of my wits, and part of me is. But another part of me is anticipating those things."

***********************************


I got dressed and went back into my apartment, to shower, and to try and wrap my head around everything that was happening to me. I didn't make any decisions, but I did manage to calm myself down.

I got two emails. One was from Phil, calling a meeting tomorrow morning of everyone in the Channel 8 family who could come. The second was from Richard Thorpe, whose name I recognized as the evening and nighttime anchor. Opening it, I saw a blond-haired girl, about the age I had been before the Shift, holding a baby. The caption read IT'S A BOY 8 LBS 5 OZ! I sent my congratulations.

There came a knock on my door. It was Gloria. "How you doing?"

"Better. Just about to start supper. Check out the baby picture I got from Richard."

He looked at the picture. "Yeesh. He likes them young, doesn't he?"

"What? No, no. The girl is Richard."

"Ohhh."

We ate. We watched another movie together. And then I invited Gloria into my bedroom for another round of lovemaking. This time, I replaced the incoherent noises with shouts of "YES!"
12321211111111211212211111111111.title: Back Home with Gloria

123212111111112112122111111111111.content:
Gloria went back to his apartment after we finished. I didn't mind. Together, we had taken my mind off the news of the day, but I didn't know if I was ready for anything serious.

The next morning found me in a relaxed mood. I made some breakfast, then immediately wondered why I'd bothered, as what I'd eaten came right back up. Par for the course, I thought as my stomach settled, when you're having a baby.

That thought gave me pause. It was the first time I'd thought of my condition that way. It sounded good, positive. I decided to say it aloud: "I'm having a baby."

That sounded much better. After a moment's thought, I figured out why: I'm pregnant only described my condition. I'm having a baby told the world how I felt about it. I said it again. "I'm having a baby."

"I kind of gathered that," Gloria said. He must have come in with his copy of my key. "Need any help?"

"Let's find out," I replied. I dressed myself and, to my surprise, did my own hair and makeup, too.

"Not bad," Gloria said. "You're coming along well. If you can get off work early, we can devote more time to another chore."

"What did you have in mind?"

"They'll be reopening the streets soon. You'll need a quick course in driving."
123212111111112112122111111111111.title: Next Morning

1232121111111121121221111111111111.content:
After we arrived at the station, Officer Perkins said, "I don't know if I'll be available to pick you up after work. The Chief wants to talk to those of us who have switched into police officers."

"Fair enough," I said. "My car should still be here."

In the newsroom was a handmade big card for Richard. I signed my well wishes, then entered the conference room.

In addition to those I'd become familiar with, I saw two men in their forties, a stout African-American woman about my current age, and a 5-year-old boy, along with a couple of people I couldn't identify at all. Phil was seated at the head of the conference table, a lightweight blanket covering Luke's face and half of Phil's chest.

As soon as I walked into the room, a lot of the people I'd never seen before came up to me and thanked me for the work I'd done over the past few days. A few of them even hugged me. As I sat down, I saw Dr. Webber was with us. From the way my colleagues were acting, it didn't seem like she'd outed me yet. I wondered when she planned to make her move.

Turning my attention to Phil, I asked, "Am I late?"

"No, you're right on time," Phil said. "I decided to get in here early. I didn't want to have to struggle with the doorknob if Luke got hungry." Addressing the room, she said, "Why don't the rest of you who are in different bodies say your names?"

The African-American woman spoke first. "Kevin Sylvester, political correspondent. Though I'm not sure where politics will go after the Shift. The founding fathers didn't anticipate our elected officials winding up in bodies that are under the age limit."

"I'm Melanie George," said the boy. "With me is my mommy."

The woman waved. "Phyllis Crump. Pleased to meet you all."

"And you?" Phil asked, indicating the only unfamiliar face left.

"Oh, I'm Chad White. Richard Thorpe is in my niece's body. She sent me to find out what her employment situation is."

"You can tell her that she's been on maternity leave since the Shift, and there's an on-air job waiting for her until either she's ready to come back, or she decides she doesn't want it anymore."

"I'm afraid I'll have to step down as anchor," Melanie said. "11:00 is past my bedtime, and Mommy wants me to go to kindergarten."

"Not a problem," Phil replied. "What I want from you and Kevin right now is interviews. I want you to talk to people whose lives have been changed by the Shift. Let's remind people that they're not the only ones going through this. We'll start as soon as the authorities clear the roads for public travel.

"Bill, Pat," Phil said, turning to them, "how about giving our hard-working colleagues here the weekend off, and you guys handle the reporting?"

"Sounds good, boss."

"Excellent. Alright, Elaine, you'll interview Dr. Webber one last time before the weekend. Tell our viewers about what's going on with the talent they haven't seen since the Shift. Then, you and Dr. Webber will discuss a new angle: adults who wound up in the bodies of infants."
1232121111111121121221111111111111.title: The Meeting

12321211111111211212211111111111111.content:
When the meeting was adjourned, I hung around a while, not exactly eager to sit down with Dr. Webber. "How's motherhood going, Phil?" I asked.

"I found out why my boobs were hurting," she replied. "I was engorged from days without nursing." She checked on Luke. "I think he's done. Time for his nap."

She carried Luke to her office, where a crib and a changing table had joined the furniture. "For now," she said, "any new moms will be allowed to use my office for nursing. You know that spare office that Keith used with the girls? When I'm done with it, it'll be a deluxe nursery: rocking chairs, cribs, changing tables, soft lighting, ambient music, the works. I don't want anyone else to come here thinking they need to hide a baby."

As I stepped out of Phil's office, Melanie ran up and grabbed me. "Come on, Elaine," he said, "you've gotta see this!"

Well, with that build-up, what could I do but let Melanie take me where she wanted? I followed him to a deck, which was usually used for outdoor segments. Today, though, everyone on the deck was looking across the street. I got to where I could see, and the neighbors had decorated the wall facing the station with a large banner. It read: WE 💓 U ELAINE

I raised my hand, and I could hear cheers coming from that same building. They love me, I thought.

Then, I felt a hand on my shoulder, and a familiar voice said, "You've touched their lives, haven't you?"

I turned. Dr. Webber was standing there, smiling.
12321211111111211212211111111111111.title: Continue

123212111111112112122111111111111111.content:
Dr. Webber and I walked into the studio and took our places. An associate producer stepped forward. "Phil left orders that she'll be napping when the baby naps," she said. "I'll be working with you today." She counted us down, and we began.

"Good morning, I'm Elaine Sato. We begin this morning with some updates about some members of the Channel 8 family who you haven't seen since the Great Shift. Evening News anchor Richard Thorpe has given birth to a bouncing baby boy, 8 pounds, 5 ounces. Anchor Keith Houseman has left Channel 8, and will be living his new identity as a Catholic schoolgirl. And Melanie George will be stepping down as anchor, due to the fact that she is now a 5-year-old boy. As staggering as this information is, it could have worked out much worse for them. Our guest, Dr. Jackson Webber, will explain. Good morning, Dr. Webber."

"Thank you, Elaine. We have received cases of teens and adults with the minds of infants. This leads us to the staggering conclusion that there must be teens and adults who are now trapped in the bodies of infants."

"And what is their reaction to this?"

"We can only speculate, as an infant's body simply doesn't know how to communicate."

"What is the long-term prognosis for cases such as these?"

"Well, with the mature bodies, we have begun getting them back on their feet, and we expect to start teaching them to speak and read and write soon after that. As for the mature minds in infant bodies, there is no telling. It may be that, over time, their minds will regress into infancy. We may know more in the years ahead."

"Thank you for joining us, Doctor. For Channel 8 News, I'm Elaine Sato."

With the interview over, I brought Dr. Webber into the ladies' room. "Thank you for not telling anyone about me, Doctor."

"I've kept quiet for two reasons, Evan. The first is, I've had a chance to observe your co-workers. If I did tell them, I'm not certain they would believe me, even with rock solid evidence."

"What do you mean?"

"Their identities are wound up in you. Any challenge to you would be a challenge to them, as well. This is because of the second reason."

"Which is?"

"Whatever your intentions for starting down this road, you've inspired millions of people, to make it through another day, if nothing else. That banner outside may have Elaine's name on it, but the message is for you." She paused. "I'm nowhere near ready to forgive you for your deceiving me, but I won't be making any trouble for you."

"Thanks."
123212111111112112122111111111111111.title: The Interview

1232121111111121121221111111111111111.content:
"You seem more at peace today than yesterday," Dr. Webber said, as we walked out. "And I don't think my promise to keep your secret is the reason."

"I'm feeling better," I explained. "I can't really explain why. Maybe I'm thinking enough like a woman that it doesn't bother me anymore. Maybe it's the baby. Maybe it's the sex."

"You had sex?"

"Yesterday afternoon, and then again last night."

"Amazing. I'm nowhere near ready to go that far. Enjoy your weekend."

Digging into my purse, I found a set of car keys. The ignition key was the kind where I could remotely. Getting an idea, I walked into the station garage, I held the key up and clicked the unlock button. I was rewarded with a distant beep and a flash I caught out of the corner of my eye. Walking toward the flash, pressing the button occasionally to make sure I was headed in the right direction, I came to a cool convertible. I could get used to driving this, I thought. Then I saw that it was a two-seater. Better not get too used to it. Right, baby?

There still weren't too many cars on the road, but I kept an eye on the speedometer anyway. So it was something of a shock when a police car came up behind me, turned on the flashers, and gave a whoop with the siren. I pulled over and started looking for my registration.

"How's your day going, Ms. Sato?"

I did a double take. It was Officer Perkins. "I thought it was going well. I could swear I was going the speed limit."

She chuckled. "Sorry, I couldn't resist asking my sergeant to help me with this. You aren't in any trouble. I just wanted you to meet someone." She motioned to someone in the cruiser.

A woman Officer Perkins's age came to my car. "How do you do, Ms. Sato? I'm Rachel Richter. I understand you know my, ah, new bride?"

I nodded. "She is the father of my baby. I want you to know, I don't want to come between you two."

"Perhaps we could visit occasionally?"

"I'd like that. Two very special aunties. Except it's just occurred to me that I don't know your wife's name?"

"I used to be Brian. Her name was Kayla. I'll answer to either one."

"Alright." I wrote out my address. "Don't be strangers."
1232121111111121121221111111111111111.title: Driving Home for the First Time

12321211111111211212211111111111111111.content:
Gloria was waiting for me when I got home. "Nice set of wheels," he said.

"Thanks," I said. "Though I don't dare let myself get too attached to it. I can't exactly put a baby seat in there, can I?"

"Well, enjoy it while you can. What's your work schedule like?"

"The weekend is mine. And I have permission to drive. I got home okay, but maybe tomorrow you can teach me the finer points?"

"Sounds like a plan to me. Lunch?"

"I don't know if you read my mind or just heard my tummy rumbling."

*****************************************************%


As we ate, I asked, "So, Gloria, what's new with you?"

"My car should be ready as soon as the roads are open. But I'm thinking about making a change."

"Oh?"

"I don't think I want to be Gloria anymore."

"Okay. What should I start calling you?"

"How about Glenn?"

"Glenn. I like it. It suits you. Glad to know you, Glenn."
12321211111111211212211111111111111111.title: Home

123212111111112112122111111111111111111.content:
After lunch, I went back to my place. After a while, I started looking around the place, not sure of what I was looking for, until I found it: the guest bedroom. As I walked in and looked around, I thought, Perfect for the nursery, and realized that was what I'd been looking for. I don't even know how far along I am, and already I'm thinking about where the crib will go. I made a mental note to find out who Elaine's doctor was, and make an appointment.

The phone rang. I answered it. "Hello?"

"Hello, Evan, it's Jacqueline."

"Who?"

"Formerly Jackson. I asked the station for your home number, I hope that's alright."

"For you, not a problem. What can I do for you?"

"I... I was... I was wondering... " Good Lord, when Jacqueline Webber got nervous, she was like a different person. "How did you know you were ready for sex?"

"I didn't, not really. My neighbor, Glenn, and I were talking, about how upset I was. Then, all of a sudden, I kissed him. Then, he kissed me, and we made a trail of discarded clothes to the bedroom. Why do you ask?"

"I've been... feeling some things."

"Ah. And you want to know if it's okay to act on those feelings? Well, I won't ask for personal details. If there are no personal or professional barriers to it, I say, go for it. Just make sure to use protection, in case you don't want to get pregnant."

"Thanks, Evan."

"Don't you mean 'Thanks, Elaine'?"

"Wouldn't you like to have someone to talk to, who you don't need to lie to?" With that, Jacqueline hung up.

That night passed like the night before: dinner, a movie, and sex. This was definitely a routine I could get used to.
123212111111112112122111111111111111111.title: Continue

1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.content:
The three weeks that followed the Great Shift were marked by two things: the changes wrought by the Shift, and life returning to something like normal. A week after, we were all encouraged to return to work or school. Let me start with my Channel 8 family.

Phil changed her name to Felicia, and embraced her new life as a single mother. She loved Luke, and would do anything for him. I also noticed that whether she covered up when she was breastfeeding depended on if there was a man in the room. Whenever she was asked if she was ready to start dating again, she just said, "Luke demands all my attention and fills my home with odors, who needs a man?"

Diane was seeing Roger, though people disagreed on how long that was going to last. They argued a lot, mostly because Diane didn't like Roger patrolling the streets as a cop.

Kevin was now Kanika, and was settling into her new life admirably. And, if you couldn't tell she was giving her cameraman definite signals, I don't know what to tell you.

Melanie, now known as Mitch, was a study in contrasts. A week of kindergarten was enough to convince everyone involved that he was too smart for it, and his interviews were journalistic masterpieces. And then, once the cameras were off, he liked to sit in his office playing, and any trip to McDonald's meant that he had to spend some time in the ball pit.

Richard had become Rhea. She called us a lot from the home she shared with Chad and his husband, Michael.

Brian decided to be Brianna, and settled in with Rachel. It really changed her life. She told me she had no idea what she was missing out on as a bachelor.

Jacqueline was looking for a new place, and now wanted to strike a better balance between her work and her social life.

Which brings us to me, and how much my life has changed. Boy howdy, has it ever.

I finally got to see a doctor, and was surprised to find out that I was 6-8 weeks along. My doctor said that this was common with women, so I didn't blow my secret right then and there. I also started seeing an obstetrician, one who had been shifted into the body of a girl who still needed a training bra.

My breasts went up a cup size, and it won't be long before my clothes start getting snug around the middle.

But the biggest change was between me and Glenn. After two weeks of telling ourselves that we were just friends with benefits, he finally said the L-word to me, and I said it right back to him. Bonus points: he has a four-door, so we don't need to get rid of the convertible.
1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.title: Three Weeks Later

1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.content:
It wasn't long after we confessed our love for each other that Glenn and I decided to move in together. After all, except for our work and Glenn's time at the gym, we were together all the time anyway. Comparing our stuff told us who should do the moving. My furniture and electronics were more high-end, so Glenn had no trouble selling his. That left only his clothes and DVD library, which you'd think would be pretty lightweight, and you'd be right. Still, Glenn insisted I sit out the move, leaving me with nothing to do but sit on the couch and listen to Glenn's friends come up with new ways to say bro.

I was never so glad to hear the phone ring, so much so that even seeing it was Diane on the other end couldn't ramp up my enthusiasm. "What up, girlfriend?"

"I'm doing nothing, Elaine. You?"

"I should be doing more to help Glenn move in, but he's relegated me to the couch for the duration. What're you calling about?"

"A couple things I wanted to tell you. First: Bill's sleeping with his wife again."

"Huh." That poor body had been hit by each and every one of the aftershocks of the Great Shift. I think Kayla Perkins was in there at one point, although I could be misremembering. "Last I heard, there was an 11-year-old in there"

"It caught him by surprise, too. He was setting up his usual spot on the couch, when she asked him to come to bed. Apparently, she asked him how to do some things, but she was a willing participant."

Of course, I couldn't say much about the arrangement. After all, I was a 15-year-old boy in the body of a 32-year-old woman, who made love to a 45-year-old woman in the body of a 25-year-old man. "Okay. What's the other bit of news?"

"The network is coming to talk to us."

"Tell them I'm not moving until this kid is at least out of diapers."

"Not you and me, the whole Channel 8 family. Apparently, we're one of a handful of markets with a mostly female news team. Plenty of newsrooms were turned into sausage fests by the Shift, but only a couple went Taco Tuesday."

"Oh. Thanks for the heads-up, Diane. Talk to you again soon."
1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.title: Moving In Together

1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.content:
I brought Glenn along for my first prenatal examination, and, with the way he was hovering over me, I was beginning to regret it. "Settle down," I finally told him. "If I didn't know any better, I'd say you were the pregnant one."

"I have good reason to be nervous," he replied. "And you're closer than you think."

"Okay, sit down and tell me your story."

He finally sat down. "You know that I had been married, back when I was a woman. Well, I also got pregnant. Several times, in fact. Trouble is, I could never carry any of them to term. Six months was my record. Long story short, my husband left me for his secretary, and, last I heard, she had no trouble having children."

"So that's why you wouldn't let me help you with moving. And why you've been wearing a moat around me with your pacing."

"Can you blame me?"

"I suppose not. But... look, you have no intention of leaving me, right?"

"You know I won't."

"So, you've just prevented history from repeating itself, and you can relax."

***********************************************************


"Good morning," the doctor said as she walked into the exam room. "I'm Dr. Anderson. And how are we today?"

"We're fine, Doctor. And you?"

"Just fine. You know, you're my first patient who didn't comment on the age of my body."

"I'm accustomed to meeting people who've been affected by the Great Shift. In fact, one of my colleagues is in a body even younger than yours."

"I thought I recognized you. Alright, let's begin."

She pressed into my belly. "So, you're how far along?"

"About 8-10 weeks."

"You're sure about that?"

"Yes. What's going on?"

"Well, you're a bit bigger than you should be."

"Should I be worried?"

"It's probably nothing. However, to find out what kind of nothing we're dealing with, I'm going to schedule an ultrasound for next month. Now, the worst part of it is, you have to have a full bladder for it to work, so no potty breaks that day"
1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.title: Prenatal Appointment

1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.content:
Back we went to the condo. "So," Glenn asked, "how do you feel, after your first prenatal examination?"

"It's starting to feel real," I replied. "Hard to believe I went from a teenaged boy to this." I turned to Glenn. "Should I be worried about what Dr. Anderson said, about me being too big?"

"You heard her yourself. She thinks it's nothing to worry about." We pulled into the driveway. "Looks like we've got a new neighbor already."

Indeed, someone was parked in front of Glenn's old place. "Wonder who it is?"

We didn't have long to wonder, because she soon came out the front door. "Hi, neighbors! Fancy running into you here!"

I could hardly believe my eyes. "Jacqueline?"

When the Shift first threw her into that body, she was mortified by the previous occupant's taste for risque outfits. Now, she had embraced the sexy clothes. "Not used to seeing me without a pantsuit or a lab coat, huh? Who is this?"

"Oh, excuse me. Glenn, this is Dr. Jacqueline Webber. Jacqueline, this is my live-in boyfriend, Glenn Hardwick."

"Pleased to meet you in person, Doctor."

"Likewise. No wonder she's laid claim to you. You're a lucky man, Glenn, I want you to know that."

"Don't I know it. We just got back from the doctor."

"Everything good, I hope?"

"She says no worries. She ought to know, she had been close to retirement before the Shift."

"Well, let us assume she knows whereof she speaks."

"I keep reminding myself that. I guess, when it's your baby, you can't help worrying a little."

Before we could continue the conversation, I heard the phone ring. "Could you get that, Glenn?"

He did, then came right back to me. "It's for you. He refuses to talk to anyone else."

With a sigh, I took the phone. "Hello?"

"Is this Elaine Sato?"

"You seem to have me at a disadvantage, young man."

"Well, if you're Elaine Sato, I guess that makes me Evan Rogers."

"Who is it?" Glenn asked.

"It's the original Elaine Sato, in my old body."
1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.title: Our New Neighbor

1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.content:
Let me tell you, it's unnerving to have a telephone conversation with yourself. "So, uh, what can I do for you?"

"Come now, Elaine," he said, "surely you must have some questions about your old self? I know I would, if the TV didn't answer most of them already."

"So, what's your proposition?"

"Why don't we meet on neutral territory? Maybe that will make you feel less hostile. Let's make it the ice cream shop on 5th, tomorrow at 1:00, shall we?" With that, he hung up.
1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.title: Talking with My Opposite Number

1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.content:
Jacqueline insisted on coming with me to meet the former Elaine. "I'm curious how seeing you on TV has affected her sense of self."

I shrugged. "He never said I couldn't bring anybody. Probably relying on my not wanting to involve the station."

******************************************************


So it was that, the next day, Jacqueline and I waited at the ice cream shop. "How'd she come to pick this place for a meeting?" Jacqueline asked.

"I came here all the time when I was a kid," I replied. "Maybe he found out it was significant to me."

"From who?"

"From me."
