A woman, maybe five years younger than I was now, joined us at the table. I was about to ask who she was when she took care of that with no prompting. "It's Corinne. Do you prefer Evan or Elaine?"

I was struck by her tone. She wasn't accusing me of anything. She just wanted to put me at ease. "Most everyone calls me Elaine," I replied. "Including my boyfriend. I guess I should introduce you. Corinne was my younger sister before the Shift. Corinne, this is - "

Before I could speak, Jacqueline took care of her own introduction. "Dr. Jackie Webber. Pleased to meet you."

"What have you been up to since the Shift, Corinne?"

"I found myself with a husband and a 3-year-old baby girl. Not to mention my newest charge."

"Let me guess: my old self?"

"Precisely. I was sent ahead to prepare you. There have been a few developments since that day."

"Oh, come on. How much could my old body change in just three weeks?"

"Oh, you'd be surprised."

Over walked my original body. But Corinne hadn't oversold it: Elaine's mind had made significant changes.

The young man before he was wearing girl's clothes. His face was made up. He even had pierced ears.

He stuck out a hand. I could see that the nails were painted. "The name's Evelyn. How do you do?"
1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.title: The Meeting

1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.content:
I've seen a lot of things since the Great Shift, but, I confess, I didn't expect to see my old body looking like a girl. I decided to work on a different topic first. "How come you didn't return to the station?"

"I was focused on the life I now had," she replied. "Let me tell you, I am glad you were one of those people who kept their whole lives on their phones. I was nearly on top of your life by the time I got home. By the way, how are you holding up with the little surprise I wound up leaving you?"

"You mean the baby? Glenn and I are looking forward to it."

She snorted. "That's a different reaction than I had. I would have gotten that little matter taken care of, let me tell you. Who's Glenn?"

"He used to be Gloria."

"I never liked her. Anyway, I felt like I was spinning my wheels at the station. So, when you told everyone that you were me, I had no intention of contradicting you."

"Which leaves us with one question, I guess: Why are you dressed that way?"

"Even after everyone else had settled into their new bodies, I couldn't shake the feeling that I was stuck in the wrong body. Finally, just as an experiment, I bought a makeup kit, then I tried it out. The second I saw my made-up face, I said to myself, 'There she is.' That's when I realized that I was trans.

"I went to supper in my makeup, and my new mom told me to wash the garbage off. I refused, and told her what I had just realized about myself. She responded by kicking me out, right then and there. Luckily for me, Corinne came by shortly after."

"I was on my way to see if you needed any help," Corinne added. "Now that I had a place of my own, I thought you might like a change of scenery. Then, she told me what happened, and I decided you had your own escape."

"Nice. But how come I'm not transgender, if you were?"

"Kid, the body of Elaine Sato is not trans. This body is."
1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.title: Evelyn's Story

1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.content:
"What?" I couldn't believe what I was hearing. "I-I'm not trans!"

"You were," Evelyn insisted. "And now I am."

"B-but I was never trans."

"And yet," Jackie said, "as soon as you found yourself in a woman's body, your first thought was to become that woman."

"I... I panicked."

"And you adjusted to womanhood far faster than others who were switched," she said. "Present company very much included."

"Th-that doesn't prove anything."

"You used to play with my dolls," Corinne said.

"I was being a good big brother."

"Even when you played with them when I wasn't around?"

I shook my head. "That was normal... I mean, who doesn't... Every guy dreams every night of being a girl,... right?"

I got my answer in the stares Jackie, Corinne, and Evelyn were giving me.

I slumped. "I... guess that wasn't so common... "

Jackie wrapped her arm around me. "It's okay, Elaine."

I looked up. That was the first time she called me that since I told her I'd been Shifted.

"You don't have to live that way anymore." She cupped my face in her hand. "I called you that other name because I thought I was reminding you of who you really were. Now, I see that you are who you really are. I promise I'll never deadname you again."

Corinne lifted my soda. "Drink up," she said. "You stop crying when you drink something."

As I drank my soda, it occurred to me that, whatever caused the Great Shift, it had put Corinne and me where we needed to be. Corinne was a wife and mother, and I... I was a woman.
1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.title: My Reaction

1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.content:
A few days later, I called Corinne. "Hey, Elaine," she said, "what's up?"

"Thought maybe the two of you would like to go clothes shopping," I replied.

"Sounds good to me. I'll ask Evelyn where she used to shop, and get back to you."

"Okay, but we'll be going to other stores, too. I really need casual wear."

*******************************************************


As agreed, we met up at Elaine's favorite clothing store. "What are we looking for?" Evelyn asked.

"Pretty soon," I replied, "I'll be at that in-between stage: not big enough for maternity clothes, but too big for my current wardrobe." Pretty soon, indeed: my clothes were already starting to feel snug in the waist.

"I can't give you too much advice on that," Evelyn said. "I didn't really want to have a baby."

"Maybe not, but it's a good chance for the three of us to hang out, do some female bonding."

"Speaking of," Corinne said, "what about your other friend? Will she be joining us?"

"Jackie? I offered, but her taste in clothes runs between lab wear and little black dresses."

Inside the shop, I explained to the attendant what I was looking for. "Certainly, Ms. Sato," she said. "We have exactly what you'll need." I soon had several outfits that should see me through until it was time to check out the maternity wear section.

Our next stop was the shoe store. Wider shoes with flat heels were the order of the day.

Finally, we went to a less high-end clothing store, where Corinne and Evelyn could get their shop on, and where I could get some sweats, T-shirts, and jeans for when I didn't feel like getting all dressed up.

I went home and hung my new clothes in my closet immediately, remembering what my OB/GYN said about me being bigger, and trying to focus on the part where she said it was probably nothing. I decided to buy some pregnancy books online, so I could do some reading about what was going on inside me.
1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.title: Clothes Shopping

1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.content:
After 15 minutes of struggling, I realized it was time to concede defeat: I had to move up to my big-girl clothes. Glenn told me I still looked good, but I was still counting the days until my next appointment with Dr. Anderson. Eight never seemed so big a number before.

I wasn't exactly in a sour mood, but my spirits certainly weren't buoyed by what happened at the station. A producer from the network walked up to me and said, "Hi. You're Elaine Sato, aren't you? You, uh, look a little, uh, bigger in person."

Looking him square in the eye so he could see how big a mistake he'd just made, I told him, "I'm pregnant."

"Oh. I'm sorry. I mean, congratulations. I mean,... " He looked to me to offer some means of escape from the predicament his mouth had led him into, but I enjoyed watching him squirm too much.

Ultimately, he was freed by the reporter they'd sent. "Hi. Elaine Sato, right? Jason Costello. Where would you like us to set up?"

"My office will be fine." I led the way.

As his crew set up their cameras, I asked Jason, "Nervous? Or was it that long a trip?"

"What?"

I looked down, and he followed my gaze to the toilet paper on his shoe.

I understood why he said that word, but I'm sure he was glad that I said something before the cameras started recording. "The greasy spoon we had breakfast in. Those sinkers did not sit well with me. How do you screw up pancakes?"

"Spare me the details, please?" I patted my belly. "I've got a tender tummy."

As the cameras rolled, Jason interviewed me about my coverage of the Great Shift and its aftermath, then moved on to the station. "I don't know why we're mostly female, or even if there is a reason."

"Your producer went from man to woman as a result of the Shift. How has that affected things here?"

"Technically, it was motherhood that had the greatest effect. You see, Phil's new body had had a baby, which she kept secret from everyone here. Since finding out about her son, Felicia decided to make the station a little more family-friendly. With two of us expecting, and another on maternity leave, that's a huge plus."

"But one of your colleagues was certainly not family-friendly."

"Keith. She no longer works here, we weren't especially sad to see her go, and I don't care to discuss her further, out of respect for the privacy of all concerned."
1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.title: The Network Pays a Visit

1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.content:
I didn't think I could look forward to my appointment any more than I already was. Then, the day came, and I remembered what Dr. Anderson had said about the need for a full bladder. Needless to say, by the time my name was called, I really couldn't wait for it to be over.

"Why don't you lie down on the exam table?" Dr. Anderson said. "How are we today?"

"I had to put away everything I wore before I got pregnant," I replied, as I took off the clothes over my belly.

Dr. Anderson took a look at me. "Yep, that there's a bump. I remember how much I looked forward to seeing it with my first."

"Uh, how many did you have?" Glenn asked.

"Five, in all," she replied. "I just recently got in touch with one of my grandchildren. Would you believe it? I'm going to be a great-grandma." She produced a tube of gel. "This will feel cold."

She wasn't kidding. It felt ice cold on my belly.

Next, she ran a plastic doohickey over my belly, until we heard the whoosh-whoosh that I knew was the baby's heartbeat. It sounded different to me than it did in the movies and on TV, but Dr. Anderson just nodded, as if it were normal to her, or as if it told her something she expected to hear.

Now, she brought over the ultrasound machine and turned it on. Once she was ready, she positioned the plastic wand where we had heard the heartbeat. "There we are."

I looked at the monitor, and there it was: my baby.

"So beautiful," I said.

"With you for a mom?" Glenn said. "Of course."

Then Dr. Anderson moved the wand off to the side. "And take a look at this."

I looked. My jaw dropped.

It was another.

"Womb-mates," she said.

I looked at Glenn. His face showed the same mix of sheer delight and pants-crapping terror I was feeling.

We spoke, at the same time, the only word we could find: "Twins."
1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.title: The Ultrasound

1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.content:
When I got to the station, Diane and Felicia were talking. "What's up, you two?" I asked.

"Oh, hi, Elaine," Felicia said. "Diane was just showing me her ultrasound."

"What a coincidence, I've got mine, too." I handed them over.

It took them just a few seconds to figure it out. "You're having twins? Congratulations!"

"How do you want to break the news?" Felicia asked.

"Give me a couple of minutes at the end of the evening news."

"You've got 'em, sister."

************************************************


We had two minutes at the end of the evening news that were usually spent on a fluff piece: you know, waterskiing squirrels and whatnot. Tonight, those minutes were mine.

"I've noticed in my email," I said, "a few of our loyal viewers are discussing my weight. Some are concerned about my health, while others just think I'm letting myself go. Let me put this discussion to rest: I am seeing a doctor, and she assures me that the twins and I are doing just fine."

"Thank you for that, Elaine," my coanchor said. "As a former woman, it always bothered me how much - wait a minute, did you say 'twins'?"

"I did, indeed."

Right on cue, the pictures from my ultrasound went up.

"Well, congratulations, Elaine."

The team and the crew broke into applause, which touched me deeply.
1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.title: Breaking the News

1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.content:
Glenn and I were relaxing at home. "So," I said. "Twins."

"Twins," agreed Glenn.

"What are you thinking?"

"I'm thinking that we may have to trade in one of the cars for an SUV."

I sighed. "I knew it was a mistake to get attached to the convertible."

The doorbell rang. Glenn answered it. The visitor's voice said, "How you doing, second-luckiest-person-in-the-Great-Shift?"

I got up, always ready to greet Brianna and Rachel. "You shouldn't talk to yourself like that, Bri," I said.

Bri hugged me and kissed me on the cheek. "The whole city's buzzing over you, Elaine. Twins! Nobody can believe it."

"We were just talking about it ourselves. I really liked the ragtop."

"Can I take a look?"

"Knock yourself out."

As Glenn led Brianna to where we parked that particular car, Rachel said, "Don't get your hopes up about a sale, we aren't in the market. I guess Bri never lost her love for cars like that. But it gives her something to do, besides crow over your news."

"Sounds like she and Glenn are about to become frenemies. Can you talk her out of it?"

"I've tried. I even reminded her that, if she wants a measuring contest, she's going to come up short." She sighed.

I decided to change the subject. "How did you and Kayla meet?"

"At the academy. We were in the same class. We knew the job wouldn't let us work together once it got serious, so I quit the force and became an EMT."

"Diane, at the station, is dating a cop. Their relationship has its ups and downs. Any advice you'd care to pass along?"

"Just this: Know what you're getting into. You can't ask a cop to hang it up, and expect nothing to change."

Glenn and Bri came in. It was clear things were getting uncomfortable between them. "Elaine," Bri said, "your guy is having a tough time dealing with the fact that I'm the babies' father, not him."

"Don't drag me into this, girlfriend. I'm sleeping with Glenn, not with you."

If nothing else, that served to put a smile on Glenn's face.
1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.title: A Rivalry

1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.content:
Glenn decided we should take a break from cooking, so I made dinner reservations for us. As we got ready, Glenn reminded me, "We won't need to trade the convertible in right now, just when it's time for the kids to go to school."

At the restaurant, the valet parked the convertible, and the maitre d' led us to our table. As I looked at the menu, I noticed someone. "Four o'clock," I said to Glenn. "Act natural."

He looked. "Bill? And his wife?"

I nodded. "That's an 11-year-old boy in her body. I don't know about you, but I'm more than a little curious how he persuaded her to get physical."

"Maybe the same way I did," he said.

"Maybe. Since I have the opportunity, I think I'll just make sure."

After we gave the waiter our orders, I got my chance. She got up and headed for the ladies' room. I decided to do likewise.

She saw me in the mirror. "Do I know you?"

"Elaine Sato. I work with Bill."

She relaxed. "Pleased to meet you. My name is Marcia."

"I've heard of you. Or, rather, I've heard about you. May I ask a question, just between us girls?"

"What is it?"

"How much of your relationship with Bill is your idea?"

"Everything after the Shift. I spent two weeks crying over finding myself with half my lifespan gone. Then, I came to three realizations."

"Oh?"

She counted them on her fingers. "One: All my crying hadn't made me an hour younger, so I had better give it up. Two: I had fallen in love with Bill. Three: I was sexually attracted to him, too." She took a breath. "I wasn't sure, at first, how to do what I wanted, but Bill is a good man. He helped me. Does that satisfy you?"

I nodded. "It does. I meant no insult, Marcia. I didn't know the circumstances, and, if it wasn't as respectful or respectable, I wanted to hear it from you. I'm glad to know I was wrong."

"I guess I can sympathize with you, Elaine. After all, I knew almost nothing about sex before this."
1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.title: Dining Out

1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.content:
I wasn't home long before I got notice of a Skype call. "I wonder who that could be?" I asked myself.

It was Evelyn. "Hi, Elaine."

"Hi, Evelyn. How are you doing?"

"I should be asking you that, after the news. Twins, huh? Really?"

"Yeppers." I stood up to show her my belly. "In a few weeks, you'll really see it."

"I've got some news of my own," she said. "I've decided to start transitioning."

"I'm happy for you, Evelyn."

"You, uh, know what that means, right? I mean, I'm gonna start with the big snip."

"I figured you'd want to do that at some point."

"Yeah, but it's your body we're talking about."

"Evelyn, this is my body, and that is your body. That's how it's been since the Shift. You didn't tell me what to do about being pregnant. Why would I tell you what to do about gender dysphoria?"

"Somebody's been doing some research."

"Between that and the pregnancy books, my credit cards don't know who I am anymore. Again, I'm happy for you, Evelyn."

"Maybe I can babysit for you?"

"You'll be the first person I call."

"I should warn you, I won't look the same by the time they're born. Doctors say weight gain is a side effect."

"Well, you just do what your doctor tells you, and let them worry about the things you can't control."

That put a smile on her face, a smile I was already looking forward to seeing a lot more of. "Thanks. 'Bye, Elaine."

"Goodbye, Evelyn."
1232121111111121121221111111111111111111.title: News from Evelyn

1232121111111121121221112.content:
I was just getting out of the shower, the next morning, when I was suddenly overcome by a wave of nausea. Running to the toilet, I bent over just in time to throw up. I spent the next 5 minutes doing that; wondering where everything was coming from since I hadn’t eaten much since yesterday.

Over the running faucet, I could hear a knock at the door. Grabbing a bathrobe off the bathroom door, I put it on and made my way to the door. Looking through the peephole, I saw Gloria standing there.

As soon as I opened the door, Gloria looked at me and said, “Good morning, Evan.”

Still feeling a little nauseous, I said, “It’s not going so good for me.”

It looked like Gloria was about to ask what I meant until she stopped. Taking a look at me, she said, “Are you alright?”

“Not particularly.” Stepping aside, I said, “I now know why women complain so much about morning sickness.”

“You still look a little green.” Walking inside, Gloria said, “Do you want some ginger ale or something?”

Closing the door, I said, “That sounds great.”

I made my way back to the bedroom while Gloria went into the kitchen. She came into the room a moment later with a small glass of ginger ale. Handing it to me, she said, “This should make you feel better.”

Taking a sip, I said, “Thanks.”

****************


After waiting a few minutes to let my stomach settle, Gloria and I went about getting me ready for another day at work. As I walked out of the bathroom wearing another dress that left little to the imagination, I looked at Gloria and said, “I really appreciate your help the last few days.”

“I’m glad to help.” Handing me a pair of heels, Gloria said, “Although I’m hoping that you can start taking care of this on your own.”

“I hope it doesn’t come to that.” Sitting in front of the vanity, I said, “I hope to be back in my own body before I have to learn how to do my hair and makeup.”

“I’m just saying.” Grabbing some eyeliner, Gloria said, “I’d like to get my own body back too, but we both have to understand that might not happen.”

It took 20 minutes for Gloria to get me ready. I had just finished putting on another pair of pantyhose, having put a run in the last pair, when I heard a knock at the door. Walking to the door, I opened it and saw the officer from last night standing there. “Good morning, Officer Perkins.” Looking at her nametag, I said, “How are you this morning?”

“I’m doing well, ma’am.” Smiling, she said, “How about you?”

“All things considered, I’m doing pretty well.”

As we walked down the hall to the stairs, I found myself looking at Officer Perkins. She looked to be only a few years younger than I currently was; looking very professional in her appearance. Walking down the stairs, she looked at me and said, “I finally remembered where I know you from."

“You mean other than on TV?”

“I was a crime reporter for a station in Oklahoma before the Shift. Then I found myself in this body.”

Stepping out into the lobby, I said, “Were you a man or woman before this?”

“I was a man.” Gesturing to her hair, and light makeup, she said, “Thankfully this woman’s girlfriend is helping me with my hair and makeup.”

“That’s good news.” Pausing, I said, “Anyway, you said you finally remembered where you knew me from?”

“Oh, right.” Chuckling, Officer Perkins said, “We met at the broadcasting convention in Vegas last month. There was a little drinking involved, and the two of us spent the night together.”

It didn’t take me long to realize what Officer Perkins meant. The woman standing next to me was the father of Elaine’s unborn baby. Looking at her, in shock, I said, “That was you?”

“I thought I recognized you last night, but I wasn't sure where I knew you from.” Opening the front passenger door, she said, “So how have you been?”

I had to admit I felt terrible about what was about to happen. I was about to change this woman’s world; possibly even more than it already was. Looking at her, I said, “I'm pregnant.”
1232121111111121121221112.title: Next Morning

12321211111111211212211121.content:
As I sat down in the passenger seat, I looked at Officer Perkins. The look on her face said it all; she clearly hadn’t expected me to tell her that. After she finally found her voice again, she looked at me and said, “A-Are you sure?”

Believe me, I wish I wasn’t. “I’m pretty sure; I had my first experience with morning sickness before you came over.” Looking at her, I said, “There’s also the pregnancy test that I took the other day.”

“I’ve been sharing a bed with another woman for the last few days.” Looking at me, Officer Perkins said, “But you telling me you’re pregnant, that’s something I didn’t expect.”

Sighing, I said, “I’m sorry for springing this on you like that.”

Walking around to the driver’s seat, Officer Perkins got into the car. Looking at me, she said, “I honestly have no idea what I’m supposed to do now.”

“You can do whatever you want.” Looking at her, I said, “You can be as involved as you want to be.”

“I should probably talk to Amanda about this first.” Turning to me, she said, “I’m not sure how to explain it, but I do feel something for her.”

I quickly realized Amanda was the name of the girlfriend. “What do you mean?”

“Last night, after dinner, I walked in on her taking a shower.” Blushing, Officer Perkins said, “It took all my strength not to strip naked and get in the shower with her.”

Hearing that, I remembered a dream that I’d had last night. I walked into Gloria’s condo and found him naked in the living room. Instead of leaving, I stripped naked and the two of us made love on the floor.

“I know how you feel.” Turning to Officer Perkins, I said, “My neighbor Gloria ended up in the body of a guy in his early 20s. Last night I had a dream where the two of us made love on the floor of his living room.”
12321211111111211212211121.title: Officer Perkins' Reaction

123212111111112112122111211.content:
After our little chat, Officer Perkins and I headed to the station. On the way there, I turned to her and said, “I hope you don’t mind my asking; but what was your name before all this?”

“My name is...was...Brian.” turning onto the main road, she said, “I suppose I shouldn’t be mad that you don’t remember my name; there was a fair amount of alcohol involved that night.”

“If you were a crime reporter before this, why are you working as a cop?”

“You can thank the Police Chief for that.” Pausing, Brian said, “Those of us that didn’t have any police experience, he put on babysitting duty.”

“For what it’s worth I’m glad you’re okay.”

Looking at me, Brian said, “I’m glad you’re okay too, Elaine.”

As we continued towards the Station, I started to feel bad about lying to Brian. Here she was, thinking that I was the woman she’d spent the night with a month ago.
123212111111112112122111211.title: Heading to the Station

1232121111111121121221112111.content:
The rest of the trip to the Station was quieter; although I could still tell that Brian wasn’t okay with the news I’d given her. Just as we were pulling into the station, I turned to her and said, “Thanks for the ride, Brian.” Pausing, I said, “I’m sorry if that bombshell put a damper on your day.”

“Don’t worry about me, I’ll be fine.” A smile on her face, Brian looked at me and said, “I have to stop by the Police Station to check-in, but I should be back in an hour or so to pick you up.”

After watching Brian drive off, I turned to head into the Station. I barely made it 10 feet before I heard someone call my name. “Elaine!”

Turning around, I saw Jackson getting out of a police cruiser. From the outfit she was wearing, a dress that showed a decent amount of cleavage, it seemed that she was getting more comfortable with her femininity. “Good morning, Jackson.” Smiling, I said, “I love that dress on you.”

“Believe me, this wasn’t my first choice.” Looking at me, she said, “I wanted to look professional for the cameras; it was this or the kind of dress you’d wear to a club.”

Hugging her, I said, “I still think you look great.”

“I wish I shared that opinion, I look slovenly compared to you.” Gesturing to my outfit, she said, “I don’t know how you do it; the world is in shambles, but you still look absolutely amazing.”

If only you knew the truth, Jackson. With a smile, I said, “I’m a reporter; I always try to look my best.”

As we turned to walk into the Station, Jackson said, “Did anything new happen since last night?”

“Well I had my first bout with morning sickness this morning.” Opening the door, I said, “On a somewhat related note, it turns out that Officer Perkins is the father of my baby.”

On any other day, I would have found it strange to say a 25-year-old woman was the father of my baby. But all that went out the window when I ended up in Elaine’s body. “I suppose shouldn’t be surprised by that.” Walking in behind me, Jackson said, “After all, I’m a 55-year-old man in the body of a 27-year-old woman.”

As we headed down the hall to Elaine’s desk, I looked at Jackson and said, “How about you? Did anything interesting happen to you?”

“Yes, actually it did.” Looking at me, Jackson said, “I heard from the original occupant of my body. It turns out that she didn’t end up in my body after all; instead, she ended up in high school cheerleader in Arizona.”

I was surprised to hear that, as I’d expected that those who’d swapped would end up in the other person’s body. Turning to Jackson, I was about to say something when we were approached by a teenage girl wearing a headset. Looking at me, she said,
“Elaine, Phil wants to see all the anchors in the conference room.”

“Okay.” Turning to Jackson, I said, “I’ll catch up to you later, Jackson.”

“No rush, I’m probably just going to be hanging out in the break room.”

After waving goodbye to Jackson, I walked down the hall to the conference room. Going inside, I found Diane sitting with a few people I didn’t recognize. There was a young boy in overalls sitting in the corner and an African-American woman, who was probably a few years older than me.

As I took a seat next to Diane, I looked at her and said, “I don’t see Keith.”

“I doubt we’ll be seeing Keith anytime soon.”

“What do you mean?” fearing the worst, I said, “Did something happen to him?”

“It seems that the parents of his new body tracked him down.” Looking at me, Diane said, “They said he may have been Keith Houseman before, but now she’s Mary-Katherine Loftus. Since none of her nine siblings are on TV, they didn’t think it was appropriate for her to be. They’re sending her back to St. Anne’s.”

The thought of Keith attending Catholic school as a girl made me smile. “I’d be lying if I said she didn’t deserve that.”

“Keith...err Mary-Katherine isn’t the only one missing.” Looking at me, Diane said, “Richard went into labor last night; after 5 hours of labor he gave birth to a baby boy.”

Before I could say anything, Phil walked into the room. Closing the door, Phil said, “Glad to see most of us are here.”

“I don’t see why you had us all come in, Phil.” Looking at him, the 5-year-old boy said, “There are only four of us left who are in any condition to go on the air.”

“We have to make do with what we have, Melanie.” With a sigh, Phil looked at everyone present and said, “For now, we’ll be relying on Diane and Elaine to report the news.”

“If you’re just going to use Diane and Elaine, then what are Kevin and I doing here?” Gesturing to the African-American woman, Melanie said, “We’re all anchors here, so use us.”

“For now I think it’s best if Diane and Elaine are the faces people see when they turn on the TV.” Pausing, Phil said, “Elaine wasn’t affected by the Shift, and Diane’s new body isn’t all that different from her old one.”

“Except that it’s 25 years younger.” Joining in the conversation, Kevin said, “Come on Phil, just tell us why you don’t want to use us on air.”

“I was going to, Kevin, until you both interrupted me.” Sighing, Phil said, “I’m not going to use you as anchors for the time being; because I’m going to have you both working as correspondents in the field.”

“I suppose that could work.” Pausing, letting the news sink in, Melanie said, “You want us to talk with those affected; see how they’re coming to terms?”

“That’s right; I figure it would be a good way for people to help each other.” Smiling, Phil said, “Who knows, I might even go out in the field.”

I could tell Kevin was in agreement; but before he could say anything, a technician ran into the room. “Phil, some sort of emergency broadcast just popped up on the TV.”

Phil quickly turned on the TV, flipping through the channels until she saw the image of an empty podium. Turning to everyone in the room, she said, “I wonder what this is all about.”
1232121111111121121221112111.title: Arriving at the Station

12321211111111211212211121111.content:
Everyone in the room waited patiently for someone to appear on the screen. While we waited, Diane looked at me and said, “I hope they’re announcing that they can reverse this.”

“I’m surprised to hear you say that; especially after how excited you were when you found out you were pregnant.”

“That was before I had a chance to process what was going on.” Taking a breath, Diane said, “Don’t get me wrong, I’m overjoyed by the idea of having a baby. If this does turn out to be permanent, I’ll be the best mother I can be. It’s just that part of me wants my old body back.”

I know how you feel; I want my old life back too. Before I could say anything a young girl, probably no more than 10 years old, walked onstage and went behind the podium. Some text appeared on the screen that identified her as Major Derek Hunt. “Ladies and Gentlemen, my name is Major Derek Hunt; I’m the Deputy Press Secretary for the Department of Defense.”

Briefly looking away from the conference room TV, I looked outside and saw the broadcast on every screen in the Station.
Leaning over to Diane, I said, “This must be on every station in the country.”

“Over the last few days, scientists from around the world have been trying to find out everything they can about the phenomenon that caused 90% of the world’s population to swap bodies. While they’re no closer to discovering a cause for this, they have made an unsettling discovery.” Taking a deep breath, Major Hunt said, “They’ve discovered that there is no way to reverse the swaps.”

The Major was suddenly overwhelmed by the reactions of people in the audience. There were several audible gasps in the conference room as well; along with a few screams from outside the room. I was on the verge of panicking when Diane took my hand in hers. Turning to her, I quickly realized it wasn’t for my benefit; Diane had gone pale. Looking at her, I said, “We’ll get through this, Diane.”

“You’re a good friend, Elaine.” Looking at me, seeing the frightened expression on my face, she said, “You’re concerned for everyone else; even though you’re still in your original body.”

The hell I am! I’m supposed to be a 15-year-old boy, not stuck as a 30-year-old pregnant woman!

Once the noise died down, Major Hunt continued. “While I’m sure this isn’t the news many of wanted to hear, myself included, this is now our new reality. In the coming weeks, the Federal Government will take a census of those who were affected, those who weren’t and those...who are missing.”

With that, the broadcast ended and the image was replaced by static. Everyone in the room turned their attention to Phil; who was trying her best to keep herself together. Turning to me, she said, “Elaine, we’re going to need Dr. Webber and you on the air as soon as possible.”

“I’m not sure I can that, Phil...”

“We need your strength, Elaine.” Walking over to me, she said, “You pulled this city out of panicked rioting, now we need you to prevent more.”

“Alright.” Pulling myself together, I said, “But I’m afraid I’ll have to leave after I’m finished; this morning sickness is getting the best of me.”

“Absolutely.” Pausing, Phil said, “We'll run it on repeat all day.”
12321211111111211212211121111.title: Continue

123212111111112112122111211111.content:
I walked out of the conference room with the others; everyone still in shock from the announcement. As I walked through the halls, in a daze, I spotted Jackson sitting at a table in the break room. I don’t know why, but my concern for her overrode the concern for myself.

Walking into the room, I went to the table and sat down. Looking at her, I could tell she’d been crying. “Are you alright, Jackson?”

“No, not really.” Wiping her eyes with a napkin, she looked at me and said, “That wasn’t the news I was expecting.”

I know how you feel. “I’m sure you’ll come to terms with this; if you just give it time.”

“I hope you’re right.”

“Phil wants us both on the air in a few minutes.” Taking her hand, I said, “If you’re not up to it, I’ll understand.”

“No, I can do it.” Taking a breath, Jackson said, “I suppose going on the air will help me to process this.”

***************************


After our little pep talk, Jackson and I made our way to the set. We sat down just as Phil was getting the cameras ready. Once he counted us down, as had become routine over the last few days, I turned to the camera and started talking. “Good morning, this is Elaine Sato with the latest on the Great Shift. Just moments ago the US government announced a development in their investigation – the Great Shift is permanent.”

I paused for a few seconds to let that sink in; even though I wasn’t certain there were many people watching. “With us in the studio is Dr. Jackson Webber; who will help us to understand the Government’s announcement.” Turning to Jackson, I said, “Thank you for joining us again, Doctor.”

“Thank you, Elaine; although I suspect that I’ll be changing my name in the near future.” Pausing, she said, “As you said, the circumstances that resulted in the Shift cannot be duplicated; which means that for the countless victims around the world, myself included, there’s no going back to our original bodies.”

“Is there anything that wasn’t in the broadcast that you feel is worth mentioning?”

“As a matter of fact, there is.” Looking at me, she said, “Those of us who have switched have begun to notice certain traits for our new bodies’ original owners bleeding through into our own personalities.”

Listening to that, I started to realize that might explain why I was becoming less uncomfortable dressing in such a feminine manner. “Can you explain that a little more?”

“An example of this would be if a man finds himself in a woman’s body, he’ll find himself becoming more feminine; likewise a woman in a man’s body will become more masculine.” Pausing, she said, “I would even go so far as to suggest one’s sexual orientation might change as a result of being in someone else’s body.”

That would certainly explain my last night. “Thank you, Doctor.” Pausing, I said, “For Channel 7 News, I’m Elaine Sato.”

Once the cameras had stopped rolling, I removed the microphone and quickly left the studio. After retrieving my things from what was now my desk, I turned to leave when I felt a hand on my shoulder. Turning around, I saw Jackson standing there. “What can I do for you, Jackson?”

“I was hoping we could speak privately, Elaine.”

“I was just about to go home, but I suppose that can wait.” Taking a breath, I said, “Follow me; we can talk in the conference room.”

The two of us walked through the bullpen and into the conference room. As I closed the door, Jackson said, “I just wanted to make sure you’re doing alright.”

“I’m fine.” With a smile, I said, “I’m just not feeling well.”

“Are you sure?” concerned, Jackson said, “You’ve been acting strangely since that announcement. Are you alright?”

I don’t know what possessed me to do so, but suddenly I found myself wanting to come clean to Jackson. “I suppose I might as well tell you.” Sighing, I said, “I’m not really Elaine Sato.”
123212111111112112122111211111.title: The Broadcast

1232121111111121121221112111111.content:
“I see.” Sitting down, Jackson looked at me and said, “Then who are you really?”

“Until two days ago, I was a 15-year-old boy named Evan.”

I proceeded to explain everything that happened from when I woke up in Elaine’s body to now. When I was finished, Jackson looked at me and said, “Let me see if I understand this.” Taking a breath, she continued, “You’re a 15-year-old High School student who, without even thinking of the consequences, took an innocent woman’s life as your own?”

“I did think of the consequences.”

“Evidently not hard enough.” Sighing, Jackson looked at me and said, “What if the real Elaine is still alive and wants her life back?”

I hadn’t thought of that. “What do you want me to say, Jackson?” Looking at Jackson, I said, “Everyone was in a panic; they needed me to be Elaine.”

“You could have simply told them the truth; that you weren’t the woman they thought you were.”

“That’s just the thing.” Sitting down next to Jackson, I said, “The more time goes by, I think I’m becoming that woman.”'

“What’s that supposed to mean?”

“It’s like you said during the broadcast, about the two different personalities merging together.” Gesturing to my outfit, I said, “Take this outfit, for instance, I picked this out myself. I’ve also noticed I’m much more comfortable in women’s clothing than I was when this started.”

“I don’t know what to tell you...Evan.” standing up, Jackson looked at me and said, “If you’re looking to me for forgiveness and understanding, you won’t find it. You lied to me and to everyone in that newsroom.”

“Please Jackson, I tho...I thought we were friends.”

“I thought so too; until you told me this.” Grabbing her things, Jackson headed towards the door. Before reaching it, she turned to look at me and said, “I have half a mind to go out there and expose you to everyone.”

Getting up from the chair, I rushed out the door to stop her. Thankfully she didn’t make it very far; as everyone was watching two police officers walk into the bullpen holding a baby. “Is one of you here in the body of Grace McKinnon?”

“That would be me, officers.” Stepping forward, Phil said, “What seems to be the problem?”

The other officer walked over and placed the baby in Phil’s arms. “This little guy is yours now.” Pausing, she said, “His name is Luke.”
1232121111111121121221112111111.title: Dr. Webber's Reaction

12321211111111211212211121111111.content:
The look on Phil’s face was the same one I had when I saw the results of that pregnancy test. Looking at the baby in her arms, she said, “How...Where did he come from?”

“We don’t have all the details; but from what we’ve been able to find out, Ms. McKinnon’s mother would babysit the baby when she was at work.” Pausing, one of the officers said, “When the Shift happened, the mother was switched and whoever ended up in her body took one look at the baby and left.”

Taking her eyes off the squirming baby in her arms, Phil said, “How does that explain why the baby is suddenly my responsibility?”

“Some neighbors heard him crying and called us.” Looking at Phil, the officer said, “We weren’t sure what to do until Ms. McKinnon’s mother called this morning to check on Luke; from there we put two and two together.”

“Wait just a minute.” Handing me the baby, Phil said, “Just because I’m in Grace’s body doesn’t mean...”

I don’t know what was said after Phil handed me the baby; because all my attention was focused on him. What if I dropped him?
What if he hit his head on something while we were walking. What if he didn’t get into college? What if he didn’t like me?

While those thoughts, and more, ran through my head Luke just stared at me. I started to wonder what was going through his little mind; if there was something he wanted but couldn’t tell me. I soon got an answer when Luke started crying. Someone in the back then said, “That’s your baby alright, Phil.”

Taking my attention off of Luke, I looked up and saw two wet spots on Phil’s blouse; right over her nipples. Taking Luke back, Phil said, “If there’s anyone who’s had experience nursing, I could use a little advice.”
12321211111111211212211121111111.title: Phil's Introduction To Motherhood

123212111111112112122111211111111.content:
One of the officers, a woman a few years older than I was now, said, “Follow me into your office, I can tell you everything you need to know.”

“Okay, thanks.” Looking at everyone in the room, Phil said, “I guess everyone can just call it a day.”

Everyone started to leave after Phil said that. Looking around, I didn’t see Jackson anywhere. I suppose I should be grateful that she hadn’t outed me like she’d said she would. Walking out of the station, waving goodbye to Diane as she left in Roger’s cruiser, I spotted Brian waiting for me in the parking lot.

Neither of us said much during the ride home; probably because we were both shocked by the news. Arriving back at my building, I got out of the car. Turning around, I said, “Brian, do you want to come in or something?”

No, I think I’ll just go home.” Sighing, Brian said, “I suppose now would be a good time to tell Amanda that you’re pregnant.”
“I’m sorry if I put you in an awkward situation.”

Brian’s face was full of emotion when she looked at me. “It’s not your fault.” Scoffing, Brian said, “I suppose this is what I get for not using a condom.”

I felt awful about the whole situation, springing something like this on Brian while she was dealing with the fact she was in a woman’s body. Looking at her, I said, “Is there anything I can do to help?”

“Isn’t that something I should be asking you?” looking at me, she said, “What I have with Amanda is like nothing I’ve ever had before. She...”

Looking at Brian, I could tell what she meant from the expression on her face. “It's ok, Brian; I'm not offended.”

“I do want to be there for you and the baby, but I also want to be there for Amanda.” Resting her head on the steering wheel, without looking at me, Brian said, “This whole situation is crazy and I don’t know how to handle it.”

Reaching through the window, I placed a hand on her shoulder. “You take it one day at a time, just like the rest of us."
123212111111112112122111211111111.title: Heading Home

1232121111111121121221112111111111.content:
After Brian drove off, I walked inside the building. Walking by the mailboxes, I don’t know what possessed me to do so; but I decided to check the mail. It was mostly garbage, but there was an invitation to Elaine’s 10 Year Reunion. In light of the news, I realized it was now my 10 Year Reunion.

Heading upstairs, I was about to enter my condo when I heard Gloria’s voice behind me. “Is that you, Evan?”

Walking to Gloria’s closed door, I said, “Yeah, it’s me.”

I heard footsteps approaching from behind the door. It wasn’t long before Gloria opened the door and looked at me. “You don’t look so good, sweetie.”

“I haven’t had the best day, Gloria.” Walking into the condo, I said, “It seems like everything has gone wrong for me today.”

“I heard the announcement about the Shift.” Closing the door, Gloria said, “How are you taking it?”

“How do you think?” tearing up, I said, “I’m stuck in the body of a pregnant woman who’s twice my age.”

Walking me to his couch, Gloria said, “Need I remind you, I’m also stuck in an unfamiliar body.”

“I know, but it’s not really the same.” Sighing, I looked at Gloria and said, “Yeah I know you’re in a man’s body now, but you’re also 20 years younger.”

“Under the circumstances, I think it’s alright if we’re both a little testy.”

“It’s not just that, Gloria.” Wiping tears from my eyes, I said, “I told Jackson who I really was, and she didn’t take it very well.”

“Oh?” concerned, Gloria said, “How exactly did she take it?”

“She said I stole an innocent woman’s life for my own benefit.” Pausing, I said, “That I’ve been lying to everyone the last few days.”

“Well, she’s not exactly wrong.” Seeing the look on my face, Gloria said, “After you left yesterday morning, I was angered by the idea that you were masquerading as a woman I’ve known for 5 years.”

“What made you come around?”

“I reminded myself of the situation you were in; finding yourself in the body of an older woman.” Standing up, Gloria walked towards the porch door. “I don’t think anyone, or anything, could have prepared us for this...Great Shift.”

I watched as Gloria balled his trembling hands into fists and slammed them against the glass. As I sat there watching Gloria, I started to worry that I was losing the one constant that I’d found since the world went crazy. “Gloria, I-I’m so sorry.”

“Sorry? Why would you be sorry?” turning to look at me, Gloria said, “I’m the one who should be apologizing to you; I was so close to ratting you out yesterday. I was worried that you would ruin my friend’s life.”

Standing up, I walked towards Gloria but didn’t go all the way. I felt as though the world around me was collapsing. Looking at Gloria, I said, “What changed your mind?”

“I got to know you, and see you in action.” Looking at me, Gloria said, “I came to realize the huge risk you were taking, not just for yourself but for our whole town.”

I felt as though my heart was beating a mile a minute; caught between the fear of losing him and something else. “Gloria, I-I don’t know what to say.”

“After Elaine’s parents died, I looked at her like a daughter.” Looking at me, Gloria said, “But you've become so much more than that. I’m sorry for...”

Before Gloria could finish his sentence, I closed the gap between us and kissed him. I could tell he was surprised, but he quickly returned the kiss with a passion that I hadn’t expected. He cradled my face in his hands and pulled me in. It wasn’t long before his hands were roaming the curves of my new body.

Without saying a word to each other, we started towards the bedroom; kissing and taking off our clothes as we went.

We were both naked by the time we reached the bedroom; lying on the bed, we soon went a lot further than kissing.
1232121111111121121221112111111111.title: Going Inside

12321211111111211212211121111111111.content:
I won’t bore you with all the intimate details; because frankly a woman is allowed to have her secrets. But sufficed it to say my first experience with sex – not just as a woman, but ever – was more incredible then I’d ever imagined. My eyes rolled back into my head, I made some incoherent noises and I experienced several amazing orgasms – just from the one session.

I must’ve fallen asleep afterward because I woke up to Gloria running his hand along my waist. Rolling over, I rested my head on Gloria’s chest. Looking at me, he said, “Was that good for you?”

“I-I don’t know.” Looking at him, I said, “A few days ago I was an ordinary teenage boy, but now…”

Sitting up, Gloria said, “We didn’t rush into this, did we?”

“I don’t even know what this is.” Sitting up in bed, leaning against Gloria, I said, “I don’t even know if I was fully in control; it was like my body was on autopilot.”

************************


I stayed in bed with Gloria for another hour or so; until I decided it was time for me to leave. After saying goodbye to Gloria, I gathered my clothes and went back to my condo. It felt weird thinking that – but now, with the Shift being permanent, it was my condo.

Letting myself into the condo, I walked into the bedroom. After dropping the clothes in a hamper, I made my way into the bathroom. Having just experienced the plethora of sensations associated with sex, I wasn’t nervous about taking a bath in my new body.

After letting the tub fill up, I disrobed and climbed in. I laid in the tub, soaking in the scented bubble bath, thinking about everything that happened over the last few days. As I lay there, I found myself replaying Jackson’s lecture in my head. Deep down, I knew she was right; but I feared it was too late for me to come clean.
12321211111111211212211121111111111.title: Post-Sex

123212111111112112122111211111111111.content:
After getting out of the tub, I got dressed and made my way into the living room. Sitting down at the desk in the corner, I turned on the computer. I was somewhat surprised to find that Elaine didn’t have a password – a problem I remedied as soon as I’d logged in.

With everything that’s happened, I wasn’t too surprised by how slow the internet was. While I waited for the email app to open, I focused on a framed photo on the desk. Looking at it, I saw it was a picture of Elaine and two other girls on a beach.
Looking at the photo, I couldn’t help but think - There’s no way I’ll be able to wear that bikini next summer. I'd look ridiculous in anything except a freaking tent. I quickly realized what was happening; my mind was starting to change rapidly. I started to wonder if there’d be anything left of the old Evan when it was finished, or if I’d even remember that I was once a boy.

When the email app finally opened, I was created by 8 unread emails; most of which were spam. After deleting the spam, I was left with an email from Phil about a staff meeting tomorrow and another from Richard Thorpe – who I remembered had gone into labor last night. Opening the email I saw a photo of a blonde-haired girl, no older than I’d been before the Shift, holding a baby. The caption underneath said:

IT’S A BOY! 8LBS 5 OZ!


I had just finished sending my congratulations when there was a knock at the door. Getting up, I walked to the door and opened it to find Gloria standing there. “I was just coming to see how you’re doing.”

“I’m doing better, I guess.” Getting up, I said, “I was just about to make some dinner, do you want some?”

“Sure.”

We ate. We watched another movie together. And then I invited Gloria into my bedroom for another round of lovemaking. This time, I replaced the incoherent noises with shouts of "YES!"
123212111111112112122111211111111111.title: Back in My Condo

1232121111111121121221112111111111111.content:
Gloria went back to his apartment after we finished; which I didn't mind. Together, we had taken my mind off the news of the day, but I didn't know if I was ready for anything serious.

When I woke up the next morning, I felt much better than I had the day before. Today was a new day and I was going to start it on the right foot. After taking a shower, I made some breakfast but quickly realized how futile it was – as it soon came right back up.
Standing in front of the bathroom mirror, having just finished brushing teeth, I thought to myself - That’s par for the course when you’re having a baby.

As I spit into the sink, I realized that was the first time I’d thought of the pregnancy in that way. It sounded good, almost positive. Looking at the mirror, I tried to imagine what I’d look like in a few months when I started to show. “I’m having a baby.” Placing a hand on my stomach, smiling, I said, “I’m going to be a mother.”

********************************


It took me 20 minutes to get ready for work; although I was a little worried about doing it without Gloria’s help. I’d chosen to wear a lavender skirt suit and, although it took some doing, I managed to get my hair into a bun.

I had just finished doing my makeup when I heard a knock at the door. Making my way through the condo, I opened the door and saw Gloria standing there. “Good morning, Gloria.”

“Good morning.” Looking at me, he said, “I was coming over to see if you needed help getting ready, but I guess you don’t.”

With a smile, I spun around and said, “How do I look?”

“You look great.” Smiling, Gloria said, “You’re the definition of a professional woman.”

“Thank you.” Chuckling, I said, “I learned from the best.”

“What are the chances you’ll get off work early today?”

“It depends on what happens at the meeting.” Grabbing my purse, I said, “Why?”

“Barring anything major, I don’t see any reason I won’t be able to leave after the meeting.” Grabbing my purse, I said, “Why?”

“I was thinking we’d spend the day teaching you another aspect of being an adult.”

Looking at Gloria, I said, “What exactly did you have in mind?”

“With the roads opening up soon, I think it’s time for you to have a quick course in driving.”

“I took some basic classes at school to prepare for my learners permit.” Pausing, I said, “But I don’t have a car, and yours is probably still at the grocery store, how am I going to learn to drive?”

“You do have a car, Evan.” Chuckling, Gloria said, “It’s where Elaine left it; parked at the Station.”
1232121111111121121221112111111111111.title: The Next Morning

12321211111111211212211121111111111111.content:
After saying goodbye to Gloria, I walked down to the parking lot where I found Brian waiting for me. Once I got into the car, it was a quick 15-minute drive to the Station. When we arrived there, Brian said, “I’m not sure I’ll be able to pick you up after work.”
Looking at me, she said, “The Chief wants to talk with those of us who switched into police officers.”

“That’s no big deal.” Getting out of the car, I said, “My car should still be here.”

“If you get pulled over on the way home, just show the officer your ID.” Leaning towards the window, Brian said, “We have a list of essential personal who are allowed on the streets right now.”

“Okay, thanks for the tip.” Smiling, I said, “I’ll see you later, Brian.”

After Brian drove off, I made my way into the Station. Walking through the bullpen, I saw a large handmade card for Richard on the counter. After signing my good wishes, I left my purse at my desk and walked into the conference room.

There were some people I recognized; mainly Diane and Kevin, but there were a few people I didn’t know. I also saw two men sitting across from Diane; who I quickly realized were Bill Donohue and Pat Anders, the weekend anchors. I wondered where Melanie was until I spotted her playing with some toy cars in the corner of the room.

As I went to take a seat, a few of the strangers came over and thanked me for the work I’d over the last few days. I sat down just as Jackson entered the room. With the way people were acting around me, I figured she hadn’t outed me yet. I had to wonder when she planned to make her move.

Before long, Phil walked into the room with Luke in her arms; I also spotted a lightweight towel covering Luke’s face and half of Phil’s chest. I didn’t have to be a genius to know she was breastfeeding.

Sitting down at the head of the table, adjusting the blanket with her free hand, Phil said, “I’m glad to see most of us are here.”
Looking around, she said, For the benefit of everyone here, why doesn’t everyone who’s in a different body say your name.”

Kevin was the first one to speak. Standing up, she said, “I’m Kevin Sylvester, the station’s political correspondent.” Pausing, she said, “I’m not sure how the Shift will affect the political landscape; what with our president missing and the vice president in the body of a 20-year-old woman.”

After Kevin sat down, a woman stood up. “I’m Brooke Mitchell,” gesturing to Melanie, who was still playing with the toy cars, she said, “Melanie is in my son’s body.”

Looking at Brooke, as she sat down, I said. “If you don’t mind my asking, Ms. Mitchell; what’s wrong with Melanie?” pausing, I said, “When I saw her yesterday, she seemed pretty much like her old self.”

“It seems that the news of the Shift being permanent caused Melanie to have a mental breakdown.” Sighing, Brooke said, “She still has her memories, at least for the moment, but she’s got the emotional maturity of a 5-year-old now.”

As if to prove her point, Melanie stood up and walked over to Brooke. Pulling on her arm, she said, “Mommy, I’m thirsty.”

“Okay, sweetie.” Taking a juice box out of her purse, Brooke handed it to Melanie and said, “Go back to playing with your toys.”

Once Melanie returned to her cars, I looked at Brooke and said, “What does that mean for Melanie?” confused, I said, “I don’t see how she’d be able to do her job in her current condition.”

“That’s why we came here today.” Sighing, Brooke looked to Phil and said, “I’m afraid Melanie won’t be able to continue working here. My husband and I have decided to raise her as our son; which means, once the schools open up again, she’ll be starting Kindergarten.”

I felt a pang of sadness when I heard that. Although I barely knew Melanie, I wouldn’t wish her situation on anyone. Turning to the one unfamiliar face left, a man in his early 40s, Phil said, “Who might you be?”

“I’m Chad White; your co-worker Richard Thorpe is in my niece’s body.” Pausing, Chad said, “She sent me here to find out about her employment status.”

“You can tell her that, as far as I’m concerned, she’s been on maternity leave since the Shift.” Looking at Chad, Phil said, “There’s an on-air job waiting for her when she comes back; or until she decides she doesn’t want it anymore.”

Chad left after that, followed soon after by Brooke and Melanie. Once they were gone, Phil turned to Bill and Pat, “I’d like you guys to take over the reporting for the next few days; give Diane and Elaine some time off.”

“That sounds good to me, boss.”

“Elaine, I want you to interview Dr. Webber one last time before you take some well deserved time off.” Pausing, Phil said,
“Update our viewers with that’s going on behind the scenes here, then you and Dr. Webber will be discussing a new angle – adults who wound up in the bodies of infants.”

I wasn’t looking forward to the prospect of working with Jackson, but I didn’t want to let Phil down. Looking at her, I said, “Okay Phil.”
12321211111111211212211121111111111111.title: At The Station

123212111111112112122111211111111111111.content:
Everyone left once the meeting was adjourned; everyone except for that it is. I wasn’t exactly eager to give Jackson a chance to corner me. Walking over to Phil, I said, “How’s motherhood treating you, Phil?”

“I found out why my boobs were so sore; it turns out they were just engorged from not nursing for two days.”

“That would definitely do it.” Smiling, I said, “You seem to be handling this whole thing pretty well.”

“I’m trying my best, but I’m still new at this.” Checking on Luke, she said, “I think he’s done; time for his nap.”

I followed Phil out of the conference to her office; where I saw a crib and a changing table had been set up. Looking around, I said, “You’ve been busy.”

“The police escorted me to Grace’s apartment last night; let me grab what I needed.” Placing Luke in the crib, Phil said, “For now, any new moms will be able to use my office for nursing.”

“That’s a good idea Phil, but neither Diane nor myself are due for 9 months.”

“Which will give me time to renovate that spare office Keith liked to use with the girls.” Sitting down at her desk, Phil said, “When
I’m done with it, it’ll be a deluxe nursery; rocking chairs, cribs, changing tables, soft lighting, and ambient music...the works. I don't want anyone else to come here thinking they need to hide a baby.”

Before I could say anything, Kevin walked into the office. “Elaine, there’s something outside that you need to see.”

My curiosity was peaked as I followed Kevin upstairs to a patio; one that was usually used for outdoor segments. Today, however, the patio was full of people looking at something across the street. I managed to maneuver my way through to the railing, where I saw what everyone was looking at. There were dozens of people standing in a parking lot across the street, holding a large banner that read: WE U ELAINE!

Someone across the street must’ve spotted me on the patio because soon everyone was cheering and waving at me. Looking at the crowd, I thought - They love me.

As I stood there, taking in the view, I felt a hand on my shoulder; followed by a familiar voice. “You've touched their lives, haven't you?”

Turning around, I saw Jackson standing behind me; a smile on her face.
123212111111112112122111211111111111111.title: Continue

1232121111111121121221112111111111111111.content:
The look on Jackson’s face was creeping me out; part of me wanted to tell her to just get it over with. Looking at her, I said, “Let’s get this interview done, shall we?”

“Okay.”

Jackson and I walked downstairs to the studio. Once we took our seats, a technician came over to place our microphones. When that was finished, a young woman walked over to us. “Phil is taking a nap while the baby naps.” Looking at us, she said, “I’ll be working with you two today.”

Once the woman stepped back, she counted us down and we began. “Good morning, I’m Elaine Sato. We begin this morning with updates about some of our Channel 7 family.” Pausing, I said, “Evening anchor Richard Thorpe recently gave birth to a healthy baby boy; 8lbs 5oz. My fellow morning anchor, Keith Houseman, has left Channel 7 and will be living his new identity as a Catholic schoolgirl. Melanie George will also be leaving us; due, in part, to the fact that she’s now a 5-year-old boy.”

I paused for a few seconds to catch my breath. “As shocking as this information might seem, things could’ve been much worse for them.” Looking at Jackson, I said, “Our guest, Dr. Jackson Webber will explain. Good morning, Dr. Webber.”

“Good morning, Elaine.” Pausing, Jackson said, “As you mentioned, things could have been much worse for your colleagues. We have received information suggesting that many teens, and adults, have ended up with the minds of infants. This has led to the staggering conclusion that there are teens, and adults, trapped in the bodies of infants.”

“What might be their reaction to such an occurrence?”

“We have no way of knowing for certain; as an infant’s body simply isn’t developed enough to communicate on that level.”

“What is the long-term prognosis in cases like that?”

“For those infants, who found themselves in older bodies, attempts will be made to help them adjust to their new lives; this includes teaching them to speak, read and write.” Pausing, Jackson said, “Unfortunately for those in infant bodies, there’s no way to tell the effect this will have on them. It may be that, over time, their minds will regress into infancy.”

"Thank you for joining us, Doctor.” Looking at the camera, I said, “For Channel 7 News, I'm Elaine Sato."
1232121111111121121221112111111111111111.title: The Interview

1232121111111121121221112111111111111111.content:
The technician came to remove the microphones the instant the interview was over. Once that was done, I brought Jackson into the ladies’ room. With the door closed, I looked at her and said, “Thank you for not telling anyone about me, Jackson.”

“Believe me, I had every intention of telling them.” Looking at me, Jackson said, “That was until I realized two things.”

“What do you mean?”

“If I tried to tell them, I’m not certain they would believe me.” Taking a breath, Jackson said, “The only reason they’ve been able to cope with everything that’s happened is because of you. For better or worse, their identities are wound up in you; if I tried to challenge you, they’d think I was challenging them as well.”

“I don’t know what you mean.”

“Whatever your intentions were for starting down this road; you’ve inspired thousands, if not hundreds of thousands, of people to make it through another day. That banner may have Elaine’s name on it, but it’s clear the message is for you.” Looking at me, Jackson paused, “I’m not ready to forgive you yet, but I won’t cause you any trouble.”

“Thank you.”

*********************************


Jackson and I walked out of the Station a short time later. Standing by the sidewalk, Jackson looked at me. “You seem more at peace today than when I saw you yesterday.” Pausing, she said, “And I’m sure my promising to keep your secret isn’t the reason.”

“That’s a big part of it; but you’re right, it’s not the only reason.” Smiling, I said, “I’m not sure why I’m happier today; maybe I’m thinking enough like a woman that it doesn’t bother me. Maybe it’s the baby. Maybe it’s the sex.”

I could tell Jackson hadn’t expected to hear that. Looking at me, she said, “You had sex?”

“Twice.” Nodding, I said, “Yesterday afternoon, and then again last night.”

“That’s amazing.” Shocked, Jackson said, “I don’t think I’m ready to go quite that far.”

As Jackson’s police escort showed up, I looked to her and said, “I can understand you not being ready to forgive me.” Pausing, I said, “But I hope that we can be friends.”

“Let’s take it one day at a time.” Looking at me, Jackson said, “Goodnight, Elaine.”
1232121111111121121221112111111111111111.title: Confronting Jackson

1232121111111121121221112111111111111111.content:
Once Jackson left, I dug through my purse until I found a set of car keys. I started to wonder why they hadn’t been attached to my regular keys until I saw a tag from an auto mechanic.

Getting an idea, I walked behind the building to the entrance to the station’s garage. Walking down the ramp, I pressed the unlock button until I heard a distant beep echo through the area. Occasionally pressing the button to ensure I was going in the right direction, I soon found myself standing next to a nice convertible. I could get used to driving this.

After getting into the car, I made sure to buckle in. Before I started the car, I took off my heels - I was already inexperienced at driving, I didn't need to throw heels into the mix. Once I was ready to go, I started the car and pulled out of the garage; waving at Phil as she walked out of the station with Luke in a baby carrier.

With the curfew still in effect, there weren’t any cars on the road; but I still kept an eye on my speed anyway. So you can imagine my surprise when, as I was turning on to Main Street, a police car came up behind me – its lights flashing and everything.

Pulling over, I started to look for my registration as the officer walked towards me. I was looking through the glove box when the officer said, “How’s your day going, ma’am?”

Looking at the officer, I did a double-take when I realized it was Brian. “It was going pretty well until now.” Pausing, I said, “I could swear I was going the speed limit.”

“Sorry, I couldn’t resist when I saw you driving by.” Chuckling, Brian said, “Don’t worry, you’re not in trouble. I just wanted you to meet someone.”

Brian turned to the cruiser and made a gesture; I watch as a woman, about Brian’s age, walked over to me. As she got closer, I realized she was wearing an EMT’s uniform. “How do you do, Ms. Sato?” looking at me, she said, “I’m Amanda Richter; I understand you know my, uh, girlfriend.”

“She’s the father of my baby.” Looking at her, I said, “I want you to know that I don’t want to come between the two of you.”

“I’m not worried about that.” Pausing, Amanda said, “I just wanted to meet you; since I get the feeling we’ll be seeing a lot of each other in the coming months.”

“I’d like that; my baby can have two very special aunties.” Turning to Brian, I said, “I just realized, given how the Shift is permanent, I can’t keep calling you Brian.”

“Amanda and I were talking about that last night, actually.” Looking at me, Brian said, “Her girlfriend’s name was Colleen, but I’m not certain I’m comfortable with taking her name.”

It’s easier then you might think. “So what can I call you then?”

“Brianna.” Smiling, she said, “It’s simple and easy to remember.”

“Well then, Brianna and Amanda.” Writing down my address, and phone number, I said, “Once everything settles, perhaps the three of us can get together.”
1232121111111121121221112111111111111111.title: Continue

1232121111111121121221112111111111111111.content:
Gloria was walking out from around the corner of the building when I pulled into the parking lot. As I parked in my reserved spot, he came over and said, “That’s a nice set of wheels you got there.”

“Thanks.” Putting my heels back on, I stepped out of the car. “I have to make sure I don’t get too attached to it; I can’t very well put a baby seat in there.”

“Well, then you should enjoy it while you can.” Holding the door open for me, Gloria said, “How was the meeting?”

I proceeded to explain how Melanie had regressed to the mental age of 5, while Jackson had decided to keep my secret. When I was finished, I said, “Part of me is still leery about trusting her, but I think Jackson will keep her promise.”

As we walked to the elevator, Gloria looked at me and said, "If she does anything, let me know; I'll be right there to defend you.”

“Thanks.” Chuckling, I said, “But I don’t think it will come to that.”

“So what is your work schedule like for the next few days?”

“Well I’ve got the weekend off.” Pressing the button for our floor, I said, “I’ve also got permission to drive, so perhaps you can teach me to drive.”

“You seemed to have it down.”

“I got home fine today, but there were no other cars on the roads.” Looking at Gloria, I said, “Once the roads open up again, that’ll be a totally different story.”

As we stepped out of the elevator, Gloria said, “I was just about to make some lunch. Are you hungry?”

“I don’t know if you read my mind or just heard my stomach; but yes, I’m starving.”

*****************************************************


The two of us were sitting at Gloria’s kitchen counter. After taking a bite of my sandwich, I said, “We’ve been so focused on me the last few days; I haven’t had a chance to ask how you’re doing?”

“I’m doing as well as can be expected.” Wiping his mouth, Gloria said, “I heard from my nephew this morning; as it turns out, he ended up in the body of a high school cheerleader.”

“That must’ve been quite a shock for him...I mean her.”

“He hasn’t heard from anyone in his immediate family yet.” Sighing, Gloria said, “I was going to suggest he come out here once the roads open again.”

“I think that’s a great idea.”

“There’s something else I’ve been thinking about.” Looking at me, Gloria said, “I’m not sure I want to be Gloria anymore.”

“Okay.” Pausing, I said, “What should I start calling you then?”

“I always liked the name, Glenn.”

“I like it.” Extending my hand, I said, “It’s nice to meet you, Glenn.”
1232121111111121121221112111111111111111.title: Later On

1232121111111121121221112111111111111111.content:
The first three weeks after the Great Shift was marked by two main events; people dealing with the changes brought on by the Shift and life returning to something that resembled normal. The general curfew was lifted about a week after the Shift; everyone was encouraged to go about their normal lives. I suppose I should update everyone about my Channel 7 family.

Phil had changed her name to Felicia and quickly embraced her new life as a single mother. She loved Luke and would do anything for him. I noticed that whenever she was breastfeeding, she’d only cover-up if there was a man in the room. Whenever I, or anyone, asked if she was ready to start dating, she’d say, “Luke demands all my attention and fills my house with odors – so who needs a man?”

Diane had started dating Roger, but people were starting to wonder if they’d last. The arguments started about a week after the Shift, mostly because Diane didn’t like Roger patrolling the streets.

Kevin was now going by Kanika and was settling into her new life admirably. She’d deny it if you mentioned it to her, but I’m pretty sure she’s sending signals to her cameraman.

We’d received an update from Brooke Mitchell; Melanie, who was now going by Robby, was doing well in Kindergarten. There were times that his old personality would seep through, but Brooke said, for the most part, that he was your typical 5-year-old boy.

Richard had become Samantha. She was living with Chad and his husband Michael, and would frequently call to update us about Caleb.

Brianna had settled into a relationship with Rachel; which really changed her life. She’d told me that she had no idea what she was missing out on being a bachelor.

Thankfully Jacqueline had kept her promise. She was looking for a new place in town and wanted to strike a better balance between work and her social life.

That’s everything about my Channel 7 family, now I suppose you’ll want to know how much my life has changed. Boy howdy has it ever.

I finally got to see a doctor; a few days after the curfew lifted and was surprised to find out that I was 6-8 weeks along. My doctor said that this was common with women, so I didn't blow my secret right then and there. I also started seeing an obstetrician, one who had been shifted into the body of a girl who still needed a training bra.

She told me that my breasts had gone up about a cup size; which made me realize it would be long before my clothes started to get snug.

Perhaps the biggest change was between Glenn and me. After two weeks of insisting we were just friends with benefits, Glenn said the L-world to me and I said it right back. So I guess my life is pretty good now – I’ve got a great job, a baby on the way, and an amazing boyfriend.
1232121111111121121221112111111111111111.title: Three Weeks Later

1232121111111121121221112111111111111111.content:
Glenn and I took another big step not long after confessing our love for each other – deciding to move in together. It made sense when we discussed it; after all, we were always together when we weren’t at work or when Glenn was at the gym.

Of course that meant having to decide whose condo to live in. It didn’t take long to figure out that we’d live in my place; after all, I had to the pricier furniture and electronics. After selling Glenn’s things, we were left with his clothes and his DVD collection.

You would think that Glenn would want my help moving everything; but he insisted that I step back and let him do it. This, of course, left me with nothing to do but sit and listen to his friends as they came up with new ways to say bro. Honestly there were times that I found myself forgetting that Glenn had been a 45 year old woman before this.

I had just gotten back from picking up some lunch for myself and four guys. Having just parked the car, I was walking into the building when my cell phone rang. When I saw that it was Diane, I answered it and said, “Hey Diane, what’s up?”

“Hey Elaine, I’m not doing much.” Pausing, she said, “How about you?”

“Glenn is insisting that I don’t help with the move because of the baby.” Sighing, I said, “So I’ve been relegated to picking up food for him and his friends.”

“I think it’s cute that Glenn is taking so well to the boyfriend role.” Chuckling, Diane said, “I remember meeting him a few times before the Shift, he was always looking out for you.”

“I can’t really blame him; after all, I moved to a new town and lost my parents in the same week.” Heading into the elevator, I said, “If it hadn’t been for Glenn, I don’t know what would’ve happened.”

“Well I’m glad you found someone who cares for you like that.” Sighing, Diane said, “I’m getting really annoyed with Roger; he’s still insisting on being a cop.”

“Have you guys thought about couples counseling?”

“No, but I guess we could try that.”

“I doubt you called just to chat.” Stepping out of the elevator, I said, “What’s up?”

“There were just things I wanted to tell you.” Pausing, Diane said, “First off, Bill’s sleeping with his wife again.”

That poor body had been hit by every one of the Aftershocks; at one point I think heard Tara Johnson was in there. “I thought there was an 11-year-old boy in there?”

“There is...was.” pausing, Diane said, “It happened last night; he was getting settled on the couch when she asked him to come to bed. She had to ask how to do some things; but from what I hear, she was a willing participant.”

There wasn’t much I could say about that; after all I was a 15 year old boy in a 32 year old woman’s body who made love to a 45 year old woman in a 25 year old man’s body. “I get the feeling we’re going to be hearing about that kind of thing more often.” Heading down the hall, I said, “What’s the other bit of news?"

"The parent network is coming to talk to us."

"Tell them I'm not moving until this kid is at least out of diapers."

“Not you and me; the entire Channel 7 news team.” I reached my door as Diane said, “Apparently we're one of a handful of markets with a mostly female news team. They want to talk with us about how things may or may not have changed.”

“Oh, thanks for the heads up.” Walking into the condo, hearing voices coming from the bedroom, I said, “I’ll talk to you later.”
1232121111111121121221112111111111111111.title: Continue

choices: I told him who I was
I decided to play news reporter for awhile longer
1233.content:
I wanted to know what caused the explosions that I had heard and if anyone had been hurt. It was shocking finding myself in this women's body but the chance that people in my town were in danger gave me something to focus on.

The sounds seemed to come from a few blocks away and I could see smoke coming from that direction. Walking was very difficult in the purple high heels that Ms. Cho had been wearing and the feel of her dress on my new body was troublesome. I had walked 20 feet before noticing that I still had the camcorder. I considered leaving it as it was heavy but it looked expensive and it might come in handy. On the way I spotted a news van that I assumed Elaine and her crew had arrived here in.

When I neared the local gas station I could see what all the smoke was from. A fire had broken out and a few propane tanks had exploded. There were two men and an elderly woman on the ground nearby and they looked like they needed help. I rushed to the woman who kept calling for a "Jeff" and saw blood pooling under her leg. Nearly tripping in the heels I leaned down to see how badly she was injured.
