"Jeff is that you in there man? What happened? I have some old crows body and I can't get up!" she gasped hysterically.

"My name is Evan and something happened to me too. You have a nasty cut on your leg but I can help you" I said as calmly as I could.

I had taken a few first aid classes last summer in the hopes of getting a job as a life guard. A lot of blood was coming from the cut but I was able to stop it by applying pressure to the artery and tying it off with part of the women's dress. As I was doing this I could see other people helping the two other victims and putting out the fire.

A boy around the age of 12 claimed to be a doctor and took over the old woman's care for me. As he checked for further bleeding I talked with the woman to keep her calm. "She" was actually the original occupant of the little boys body and was at the middle school having lunch when the event had happened and was in a state of shock. Soon the doctor and a few bystanders put her in the back of a van to take her to the hospital.

In the wake of all that excitement I was able to take in the fact that I was now in a early thirties women's body. This is one of the people I would expect to hear about today's unbelievable events from but the real Elaine Cho could be anywhere and she didn't have a camera to report this with. An idea formed in my head, I had taken public speaking classes before and had to write many "news reports" for class projects. I enlisted the aid of a man who looked like he could use something to keep his mind off of his new body to hold the camera and film me.

"Hello, this is Elaine Cho reporting for channel seven news". I don't know why I used Elaine's name, it just sounded right from what I'd seen on the local news. "Citizens all over our town have seemingly changed bodies with each other and this has caused an explosion at a local service station." I went on to describe all that I had seen to that point and the stories of the people I had met, particularly the boy stuck in an old women's body. I encouraged people to remain calm and stay at home if they were lucky enough to be inside.

Thanking the cameraman, I returned to the news van that I had seen. Luckily the keys were still in the ignition, whoever was driving must have fled the scene quickly. I headed right to the news station to turn in my report. I was new enough to driving and the heels were making it difficult but I made it there safely. When I walked in the front door I was greeted by who I thought was Ken Perrise, the stations head anchor, but was actually a producer named Phil. He was glad to see me as he had no reporters and happily took the tape from me to air at once.

I watched the report air from a monitor in the control room. The image of Elaine Cho reporting at the scene of an accident was a familiar one but it was odd to think it was me controlling that professional looking woman's body. Phil seemed very pleased with my work.
1233.title: Report the situation as Elaine

12331.content:
"Phil, I have to tell you something" I paused briefly, wondering how I was going to explain the situation. “I’m not really Elaine Cho; I’m just a teenager who ended up in her body.”

Confused, Phil said, “Are you serious?”

“Are you?” surprised, I said, “I just did a report for you about people swapping bodies; and you think I’m joking about not being Elaine?”

“Y-You’re right, I’m sorry.” Pausing, Phil said, “I was just surprised; because you reported the news just like Elaine would, I thought you were really her.”

“I’m sorry for misleading you; I felt that I had to report the news.” Sighing, I said, “If you want me to leave, I’ll understand.”

“Listen to me...kid.” placing his hands on my shoulders, Phil said, “I’m not angry; but I have no reporters available to report the news. I’d like for you to stay here until things calm down; so you can report the news and I can keep you safe.”

“Okay, thank you.” Nodding, I said, “I-I would like a few minutes alone to calm down if that’s alright.”

“Thank you.”
12331.title: I told him who I was

123311.content:
After Phil left to answer some phones, I turned and walked down the hall towards the restrooms. I instinctively turned towards the men’s room before catching myself. Walking into the woman’s room, I was staring at my reflection in the mirror when a man walked into the room. Looking at him, I said, “Let me guess; you were a woman before all of this?”

“No, I was a man; in fact I’m still in my body.”

“So what are you doing in here then?”

“I came to talk to you.” Pausing, the man said, “You should know that Elaine and Phil are dating.”

“Oh wow.” Leaning against the sink, I said, “That’s why he seems so protective of me...this body.”

“That’s right.” Sighing, the man said, “There’s also a rumor going around about Elaine...you being pregnant.”

“What!?” looking down at my stomach, I said, “I’m pregnant!?”

“That’s what people are saying; but Elaine and Phil haven’t made an announcement yet.”

“Then how do you know?”

“I’m Elaine’s cousin; I guess I just knew her enough to figure it all out.”

“Thanks for the news.” Reaching out my hand, I said, “Despite appearances, my name is Evan.”

“It’s nice to meet you, Evan; I’m David.”
123311.title: Continue

12332.content:
Phil walked out of the control room and down the hall. Feeling the urge to come clean, I followed him. With the ‘click’ of my heels on the floor as I walked, I managed to catch up to Phil outside of what I assumed to be his office. “Phil, there’s something important that I have to tell you.”

Looking at me, with concern, Phil said, “What is it, Elaine?”

Before I had the chance to answer, I was interrupted by Phil’s ringing cell phone. Phil quickly answered the call, while I was surprised there was still cell service. Phil had stepped into the hallway, but I could see him through the window; he seemed to be having a conversation with someone that made him excited.

With a moment to myself, I sat down at one of the consoles. As I sat there, I thought about everything that had happened. I’d gone from being a somewhat average boy to a renowned female reporter. While I’d only lost 15 years and changed genders, I was under no illusions that there weren’t people who had it worse than me. My thoughts quickly turned to my family, I feared for their safety.

Looking around the room, I saw TVs set to other news networks; but there was only static. It seemed my report was the only one going out. It was not long before Phil walked back into the room. Looking at me, he said, “Elaine, that was the parent network. They saw your broadcast and want you to report nationally from the studio in Baltimore.” Looking at me, he said, “It seems this event has affected almost the entire planet; they need someone like you to keep people calm.”

I couldn’t believe what was happening; I was being asked to report to the entire US and probably the world.
12332.title: I decided to play news reporter for awhile longer

123321.content:
To say I was shocked would be an understatement; this was a once in a lifetime opportunity. However, I started to fear for my family again. Looking at Phil, I said, “I'll do it, but I need to check on my family before I leave town" I told Phil.

"I didn't think you had any family here" Phil replied with a confused tone. "Don't they live in Korea?".

"They’re close friends, but I consider them to be family.” I knew it was a lame attempt to explain it, but I said it anyway.

“I understand.” Looking at me, he said, “Take the SUV, make sure you’re not gone too long.”

“Of course.” Overcome with emotion, I hugged Phil and said, “Thank you.”

As I headed down the corridor to the parking garage I had more time to think about the situation. How would I prove to my family that I was Evan? Getting to the garage, I climbed into the car and made my way to my house. The town was less chaotic than I had left it but there were still plenty of people milling about with bewildered looks on their faces. There were few cars on the road, perhaps people had taken my advice and were staying indoors.

Eventually, I pulled into my driveway and got out of the van. I minced up the walk to the front door and knocked. It was a big relief to see Corrine open the door.

I noticed my report on the TV behind Corinne. Looking at me with confusion, she said, "Elaine Cho, what are you doing here?"

"No Corrine. It's me, Evan." I said with my now feminine voice. She looked confused but has a revelation of her own.

"I'm not Corrine, I'm Ryan!" she said about to cry. Perhaps it's the fact that we both had female bodies or maybe it was the stress but we hugged each other deeply.

After breaking the hug, I looked at Ryan and said, “Is my family here? Do you know what happened to them?"

"They’re not here; after I found myself in Corinne’s body I fled the school. I tried getting into my place but couldn’t without my keys; I came here when I found keys in Corinne’s purse.”

“How long have you been here?”

“A good hour or so.” Pausing, Ryan said, “Wait a minute, if you’re in Elaine’s body; then you...”

“That’s right, I made the report.”

I proceeded to explain everything that happened to me; from the report to being asked to broadcast nationally. When I finished, Ryan said, “Can I come with you to Baltimore?”

Seeing that I was running out of time, I looked at Ryan and said, “Why would you want to come with me?”

“Because I’m all alone here; at least I’ll be with someone I know.”

“Okay fine, you can come.” Looking at Ryan, I said, “But Elaine – I mean my boss thinks you’re a family friend. Please call me Elaine when we’re in public.”
“Okay.”
123321.title: I'll Do It

1233211.content:
The helicopter ride to Baltimore went by without incident; Phil, Ryan and I passed the time by looking out the window at the damage below us as we flew over. There were a couple times where Phil talked to Ryan, but I was happy to see he was careful now to reveal my secret before I was ready.

As we flew into Baltimore, I could see smoke and fires below us. It wasn’t long before we approached the helipad on the studio roof. Once we landed, we all climbed out of the helicopter and walked to the door. There we were met by a young teenage girl in a cheer uniform; I figured she had been a victim of the shift. My suspicions were correct when she said, “It’s a pleasure to finally meet you, Ms. Cho; appearance to the contrary, my name is John Archer; I’m the station manager”

“It’s a pleasure to meet you, Mr. Archer.” Shaking his hand, I said, “I believe you know my producer, Phil; and this young girl next to me is Ryan, he’s in the body of a family friend.”

When Mr. Archer heard who Ryan was, he smiled. Looking at Ryan, he said, “It’ll be nice to have another guy around who's in my position.”

“Thanks.” As we walked inside, Ryan said, “What’s with the outfit?”

“We were filming an interview with a cheer squad from Virginia; they were in town for the regionals.” Shrugging, Mr. Archer said, “I guess I was a tad unlucky.”

Walking into the elevator, I said, “Phil said you wanted me to broadcast nationally?”

“Yes; we saw your broadcast and felt you would have no problem calming the public.” Pressing a button, Mr. Archer said, “I’m going to bring you the dressing room of one of our meteorologists; she’s about your size and has offered the use of her wardrobe.”

“Make sure to thank her for me.”
1233211.title: Arriving in Baltimore

12332111.content:
With some helpful directions, I found my way to the dressing room I’d be using while I was here. As we walked down the hall, Ryan caught up to me and said, “How long do you think you can keep up this charade?”

“I don’t know.” Turning to Ryan, subconsciously placing my hands on my hips in a feminine manner, I said, “I’m just taking this one step at a time.”

“Di-Did you hit your head or something after the swap?” gesturing to my hands, Ryan said, “that’s the 2nd time I’ve seen you do something feminine and out of place for you.”

Looking down at my hands, I quickly pulled them back. “I’m in a strange body, Ryan; I’m bound to do some strange things for a while.”

“I’m in a strange body too, Evan; but you don’t see me acting like that.”

As we continued walking, I noted to myself that Ryan hadn’t been acting strangely while I have. I wondered to myself if it was because I was now in an adult women’s body while he was still a teenager. When we got to the dressing room, I knocked on the door. I heard a noise inside; followed by the door opening.

I was surprised to see a young man; probably a few years younger than I was right now. Looking at him, I said, “I’m sorry, I must have the wrong room; I’m looking for Leslie Compton’s room.”

“No, you’re in the right place.” Pausing, the man said, “Despite appearances, I’m Leslie Compton.”

“Oh, well it’s nice to meet you; I’m Elaine Cho.” Extending my hand, I said, “Thank for letting me use your dressing room and clothes.”

“It’s nice to meet you.” Shaking my hand, Leslie said, “Don’t give it a second thought about my dressing room; as you can see I have no use for the clothes anymore.”

As I stood there, I was surprised to find myself feeling a little attracted to Leslie’s current body. Pushing that thought aside, I turned to Ryan and said, “This is Ryan; he’s, uh, in the body of the daughter of a friend of mine.”

“Hi Ryan, it’s nice to meet you.” Smiling, Leslie said, “How are you adjusting to being a girl?”

“I’m doing fine.” Looking at me, in a hushed voice, he said, “But not as good as some people, apparently.”

I inwardly glared at Ryan, hoping he wouldn’t blow my cover. Looking to Leslie, I said, “Sorry to end this prematurely, but I have to be on the air in 20 minutes.”

“Oh right.” Chuckling, Leslie said, “Come on in; I’ll give you guys some privacy.”

After Leslie left, Ryan closed the door and looked at me. “What the hell was that about?”

“What do you mean?” a little confused, I said, “I was just being polite.”

“Polite my ass.” Looking at me, Ryan said, “You were practically flirting with Leslie.”
12332111.title: In the Dressing Room

123321111.content:
Due to my unfamiliarity with my new body, I took some time to get ready. I had seen my mom and Corinne do their hair and makeup enough to have a good idea what to do; but when it came to picking out a dress, I was totally lost.

Thankfully, Leslie had a large selection of outfits to wear; it took me a few minutes but I finally picked a dress I felt would look good on camera. After changing into it, I showed myself to Ryan. “How do I look?”

“All things considered, you look really good.” Looking at me, he said, “I can’t believe you’re letting yourself get caught up in this; what if you do this for so long you can’t stop?”

“It won’t come to that.” Looking at the mirror, I said, “Hopefully the real Elaine shows up eventually; so she can take over.”

“Yeah, but what if she doesn’t?” concerned, Ryan said, “You didn’t even leave a note for your mom and Corinne explaining everything; you’re okay with them thinking you’re missing?”

“No, I’m not okay with it.” Sighing, I said, “I forgot to leave them a note; but if you’re so concerned about it, call my house and leave a message.”

“Okay, I’ll do that.” Pausing, Ryan said, “I’m sorry if I snapped; it’s just I’m not used to this.”

“You think I am?” gesturing to my body, I said, “I’ve gone from a 14-year-old boy to being a woman old enough to be my mother.”
Just then there was a knock at the door; causing Ryan and me to jump. After a few seconds, the door opened and a man with a headpiece came in. “You’re needed on the set, Ms. Cho.”

“Of course, I’ll be right there.” As I walked out of the room, I turned to Ryan and said, “Be careful talking with people.”
123321111.title: Continue

1233211111.content:
"Hello, this is Elaine Cho reporting for Chanel 7 News.” Unlike the last time, I’d said that I was now more comfortable saying that I was Elaine. “As many of you are no doubt aware, an unusual event has occurred in the US and around the world. People have suddenly found themselves in another person’s body; sometimes miles from where they once were.”

I continued like at for a few minutes, detailing the events post-change; until I heard a voice in my ear. “Elaine, it’s Phil; we’ve managed to track down a scientist who is willing to speak about the events. His name is Dr. Patrick M’benga.”

Without acknowledging the message, I turned to the camera and said, “I’ve just been informed that my producers have managed to get an interview with a scientist; one who is willing to speak about the events of today.”

After that, we took a few minute break to get ready for the interview. I was sitting at the table when Phil escorted Dr. M’benga into the studio. Looking at him, I saw...
1233211111.title: Reporting

12332111113.content:
I had to hide my shock when I saw the scientist I was supposed to interview appearing in the body of a pregnant girl, wearing a pair of sweat pants and a top, who looked to be no more than 18 or 19. Getting up, I walked over and said, “Dr. Doherty it’s a pleasure to meet you.”

“The pleasure is all mine, Ms. Cho.” Wincing, Dr. Doherty said, “Do you mind if I have a seat, my feet are killing me.”

“Of course.” Leading him to a chair, I said, “This must be quite a shock for you.”

“To say the least.” Sitting down, Dr. Doherty said, “I’ve had conversations with my daughter about teenage pregnancy; clearly this girl never listened to those conversations with her father.”

“We’ll be going back on the air in a few moments; so I hope you’re up to it.”

“I’ll be fine, thank you for the concern.” Wincing again, Dr. Doherty said, “You can ask me what ever you want.”

It wasn’t long before we were back from commercial. Turning to the camera, I said, “I’m here with Dr. Patrick Doherty; a neurologist at the University of Maryland here in Baltimore.” Pausing, I turned to Dr. Doherty and said, “Thank you for taking the time to speak with us, Doctor; especially given your current circumstances.”

“It’s a pleasure, Ms. Cho.” Taking a labored breath, Dr. Doherty said, “People have begun to call this the Great Shift; in my opinion that’s...”

Dr. Doherty stopped speaking at that point; as he keeled over in pain. I had to move fast to make sure he did not fall off the chair. As everyone ran over to help, I said, “Doctor, are you alright?”

As a dark stain appeared on the sweat pants, between groans of pain, Dr. Doherty said, “I-I think my water just broke; I-I’m going into labor.”
12332111113.title: A pregnant woman

123321111131.content:
I was frozen in panic when I heard those words. Here I was placed in the body of an adult woman, and I freeze at the mention of someone going into labor. It was all I could do to hold Dr. Doherty’s hand as help slowly started to arrive.

I winced in pain every few seconds as Dr. Doherty squeezed my hand as he went through another contraction. Thankfully one of the technicians was an EMT, so he was there to help. “We need to get her...I mean him, somewhere comfortable.”

I knew the room I was using was closest, and it had a couch. “We can bring him to my dressing room; there’s a couch there.”

With my hand still being crushed by Dr. Doherty, I had no choice but to follow as she was carried by several people down the hall to the dressing room. I managed to wrestle my hand free as they brought him into the room. While the technician went around asking for a first aid kit and some towels, I stood in the hallway as Ryan squeezed out of the room.

He saw me rubbing my hand. Looking at me, he said, “Are you alright?”

“Yeah, I’m fine; he just squeezed my hand really hard.” Taking a breath, I said, “How are doing?”

“Well I’m not in labor and I wasn’t just on live television; so I guess I’m doing pretty well all things considered.”

“Oh god, I forgot about the broadcast.” Placing a hand on my head, I said, “I-I was just so pre-occupied with Dr. Doherty.”

“It’s alright, Ms. Cho.” Gesturing to the closed door, Ryan said, “I’m sure no one will hold this against you.”

I heard Dr. Doherty screaming in pain through the door; yelling at someone to stop telling him to push or he’d be the one screaming. “I just hope Dr. Doherty is going to be alright.”

“I think it’s safe to say he won’t be giving many interviews for a while; being a new mother.”

************************


It felts like hours had gone by, but I knew it was only about 25 minutes since Dr. Doherty had gone into labor. I was standing outside the room, pacing, when the door opened. I could hear various voices saying he was beautiful and that he has your eyes. I looked at the technician as he walked out. “How is he?”

“The baby...and mother are both doing fine.”

“It seemed like he was having contractions before the water broke; I thought that came after?”

“There are cases where woman have contractions before their water breaks; it’s nothing to be concerned about.”

“Can I see...her?”

“Yes, in fact she was asking for you.”
123321111131.title: Continue

1233211111311.content:
I knocked on the door to the dressing room; waiting outside until I heard Dr. Doherty say, “Come in.”

Opening the door, I walked inside to find Dr. Doherty sitting on the couch with his newborn son wrapped in a towel in his arms. Walking over, I sat down next to him and said, “He’s beautiful, Dr. Doherty.”

“Oh please, Elaine; call me Patrick.” Chuckling, as he wiped some spittle from his baby’s mouth, he said, “I-I can’t believe I just gave birth to this little guy.”

“Have you thought about a name yet?”

“Please, don’t rush me.” Pausing, Patrick said, “I’ve only been a woman for a few hours, and a mother for a few minutes.”

“Sorry, I didn’t mean to rush you.” Smiling, I said, “Can I hold him?”

“Sure.” Carefully handing his son to me, Patrick said, “Be careful; remember to support his head.”

As I held the newborn in my arms, I realized something. I started to realize that something had changed inside me; as if holding the baby in my arms gave me an urge to have a baby myself. Keeping that to myself, I turned to Patrick and said, “I understand you were married before this happened. Did you and your wife have any children?”

“No, we didn’t have any children.” Pausing, Patrick said, “My wife, Helen, was...infertile.”

“Oh, I’m so sorry.”

“It’s okay.” Looking at me, Patrick said, “I’d given up on having a child years ago, but now I have one.”

“Have you been able to track down Helen?”

“No, not yet.” With a tired chuckle, Patrick said, “When I do, I’ll bet she’s going to be in for a shock.”

Just then, the baby started crying. Gently handing him back to Patrick, who started to coo and gently rock the baby, I said, “It seems motherhood suits you.”

“I don’t know why; I never imagined myself as a mother before this, but seeing this little guy and holding him in my arms changed everything. I want to protect him and raise him to be a gentleman.”

“I’ll give you two some privacy.” Smiling as I got up, I said, “I think they’ll want to me get back to the news desk.”

“Sorry about ruining your interview.”

“It’s no problem; you had something else to deal with.”
1233211111311.title: Visiting Dr. Doherty

12332111113111.content:
Several hours had passed since I finished my report; with nothing to do, I was sitting in the control room listening to reports coming from police scanners. I was sitting at the desk, drinking a coffee, when Leslie walked into the room with Ryan.

Looking at me, Leslie said, “I just heard from the EMTs, Dr. Doherty and...her son got to the hospital safely.”

“That’s good.” Pausing, I said, “I’ll be sure to visit once they allow it.”

“So I was talking with Ryan; he says you two don’t have a place to stay.” Pausing, Leslie said, “You’re both more than welcome to stay at my place with me; it’s only a few blocks from here.”

“Thanks, I appreciate that.” Looking at Leslie, I said, “Are you sure you won’t be inconvenienced?”

“No, it’s not going to be a problem.” Taking a breath, Leslie said, “Besides, I could teach you both how to be women.”

Glaring at Ryan for a moment, I said, “How’d you find out?”

“Ryan can’t keep a secret to save his life.” Looking at me, Leslie said, “I won’t tell anyone here; but I got to know, why pretend to be Elaine?”

“I-I don’t know; it just happened.” Sighing, I said, “Now I’m afraid I’m in too deep to stop.”

“For what it's worth, you did a good job reassuring people today.” Smiling, Leslie said, “I’ll meet you guys downstairs in a few minutes.”

Once Leslie left, I turned to Ryan and said, “You just couldn’t keep your mouth shut, could you.”

“I’m sorry, alright?” taking a step back, Ryan said, “It just slipped out.”

Realizing it was an innocent mistake, I took a breath and said, “Fine, just...be careful who you talk to from now on.”
12332111113111.title: Later On

choices: I said that I'll do it
I told him that I'm not Elaine
12333.content:
"Phil, I have to tell you something" I begin to explain.

"What is it Elaine?" Phil asked with concern.

Before I could answer, the control room's phone started ringing and Phil quickly picked it up. He seemed to be having an excited conversation so I sat in one of the chairs to take things in.

I looked down at the purple dress I was wearing and thought how unusual my day had turned out to be. About fifteen years had been taken from me along with my gender. How many had found themselves in a situation like mine or worse? I had helped that poor boy that was stuck in an old ladies body and possibly calmed a few people with the news report but there was so much chaos happening that I felt helpless. Was my family safe? How could I even find them? The entire town seemed to be affected but it could be much worse then that.

I flipped through the TV channels looking for answers and saw static on every other channel besides seven. The only mass media to begin airing was the one I was in and I was the only reporter there.

Phil hung up the phone with a look of urgency on his face. "Elaine, that was the parent network, they can't find any on-air talent and they want you to report for them" he smiled. "The changes happened to almost everyone in the world and they need someone on the air to calm things down. This is your big break!" he exclaimed.

Channel seven was owned by one of the big three national networks, I was being asked to report to the entire united states and possibly the whole world.

"They have an unchanged pilot that can pick us up in 2 hours" Phil explained.
12333.title: Phil's phone rang

choices: It was a stranger in her body
It was my friend Ryan in her body
123331.content:
I had wanted to be a television reporter since I had been a young boy but the dream had faded as I realized that I had neither the looks or strong voice to get into the field. It was odd to think that despite my now softer voice I could reach the major leagues of news broadcasting with it. The excitement of fulfilling my childhood dreams were tempered by concern however. Thoughts of my family filled my head and I needed to find them before continuing this charade.

"I'll do it, but I need to check on my family before I leave town" I told Phil.

"I didn't think you had an family here" Phil replied with a confused tone. "Don't they live in Korea?".

"Friends..." I lamely covered. "Friends that are close as family" I said as sincerely as I could.

"I understand," Phil said as he stepped forward and put his hand on my small shoulder. "Take one of the vans but make sure you're back in time, people really need you" he said with a bit to much affection for my liking.

I thanked him and left the control room. As I headed down the corridor to the parking garage I had more time to think over the situation. All the time in the world could not lessen the shock of turning into a woman and I hoped that my family had had less severe changes than me, perhaps they had been unaffected altogether. I pulled my small frame up into the van and headed to my house.

The town was less chaotic then I had left it but there were still plenty of people milling about with bewildered looks on there faces. There were few cars on the road, perhaps people had taken my advice and were staying indoors. The oddest sight was a small toddler dragging a middle aged woman by her hand, she looked out of sorts but the boy's sense of purpose conveyed years of experience in emergency situations.

Eventually I pulled into my driveway and got out of the van. I minced up the walk to the front door and knocked. It was a big relief to see Corrine open the door.
123331.title: I said that I'll do it

choices: I invited Ryan to come along
1233312.content:
"Elaine Cho?" my sister asked with confusion. Behind her I could see my news report playing on the television, Phil had it on loop as it was the only material he had.

"No Corrine, it's me Evan" I said with my now feminine voice. She looked confused but has a revelation of her own.

"I'm not Corrine, I'm Ryan!" she said about to cry. Perhaps it's the fact that we both had female bodies or maybe it was the stress but we hugged each other deeply.

"Is my family here? Do you know what happened to them?" I begged Ryan.

"They aren't. I found myself in your sister's body at school but couldn't get in my house without any keys. I came here when I found Corrine's keys in her purse. Nobody has shown up all day and the news kept saying to stay inside." Ryan blurted out.

His confusion returned as he looked at the television and back at me. "Wait, if your in Elaine Cho's body..." he said looking back and forth.

I explained how I had found myself after the shift and my escapades as a news woman. Ryan was shocked at my story but had all the proof to believe it. Looking at the clock, I realized the I had to get back to the station.
1233312.title: It was my friend Ryan in her body

123332.content:
“Phil, I … I am ...“ I started to say, trying to avoid looking straight at him and feeling like a thief and a criminal for impersonating Elaine. Phil took a step forward and gently grabbed my shoulder, I looked at him and he said, “Elaine, it’s OK, relax, you’ll do great, it’s the big break you’ve …” but I cut him off. “No, you don’t understand, I’m … I’m not Elaine, my name is Evan, I’m just a guy, a teenager … well, I guess I Was,” I explained, gesturing towards my new body.

Phil looked at me for a moment, “That’s, uh, wow, I … I never would have guessed if you hadn’t said anything, you, you move and talk just like her, that report was classic Elaine, it’s amazing. Are you pulling my hair?” he said, looking me up and down with an incredulous look.

“No, Phil, it’s not a joke. I got switched too, but … I don’t know, I figured out who I’d switched into and when the whole thing at the gas station happened I felt … I don’t know how to explain it … I’d brought the camera along and with all that was going around I felt it was necessary to do something. I know I shouldn’t have just … I don’t know, lied about being Elaine, but everyone and everything seemed to be spiraling out of control and …” I explained, feeling more and more like a thief with every word. Somehow, as I talked I’d walked as in autopilot to an office and sad down behind the desk inside, I had to stop myself from reaching for a lighter after I got a pack of cigarettes out of a drawer somehow.

“Wow, Ela … Eva,” said Phil, catching himself, as he sat down,” I’m having a hard time believing you’re not Elaine, you move just like her, you came straight to her office just like she does when she is stressed and got her cigarettes out of her desk. This is … this is incredible.”

I looked at the cigarette like it was some disgusting creature I’d just picked up, feeling the shock of the situation finally hit me. I’d been running on some burrowed strength somehow, but hearing Phil just made me feel like reality was slipping away from me.

“Hey, take a deep breath, I’m sorry, I didn’t mean to upset you. Look, I understand this is, well, unbelievable, but … “ he breathed a heavy sigh, “You’ve already proven you can report the news, you have the instinct, you have the spirit and right now, for whatever crazy reason, you’re Elaine Cho right now. I’m sure more reporters will surface, but as far as we can tell this is global, we need you. We can sort this all out later, but right now we need Elaine Cho to calm the people, to bring some sense to all that’s going on right now.”

I looked at him, wracking my brain for an answer, I looked down at the cigarette in my hand and said, …
123332.title: I told him that I'm not Elaine

1233321.content: “I’ll do it, someone has report on this … whatever This is,” I told him, gesturing to my new body. “That’s great, Elaine!” Phil replied, I started to raise an eyebrow at being called Elaine but before I could say anything Phil raised a hand to cut me off, “For now you have to be Elaine Cho, the public needs you to be Elaine Cho.” I look at him for a moment, feeling the gravity of his words. I would be agreeing to not only report what was going on, but to keep up the charade that I am Elaine and put Evan to the side. I nodded silently and he continued, “A helicopter will be here to pick us up and take us to the Capital, to plug into the government response to this thing.”
1233321.title: Yes, I’m in

12333211.content:
The helicopter ride to the Capital went by without incident; Phil and I passed the time by looking out the window at the chaos below. After passing over a particularly bad accident on the highway, Phil turned to me and said, “This is why we need you, Elaine.”

“I’m not sure I can do this, Phil.” Looking at him, I said, “Making a news report is one thing, but I don’t think I’m ready for this.”

“You’ll do fine.”

"You realize what you're asking me to do, right?" sighing, I said, "I know nothing about being a woman, and you're asking me to pretend to be one."
12333211.title: On the flight

123332111.content:
As soon as we landed at the State Capital, we were met by a young woman in a suit. “Ms. Cho, Mr. Miller, it’s a pleasure to meet you.” Shaking our hands, the woman said, “Appearances to the contrary, I’m Roger Fairbanks; I’m the Governor’s Chief of Staff.”

“It’s a pleasure to meet you, Mr. Fairbanks.”

Phil and I followed Roger off the helipad and down a stone walkway to a rear entrance. Once inside, away from the helicopter, Roger said, “We greatly appreciate you coming on such short notice, Ms. Cho; as you’re the only unshifted reporter within 50 miles.” Gesturing to his body, Roger said, “I only wish I was so lucky; now I’m in the body of one of our interns.”

As we walked through the halls, I said, “Why exactly am I here?”

“The Governor wants to assure everyone that everything is alright.” Pausing, Roger said, “After which you’ll inform the public about they need to know to stay safe.”

“Before we go any further, can I speak to my producer in private?”

“Of course.” Gesturing to a nearby door, Roger said, “You can use that office.”

Phil and I walked into the office. As soon as I closed the door, I turned to him and said, “I can’t do this, Phil.”

“It’s going to be alright, Elaine.”

“Would you please stop calling me that?” getting annoyed, I said, “I know you think the people need Elaine Cho, but I’m not sure I can be her.”

“You’ll be fine.”

Realizing that I wasn’t going to convince Phil to get me out of this, I walked past him and left the room. I found Roger sitting on a nearby bench, massaging his feet. I knew what he was going through; my feet were starting to ache from walking in these heels.
Looking at him, I said, “I’m ready to see the Governor."
123332111.title: The Capital

12333212.content:
The helicopter landed without much fanfare on a field near the executive house in the Capital where many tents had been set up as part of a command centre. “Ms. Elaine Cho, Mr. Phill Miller, this way please,” said a middle-aged woman in what looked like an ill-fitting officer’s uniform, motioning for you to follow. “Appearances to the contrary, I am Major Hank Peterson, public relations for joint operation,” said the formerly male Major as you followed through the maze of tents, equipment and people moving around the camp. “We’ve set up this camp as a centralized Hub until we can properly secure all government facilities. With people having switched in and out of all government installations the quickest way to get things going in the chaos was to shut those down remotely and get all capable personnel in the area to converge on this location as part of a modified plan for continued government operations,” the Major explained.

“Modified plan? What do you mean, Major?” I asked.
“In case of catastrophe the government has a long list of plans for it’s continuance as you might imagine, covering every conceivable scenario. Problem is that no one could have conceived of a scenario like this one. I personally would never have imagined that I would end up in my sister-in-law’s body, but it happened,” he replied gesturing to his unquestionably female body. “Where are we headed right now?” I asked, feeling a slight buzz of excitement for some reason. “General McMillan wanted to see you as soon as you landed. You were the only unaffected reporter within a fifty-mile radius of the Capital. He wants to bring you up to speed so you can be on the air as soon as possible. However, we need to get you IDs first so you can be identified inside and outside the Hub,” the Major replied, tapping on the ID resting against the ample chest he’d inherited from his sister-in-law. You hadn’t noticed but It showed two pictures, one was of a clean cut man in an Army Officer’s uniform and other was of the woman you saw before you but in casual office-wear. The ID card also seemed to have his information in bold as well as the body’s original owner’s in smaller letters.

“Since you’re in your original body yours will simply have your information, but anyone affected by the switch will have the information for their original self as well the body’s former occupant,” he clarified. The process was simple, but staring at the ID they’d handed me was jarring to say the least. ‘Elaine Cho’ read the ID card, plain and simple. Now anyone who saw it would instantly believe that I was one of the lucky ones who’d escaped whatever had happened without switching. The slight buzz I’d felt moments earlier died down a bit as the realization of the size of the step I’d just taken dawned on me. Before I could really contemplate what it all meant though, Phil finished being processed and the Major took us to the Central Command area to meet the General.

The person who greeted us was ____ in a General’s uniform.
12333212.title: At the Capital

choices: There is an emergency at the camp
123332121.content:
The general wore a similarly ill-fitting officer’s uniform to Major Peterson’s and stood a few inches shorter than his subordinate. “Ms. Cho, I am General Theodore Stephenson,” he introduced himself in an attempt at a gruff voice that sounded more comical than authoritative coming from a petite, tattooed, teenaged girl. Evan could see a floral design snake its way up from the collar of his uniform to just below his right ear. There were also patterns and designs inked on his hands and a four letter word was tattooed on the fingers on each hand, with a single letter per finger. The uniform hid the rest of the general’s new body, but Evan was reasonably sure that wasn’t the full extent of the ink on the general’s body.

“Nice to meet you General. This is my associate and producer, Phil Miller,” Evan said, gesturing to the only person who knew his shiny new badge was a lie. Everyone shook hands and the general motioned for them to sit around an oblong table in the middle of a makeshift conference room. “Ms. Cho, I’ll get right to it,” the general did his best to sound commanding, but if anything Evan had to keep from laughing at the strange sight of the teenage girl sitting at the head of the table wearing a 4-star general’s uniform.

“At the moment our government is hanging by a thread. I won’t insult you by giving you some sort of spin on the situation. We are trying to get out bearings and coordinate efforts both at home and abroad. Reports are trickling in of pandemonium all across the world and we until we can get some semblance of control on the situation we’re not going to get anywhere. That’s where you come in. We have drafted a rough outline of our plans to get the situation under control, but we need you to communicate this plan and get people to safety so we can start reorganizing in earnest. Do you understand?”

“Yes sir, I can do that!” Evan assured him with more confidence than he was actually feeling on the inside. “The major will provide you with the information we want you to cover, but the main thing you’ll have to convey for the moment is that people should stay indoors unless absolutely necessary. The roadways are not safe, we have ordered all planes to be grounded and …” the general went into some detail, but it wasn’t until the end of his briefing that Evan’s ears perked up. “… and as you saw we already have a plan in place to create new identifications for everyone so that we can safeguard people’s identities. For the time being the process is simplified, in your case your station vouched for your identities, but as we move forward it will be a more involved process and we need you to make it quite clear that identity theft will not be tolerated. The repercussions for those attempting to take advantage of the chaos will be quite severe. Now do you have any questions before we get you on the air?”
Evan felt nauseous after hearing the general. Thankfully Phil put a steadying hand Evan’s shoulder and asked for a few minutes to go over the brief and prepare for the broadcast.
123332121.title: A tattooed teenage girl.

1233321212.content:
“Let us know when you’re ready,” said Major Peterson as he walked away from the makeshift space Evan and Phil had been afforded as an offices space. “Thank you, Major” they both intoned, waiting until they figured the swapped officer was out of earshot. “Phill, how can I do this? You heard the general! What if …?” Evan spoke franticly, but Phil cut him off, gesturing for the former teenage boy to lower his voice. “Elaine,” he said, stressing his new name, “you heard the general. The whole world is in chaos and you’re the only one who’s stepped up to be the face of this insane situation we’re all in. Like it or not, we are all counting on you to deliver not just the news, but keep things from spiraling further out of control.” Phil grabbed Evan’s elegant, svelte frame by the shoulders and look straight into his eyes as he spoke, “Just imagine what’s going on out there. People have swapped bodies at random, everything we take for granted is up in the air right now and unless You step in front of the camera and give people a clue as to what’s going on and what to do things are only going to get worse.”

Evan looked up at Phil, who had ended up in Ken Parrise’s body, the head anchor from his home town station. Ken had been born to be a leading man, tall, with chiseled features and steely blue eyes that made you want to trust him instantly. The signals Elaine’s body was sending Evan were confusing and strange, but pleasurable in a way. “I … I … you’re … you’re right Phil,” Evan stuttered as Phil brushed a stray hair off his face. Before things got any more confusing for the boy turned adult woman, Evan pulled away and sat down at a table with the brief the Major had given them. “I should read this quickly before I go on the air,” Evan said, wondering what was going on with him, he’d never been attracted to other guys, but just the way Phil had looked at him and the feeling of his strong hands holding him … it was confusing.

“Yes, eh, lets look at the brief and we’ll get you on air in no time,” Phil added, taking the chair opposite Evan and grabbing a few of the papers. There was a hint of disappointment in his voice and for some reason Evan felt a pang of guilt and regret at hearing it. The two of them poured over the documents for a while before calling for Major Peterson to let him know Elaine Cho was ready. They were taken to another tent that had been outfitted with broadcasting equipment, electronics and set pieces so Evan could go on the air.

“How are we going to get this out to people? I’m sure not everyone is sitting in front of a TV and even says in the documents you gave me that communications are spotty at best throughout the country.” Evan inquired. “We have activated the emergency broadcast system, tapped into the cellphone network and we will be broadcasting over old school radio and other frequencies. To be honest, it might not reach everyone, but it’s the best we can do under the circumstances. Some of our communication infrastructure is fairly autonomous so as long as there is electricity, we’re hopeful that people will hear you, Ma’am.” The officer explained, “I guess it’s time then. Phil, would you count me off, please?”

“Of course,” he replied as Evan walked to his mark in front of the cameras.
1233321212.title: Evan delivers the broadcast

12333212121.content:
“Good evening, this is Elaine Cho coming to you live from the Capital,” Evan started right after Phil silently counted down to zero. “The National Press Association and the military are working together to bring you this broadcast. As you are all aware an unprecedented and as yet unexplained event has made the majority of people swap bodies seemingly at random.” Evan felt a sort of out of body experience as he read the teleprompter. This was him, Evan, a teenage boy reading the news as pretty much the only source of news currently in the air and in the body of an adult woman to top it all off. There was a detached part of his mind that didn’t quite believe this was where his life had taken him.

“As of this moment and until the proper, civilian government has been accounted for and secured the military will maintain continuity of government and ensure security for our citizens.” Phil looked uncomfortable at this piece of the report, but Evan couldn’t focus on that at the moment. ”At this time we ask that those of you who have swapped into or made your way to public building such as schools, libraries , police stations, fire stations, etc. please stay put. These sites will be used as shelters and will start the process of identifying people. We also ask that those who are on the streets head for shelter as quickly and safely as possible.” Evan switched to look at a different camera in what to any observer would have seemed like a practiced motion.

“We have reports of power outages and cuts in basic utilities and services. If you are member of a utility provider and are able bodied we ask that you report to your work site as soon as you’re able so we can begin to normalize the situation. We similarly ask that medical, emergency and military personnel present to your closest facility and to triage the situation as needed.” Evan went on for a while detailing procedures in place to begin to control the situation. Though it wasn’t part of the broadcast, the report he and Phil had been given had underscored possible and terrifying scenarios if the situation wasn’t controlled in quickly and effectively. With no one manning the refineries for example, the country would run out of gas in short order. The general had already dispatched personnel to secure the nuclear plants and other dangerous sites around the country, but the situation was highly unpredictable and rapidly changing.

“To any reporters in the field that are in a position to report on what is happening in your area, please reach out to us through the following,” Evan rattled off different ways of contacting the camp he was in, so they could start building a news network as well as get information for the government to work with. The camera’s turned off and Evan’s new shoulders sagged a little once he was sure he was no longer being recorded. “You did great Elaine, hopefully we’ll start hearing from across the country soon. They’ve set us up at a nearby hotel so we can get some rest before the next broadcast.” Evan thanked Phil and everyone in the makeshift studio and was glad to for the escort the general provided as they made their way through the city. It certainly looked like it would take a while before things would get back to normal.
12333212121.title: Presenting the news

1233323.content:
“Someone has to report on this...whatever it is.” Sighing, I said, “I guess I don’t have much of a choice.”

“You’re doing the right thing, Elaine.”

Looking at Phil, raising an eyebrow, I said, “Please don’t call me that, I’m not Elaine.”

“The public needs you to be Elaine Cho.”

I felt overwhelmed by the gravity of the situation I now found myself in. If I went along with this, I’d not only be reporting on what was going; I’d also be pretending that I was the real Elaine. Looking at Phil, I said, “I guess I don’t have much of choice, do I?”

“A helicopter will be here shortly to fly us to the Capital.” Pausing, Phil said, “Once we’re there, you’ll report on the Government’s response.”
1233323.title: The Moment of Truth

12333231.content:
The helicopter ride to the Capital went by without incident; Phil and I passed the time by looking out the window at the chaos below. After passing over a particularly bad accident on the highway, Phil turned to me and said, “This is why we need you, Elaine.”

“I’m not sure I can do this, Phil.” Looking at him, I said, “Making a news report is one thing, but I don’t think I’m ready for this.”

“You’ll do fine.”

"You realize what you're asking me to do, right?" sighing, I said, "I’m a teenage boy, I don’t know the first thing about being a grown woman.”

"Hopefully you won't have to keep up the charade for very long." looking at me, Phil said, "The real Elaine is bound to turn up eventually."

"I certainly hope so."

124.content:
The classroom evaporated into thin air, leaving me momentarily suspended in emptiness, and then the world around me rematerialized...

And I was standing in a dark, seedy bar, the neon signs advertising different beer brands above the counter. I stood elevated from all this, overlooking the spacious, smoke-filled room as best I could. It was hard to see much, aside from the general congregation of people stumbling around, leaning up against my platform, their large, hairy arms holding empty bottles of Heineken. Spotlights hung from the ceiling and floors and illuminated me, blocking my vision of the bar but helping everyone else to see me perfectly clear.

Some guy yelled, "Take it off, baby!" and I looked down...and nearly fainted.

I was a woman, first of all, but even worse, I'd transformed into a stripper! I looked to be about five foot eight, two inches taller than my old self, and my body curved and bent in places I never knew bodies could go before. My breasts, as large as melons, strained against the skimpy white undershirt I was wearing, and a white thong rode up my butt and held my crotch tightly, emphasizing the disappearance of a certain old friend. Black high heels kept me teetering and on the verge of falling off, but one of my hands, fingernails painted red, held onto a pole and I managed to remain upright, for the most part. Long, curly, bleach-blonde hair rolled down my shoulders and in front of my eyes, which were surrounded with an excessive amount of mascara and eyeliner, and my cheeks bled with rouge.

"I'm a..." I put a hand to my throat, surprised at my new, sultry alto, and continued staring at the bar around me. I still couldn't see beyond the spotlights, but I could hear a commotion spreading across the crowd.

Oh no... I thought. Do they want me to strip down? Do I have to now?

To her relief, the commotion wasn't about her. Someone yelled, "Hey, you bastard! That's my body!" and several similar shouts rang out. The crowd was breaking off, focusing in one area where a fist fight briefly broke out, and then it was heading out the door, panicking, some people screaming, "What is going on!?"

All this happened too fast for me to register as it happened, but I knew enough to see now was my chance to get out. I let go of the pole and eased myself off the platform, nearly tripping on my high heels several times. It would take some getting used to, I figured, but part of me hoped that all this would turn out to be a dream, and I'd find myself at home, in my sixteen-year old body, with a flat chest, penis, short hair, and smelly, old gym shoes.

But the way my breasts shook, pulling on my body as my undershirt feebly pushed them back, told me this was the farthest thing from a dream.

I figured I should head home and see if my mom was all right. Maybe Corrine returned home when things got crazy. I worked through my mind what I'd say to assure them that the half-naked bombshell at their door was their soon Evan, never once wondering if mom and Corrine had changed bodies too.

I was just about to head outside when a hand fell on my shoulder. I turned around, and it was...
124.title: A stripper

choices: Stick to the plan, go home
Change of plans: find out who we are, find where they live
1241.content:
Another woman, dark-skinned and wearing even less than me--a leather thong and leopard-patterned bra--desperately held my shoulder. She had curly, black hair and a pair of red pumps that threatened to send her tumbling onto me. I placed my hand on her shoulder, partially to support her, partially to support myself as well. There were tears in her eyes, and she talked slowly and with a strange inflection, like she wasn't used to the sound of her husky, yet distinctly feminine voice.

"Please, miss, you have to help me!" she pleaded. "Whoever you think I am, that's not me, I'm not this..." She gestured at her body, hesitantly, never looking down. "You need to help me!"

"It's all right," I said, and I understood why the other stripper was talking so strange. Hearing my voice, high and a little on the nasally side, gave me chills and made it infinitely difficult just to spit out those three words. I wondered who this stripper was, to be so unused to her voice. Maybe she'd been a guy before, like me, or a teenage girl transplanted in the body of a very mature black woman. Whatever the case, while I pitied her, I couldn't do anything to help. "Listen, uh...I know how you feel, but I can't help you."

"Please!" The woman fell on her knees and grabbed my legs. It just dawned on me how much more fit I was, how much less flab I had around my thighs. "I can't be stuck like this!"

"No, you don't understand. I'm just like you, this isn't who I am. A few seconds ago, I was a kid in high school. My name's Evan Peterson and..."

"Evan!?" The woman nearly leaped to her feet, which caused her knees to get shaky as she almost fell on her back. I quickly grabbed her by the arm before she went down. "You're Evan?"

"Yeah..."

"It's me, man! Ryan, I'm Ryan!"

My heart about skipped a beat. "Ryan?! Oh my God, you're..."

For a second, it didn't matter that we'd both turned into strippers at some seedy bar that may or may not have been close to home. We hugged each other and didn't let go until the feel of our boobs pressing together got too awkward, but even then I felt much more relaxed. Sure, I might be a twenty or thirty-something blonde vixen, and Ryan's switched spots on the gender and race spectrum, but everything will be okay, I told myself. At least I'm not doing this alone.

"Do you know what happened?" I asked him after we were done laughing and patting each other on the hand.

Ryan shrugged. "Beats me. One second, I was in the bathroom, unzipping my fly to take a whiz, and the next, well..." He finally mustered the courage to look down and pat his chest. "I'm holding these in both hands, in the middle of waving them up and down for some fifty-year old dude breathing down my neck."

"Jesus, man, that's harsh," I said. "That's a lot worse than me. I was listening to Ms. Tomlin drone on and on, and then poof! I'm standing up there in this."

"I don't know if that's not worse, I mean...it looks like you're dealing with a lot more weight on the boob front."

"Yeah, but what you've got ain't bad either, and you're showing a lot more of it than me."

We got to laughing again, but not as loudly as before, and it died down faster. As much as we made light of it, neither of us were the slightest bit comfortable with the bodies fate had given us three minutes before.

"So what now, Evan?" Ryan asked.
