1331121112.content:
I slowly made my way towards the door that Kyle had pointed to, walking inside to find a Jacuzzi-sized bathtub. It was not at all surprising to see that, considering this place looked to be part of a high priced condominium complex.

After closing the door, making a note to find out what Kyle did for a living, I turned the water on and started taking off my clothes. Seeing myself in the mirror, I started to wonder what LeAnn looked like before she’d gotten pregnant; no doubt she was a very
attractive girl before all this happened.

Once the tub was filled, I slowly stepped in and lay back in the tub; marveling at how the water seemed to take off the weight of my stomach. I sat in the tub for a while, thinking about everything and wishing I had someone to talk to about what I was dealing with.
That was when I realized that I did...the baby I was now carrying.

"Hello in there," rubbing my stomach, I said, “I hope that you’re not affected by what has been happening; hopefully you got lucky like your father and are accustomed to hearing this voice.”

"I wish I was as lucky as him; since I’m not the same person I was when you were conceived.” Chuckling, I said, “I was just some teenage boy from Maryland; I’ve never slept with anyone and now I’m suddenly a 24 year old pregnant woman in Texas.”

"Anyway baby, I don’t know if this is permanent or anything; but if it is then I have a lot to learn about being a woman and a mother
before you’re born.” Smiling to myself, I said, “With that said, don’t hold it against me if I mess things up.”

“I’ll help you with that, Evan.”

Startled, I turned to find Kyle standing in the doorway carrying some fresh clothes. “H-How long have you been standing there?”

“Long enough to know how uncertain you are about all this.” Placing the clothes on the counter, Kyle said, “I’m responsible for you being pregnant; so I’ll help you where I can.”

“Thanks, Kyle.” Smiling, I said, “Now...uh, could I have some privacy?”

“Sure, sorry.” Stepping towards the door, Kyle said, “I’m cooking some dinner; I hope you like lasagna because that’s what LeAnn’s been craving lately.”

“Sounds good,” reaching to open the drain, I said, “I know you’re used to seeing this body naked; but can you please leave?”

Once Kyle left the room, I climbed out of the tub and proceeded to dry off. As I dried my hair, my thoughts went back to just before;
when I was somewhat abrupt with Kyle. As I started to get dressed, I made a decision to apologize to Kyle for my attitude.

After struggling for a few minutes with the bra, I was fully dressed in a pair of stretchy pajama pants and a top that did nothing to hide my new baby bump. Walking into the main room, I saw that Eric was awake and watching a news report from the couch. As I walked behind the couch, I ruffled up her hair and said, “You feeling better, Eric?”

“As best as I can be, considering everything that’s going on.” Sitting up, Eric turned around and leaned against the back of the couch to look at me. “How are you doing?”

“Now that I’ve had a relaxing bath, I’m feeling much better.”

“That’s good; I’m glad.” Smiling, Eric said, “I’m still in shock at my change; but I can’t imagine how this is affecting you.”

With a smile, I walked passed Eric and made my way into the kitchen where Kyle was stirring the sauce for the lasagna. Leaning against the fridge, I said, “Hey, you got a minute?”

“Sure.” Looking at me, Kyle said, “What’s up?”

“I-I wanted to apologize for what I did in the bathroom; I’m still in shock about all of this and I wasn’t expecting someone to be watching me naked in the tub.”

“You’ve got nothing to apologize for; I should have knocked.” Looking at me, with a smile, Kyle said, “You’re not really my girlfriend, so I have to accept that I can no longer see that body naked or anything like that.”

“Maybe we should set some ground rules; so you don’t barge in on Eric or me when we’re taking a shower or something.”

“I agree; but lets not do that now.” Sighing, Kyle said, “Today’s been stressful enough already.”

Sensing how stressed Kyle was, I couldn’t help but feel bad for him. With nothing else to do, I reached over and pulled him into a hug. Kyle hesitated for a moment before embracing me; which served to not only calm the two of us down but, to my
embarrassment, make me a little turned on. Breaking the hug, I turned to Kyle and said, “We’ll get through this; all three of us.”
1331121112.title: Trying to Calm Down

13311211121.content:
The next few days passed uneventfully; with a 24/7 curfew in place there was no way for any of us to leave the condominium even if we wanted to. We communicated with LeAnn a few times to make sure my family was alright; learning that mom had swapped my dad, my dad was now a girl from Corinne’s homeroom and Corinne was lucky enough not to have swapped.

Eventually, however, long distance calls became impossible so I was cut off from my family. It did give me a chance to get to know
Kyle and Eric. It turned out that they both worked for the same investment firm in the city, but in different departments. I could not help but wonder why Kyle, an obviously successful man, was dating a waitress from a nearby diner.

He assured me, however, that LeAnn had been going to school to be a paralegal when she got pregnant; putting her plans on hold for a while.

Anyways, it was the Monday after the Shift and I was walking out of the bathroom just as Eric was getting off the phone. He had been calling friends and neighbors since Saturday in an attempt to find his daughter but with no avail. Looking at him, I said, “Still no luck, huh?”

“No, and that is what’s scaring me.” Pausing, Eric said, “I have Brianna’s cellphone, you’d think she would have called it just to see if I was in her body.”

“Maybe she’s in an area with bad service; or is just in too much shock to be thinking straight.”

“That’s what I keep telling myself; but it doesn’t help to calm me down that much.” Jumping off the bar stool, Eric said, “How are you doing?”

“Pretty well, I guess; that memory foam mattress in the bedroom is doing wonders for my back.” Sitting down, I said, “Any idea when Kyle’s coming back?”

Kyle had gone out to find some food at the neighboring convenience store; he had been gone for only 10 minutes. “I’m sure he’ll be right back.” Looking at me, Eric said, “You seem worried about him.”

“Of course I’m worried; he’s the father of my baby and the only one protecting us.”

“Your baby?” looking at me, Eric said, “Are you feeling alright?”

“No, not really.” Sighing, I said, “I’m starting to notice some mental changes; especially with the baby and Kyle.”

“Like what kind of mental changes?”

“I’m ashamed to admit it; but all the pregnancy hormones are making me really horny and its all I can do to stop myself from making out with Kyle.” Placing a hand on my stomach, I said, “Plus I have a feeling this is going to be permanent; and I’m starting to become attached to the baby and thinking of it as mine.”

“You may think of it as yours, but what about the real LeAnn?”

“I don’t think she really cares about the baby right now.” Looking at Eric, I said, “Kyle hasn’t said anything about it, but from the lack
of pregnancy books and baby things in the condo, I get the sense that LeAnn wasn’t all that into the idea of having a baby.”

“Before you start claiming the baby as yours; I think you should talk to Kyle about the situation.” Sitting next to me on the couch,
Eric said, “If this is permanent, you may have some legal protection as the woman who physically gave birth the baby; but I don’t know for sure.”

“Thanks, Eric; you’ve been a real help.” Pulling Eric close, I smiled and said, “And I’m not just talking about today; you’ve been a real help the last few days with me.”

“It’s no big deal.” With a smile, Eric said, “I have experience with pregnant woman, so I have a general understanding of what you’re going through.”
13311211121.title: A Few Days Later

133112111211.content:
Later that evening, I had that conversation with Kyle about LeAnn; and it turned out that my suspicions were correct. Eric was asleep in the master bedroom and I was in the family room with Kyle; on the couch watching a random DVD.

Looking at Kyle, I said, “I-I think we need to have a talk, Kyle.”

“A talk about what?”

“About LeAnn.” Sighing, I said, “Feel free to tell me if I’m totally wrong here; but I get the feeling that she doesn’t really love you and didn’t like being pregnant.”

“What gave you that idea?”

“Aside from the fact that she was always asking how her body was and not asking about you?” pausing, I said, “I couldn’t help but sense relief in her voice whenever we talked; like she was happy not to be pregnant anymore.”

After being silent for a moment, Kyle said, “You’re not wrong at all; in fact I’m surprised you picked up on it so quickly.”

“Care to explain it to me?”

“LeAnn and I had met through a mutual friend; we went on a few dates and things seemed to be going well.” Sighing, Kyle said, “One night we got drunk and slept together; four weeks later she tells me that she’s pregnant.”

“Why wouldn’t she be happy about being pregnant?”

“Because she’s the same age her mom was when she got pregnant; one semester away from a masters degree and she had to drop out because she was pregnant with LeAnn.” Looking at me, Kyle said, “I guess LeAnn resented me for getting her pregnant and destroying her dreams for college.”

“That seems like a pretty shallow reason to resent someone; she could have just went back after the baby was born.” Pausing, I looked at Kyle and said, “All that must’ve have been difficult for you; since, by the way you act around me, I can tell you genuinely care about her.”

“You’re right; and I think the only reason she’s staying with me is because she doesn’t want to be a single mother going to college.”

“You deserve so much better than that, Kyle.” Taking Kyle’s hand, I said, “I hope you can find someone who genuinely cares about you.”

“That’s the thing; I think I already have.”

Shocked, I said, “Who could you have possibly found in the last four days; when you’ve been here with me the entire...please tell me you’re joking.”

“I’ve seen the way you look at me, Evan; it’s obvious that the pregnancy is affecting you.” Pausing, Kyle said, “I can’t say it’ll be a perfect relationship; but I think I can make you happy.”

“This is all a bit sudden; I-I’m still coming to terms with all that’s happening.” I quickly realized I was stalling to keep myself from doing something I had wanted to do for the last two days. Realizing I could not keep it up much longer, I said, “Oh; what the hell.”

Before Kyle could react, I pulled him in and gave him a passionate kiss on the lips. It didn’t take more than a few seconds before Kyle reciprocated; we kissed passionately on the couch for what seemed like an eternity, neither of us wanting to end the moment.
133112111211.title: That Night

1331121112111.content:
I woke up the next morning with the kiss still on my mind; wondering not only why I did it but also why I seemed to enjoy it so much. Getting out of bed, I looked over to find that Eric was already awake and out of the room.

As I walked into the bathroom, I found it amusing how I was skittish about sharing the bed with the rightful boyfriend of this body but was okay with sharing it with a 32 year old man in a little girl’s body. Once I had relieved myself, I walked down the hall to the kitchen where I saw Eric eating a bowl of cereal.

As had become a bit of a joke between us, I ruffled Eric’s hair and said, “Good morning, kiddo.”

“Morning.” Looking up from his cereal, Eric said, “You’re in a good mood this morning; what’s up?”

“Kyle and I talked last night about LeAnn; and we, uh, kind of made out of the couch.”

“How do you kind of make out on the couch?” looking at me, Eric said, “You either did or you didn’t; which is it?”

“Okay; we did make out on the couch.” Seeing the surprised look on Eric’s face, I said, “It was a spur of the moment thing; I was so wound up by this body’s hormones that I just kissed him.”

“Wait a minute...you kissed him first?” confused, Eric said, “I thought you were into girls, Evan?”

“I was, I mean I am into girls.” Pouring myself some orange juice, I said, “I’m not really sure anymore; especially after I found myself in the body of a 24 year old pregnant woman.”

“I guess we’ll figure things out as we go along.” With a chuckle, Eric said, “What’s the worse that could possibly happen; it’s not like you can get pregnant.”

Chuckling, I said, “Oh very funny.”

Just then, as I was drinking the orange juice, Kyle walked into the condo. The kiss was clearly on his mind as well; because I noticed him blushing a bit when he saw me. Seeing the look on his face, Eric said, “What’s up, Kyle?”

“I just got off the phone with a friend at the local hospital; they, uh, found your daughter.” Taking a deep breath, Kyle said, “She must’ve gotten into some kind of accident after the Shift; because doctors say she fell 15 feet onto a concrete sidewalk not far from here.”

“Oh my god.” Shocked, Eric said, “I-I she going to be alright?”

Kyle glanced at me silently; I knew the answer immediatetly and it wasn’t good. Turning to Eric, Kyle said, “Her injuries were quite severe; it’s not likely that she’ll live through the day.”

That was enough for Eric to simply blackout and fall to the floor. Rushing to his side, I picked him up and held him in my arms until he regained consciousness. Tears streaming down his face, Eric said, “Please, you have to get me to the hospital.”

“I’ll see what I can do; my neighbor down the hall is a cop, so he can get us through the roadblocks.”

Once Kyle left the room, I found my maternal instincts kicking in once again. Holding Eric close, I said, “It’ll be alright; we’ll get you to your daughter, Eric.”

Unable to speak, Eric buried himself in my arms and cried.
1331121112111.title: The Next Morning

13311211121111.content:
It had been two days since Kyle found out about Eric’s daughter; two days since she succumbed to her injuries. Eric hadn’t left the bedroom since then, understandably upset about the turn of events in his life. Kyle and I were started to worry about Eric; he hadn’t eaten in two days.

I was sitting on the couch, reading a book on pregnancy, when Kyle walked into the condo carrying some shopping bags of food. Putting the book down, I walked over to the kitchen and looked into the bags. Glancing at Kyle, I said, “Guess there wasn’t a whole lot to choose from?”

“Nope, I was lucky to get what I could.” Sighing, taking some bread from the bag, Kyle said, “There were a lot of people taking advantage of the government alleviating some of the curfews.”

“You know, I could have gone with you and gotten more food.”

“I saw several fights in the grocery store.” Placing a hand on my baby bump, Kyle said, “There was no chance I was going to endanger you or the baby.”

“I’m starting to feel cooped up here, Kyle.” Sighing, I said, “It doesn’t help that I’m being a surrogate mother to a grown man in the body of an 8 year old girl.”

Looking past me to the bedroom door, Kyle said, “He’s still in there?”

“Yeah, he’s still in there; although I guess we really can’t blame him.” Looking at Kyle, I said, “You knew immediately that LeAnn was okay; imagine being in Eric’s position where it took several days to find out what happened to his daughter.”

“I can’t imagine what he’s going through; but he should know we’re both here for him.” Pausing, Kyle said, “He’s an adult, he should know not to keep his emotions inside.”

I was about to say something, when I heard Eric’s voice behind me. “Do you guys think this is easy for me?” taking a breath, Eric said, “Neither of you can imagine what it’s like to know your daughter is dead; I have to look at her face every day for the rest of my life.”

“You’re right, neither of us know what you’re going through.” Walking over to Eric, Kyle said, “But Evan is in the boat as you, he’s dealing with a life altering incident same as you.”

“Oh come on, that’s not the same; Evan has you for emotional support.” Sighing, Eric said, “Who do I have?”

“What do you mean I have Kyle for emotional support?”

“It’s pretty obvious that you guys are both attracted to each other; I’m sure if I wasn’t here, you guys would have been sleeping together by now.”

“I’m not really attracted to Kyle; it’s because being pregnant is messing with my mind.” Pausing, I said, “Sure, we made out for a while; but that was a spur of the moment thing.”

“Okay, maybe I’m completely off base.” Pausing, Eric said, “But the point is that I’ve got no one who can be emotionally supportive of me.”

“That’s where you’re wrong.” Glancing at Kyle, I said, “We’re here for you; I mean Kyle is keeping both of us safe and fed. I was shifted just as you, so I have a very good idea what you’re dealing with.”

That was clearly too much for Eric; because before Kyle and I could do anything, he collapsed to the floor in tears. I immediately ran over to him and held him in my arms.
13311211121111.title: Continue

133112111211111.content:
After calming Eric down, I got him to lie down on the couch and watch some TV. Once I was sure he was okay, I joined Kyle out on the patio. Closing the sliding door, I said, “You know Eric didn’t mean what he said; I think we be able to control ourselves around each other.”

“That’s the thing Evan, I-I don’t think I can.” Turning to me, Kyle said, “On the one hand I know you’re not really my girlfriend; but on the other, I-I can’t help but think of you in a romantic way.”

“What are you saying?”

“I-I think I’m falling in love with you, Evan.” Seeing the shocked look on my face, Kyle said, “I know it’s sudden; but the last few days I’ve been happier with you around then I ever was with LeAnn.”

“Could you explain that to me?” confused, I said, “Because I’m not sure I follow where you’re going with this.”

“When we kissed on the couch, I felt a passion that I never felt with LeAnn.” Taking my hands in his, Kyle said, “I know it sounds cheesy, but you’re the girl I’ve been waiting my whole life for.”

“I-I don’t know what to say.” Looking at Kyle, I said, “This body is definitely attracted to you, and the hormones are causing some interesting problems for me. But I’m not really a 24 year old woman; I’m a teenage boy.”

“I know it’s weird; and before all this happened I never would have imagined things going in this direction.” Pulling me close, Kyle said, “But I do know that I’m falling in love with you, Evan; and I’m pretty sure you’re falling in love with me.”

At that point, I could barely control myself; my body was telling me to give in while my male mind was telling me to keep fighting.
Unfortunately, the hormones made that a losing battle; so I soon found myself in a passionate kiss with Kyle as thunder rumbled in the distance.

We stayed like that for a couple minutes until we heard someone open the door behind us. Breaking the kiss, we turned to find Eric standing in the doorway. Looking at us, he said, “So I guess this means I’ll be the one sleeping on the couch for a while?”

My hand in Kyle’s, I glanced at him for a moment before turning to Eric. “At least for tonight; so we can test things out.”

Looking at me, Kyle said, “I guess I’ll move my stuff back into the bedroom.”

Once Kyle was gone, Eric looked at me and said, “Is this really happening, or are you just giving into your pregnancy hormones.”

“I don’t know; that’s why we’re going to take things so.” Sighing, with a smile, I said, “But I think this is for real.”

“Just promise to take things slow; I’ve gotten to know you both well enough that I care what happens to both of you.”
133112111211111.title: Continue

1331121112111111.content:
It had been about just over a week since Kyle and I decided to try being a couple; and I had to admit I was actually happy with the way things were going. He was a sweet guy, making me breakfast in bed every morning and giving me massages at night.

A few days after we decided to change our relationship, the government dropped the curfew and allowed everyone to go back to work. That meant I was back at the diner and Kyle was back at the investment firm, while Eric stayed in the condominium until he could figure out what he wanted to do now.

I thought he should go back to school in his daughter’s place and take the second chance he had been given with the Shift, while Kyle thought he should continue working at the firm. The three of us were not the only ones dealing with drastic changes from the Shift. Carl, the man from the diner who had swapped with a female coworker, had become a single mother after learning his girlfriend had shifted into a 7-year-old boy.

After a long day at work, interacting with people still dealing with their changes, I was glad to be safely home with Kyle and Eric.
Walking through the front door, I saw Kyle cooking dinner and Eric watching TV. Seeing me, as I placed my purse on the counter, Kyle walked over and kissed me on the lips. “Hi babe, how was work?”

“It was interesting; it turns out our situation isn’t the weirdest one out there. I served a teenage couple today who used to be an elderly couple in a retirement home; although now the husband is the girl in the relationship.” Looking at Kyle, I said, “Did you just call me babe?”

“Yeah, I was thinking of an affectionate nickname to call you; that way I can think of you as the new LeAnn and not call you something I used on the old LeAnn.”

“I like the sound of that.” Kissing Kyle back, I said, “I’m lucky to have you for a boyfriend.”

“Speaking of that, I went to city hall and got those papers we were talking about.” Gesturing to an interoffice envelope on the counter, Kyle said, “As soon as I’ve signed them, the clerk will make it official.”

Without Kyle or I realizing it, Eric had wandered over from the couch. Looking at us, he said “What are you going to make official?”

I turned to Eric and said, “I think we should tell him, babe.”

“Since you have no living immediate family; you’re legally an orphan.” Looking at Eric, Kyle said, “Evan and I were discussing what
could be done for you; and I decided that I would start paperwork to adopt you as my daughter.”

“Really?” bursting into tears, Eric ran over and hugged Kyle. Between tears, he said, “You guys are the best; I was worried I’d end up in foster care or something.”

“Since I’m only his live in girlfriend, you’ll legally be Kyle’s daughter.” looking at Eric, I said, “If things keep going the way they have been, I’m sure Kyle and I will eventually get married; which means I could legally adopt you as well.”

“Thank you guys, this means so much to me.” Moving from Kyle to me, Eric said, “I promise I’ll be the perfect daughter and big sister.”

After giving us both another hug, Eric ran back to the TV. Looking at me, Kyle said, “You want to get married someday, huh?”

“Well you’ve already gotten me pregnant and we’re kind of dating, so yeah it would be nice.” With a smile, I said, “There’s no pressure though; so take your time.”

“Don’t worry, babe.” Kissing me, Kyle said, “We’ll be husband and wife eventually.”

“I’m glad to hear that.” Smiling, I said, “Now if you don’t mind, I’m covered if spilt coffee and need to take a shower.”
1331121112111111.title: A Week Later

13311211121111111.content:
I had had just gotten out of the shower and was drying myself off when Kyle walked into the bathroom. Just goes to show how things had changed between us, I no longer got annoyed if he came into the bathroom when I was in there.

Looking at him, I saw a curious look on his face. “What’s on your mind, babe?”

“Nothing, I was just thinking about how beautiful you look.”

“Oh haha.” Looking at him, I said, “I’m soaking wet and as big as a whale; I’m far from beautiful.”

“Beauty is in the eye of the beholder, LeAn...Evan.” with a smile, Kyle said, “Come on, can’t I give my girlfriend a compliment every now and then.”

“You can give me a compliment, but only so long as you call me by my real name.” sighing, I said, “I’m not really LeAnn, so I don’t know if I deserve to be called that.”

“Why not?” confused, Kyle said, “You have her body; and she’s 1200 miles away in Maryland. In my mind you’re LeAnn.”

“I guess you’re right.” Pausing, I said, “But I get the feeling that’s not why you came in here, is it?”

“No, it’s not.” Closing the door, Kyle said, “Last month, before the Shift, I made a reservation at a fancy restaurant and hotel in the city; to mark my two year anniversary with LeAnn.”

“Let me guess, you want to cancel the reservation since LeAnn isn’t really here?”

“No, I don’t want to cancel the reservation.” Looking at me, Kyle said, “In fact I want to take you to dinner and spend the evening at the hotel.”

“Why?”

“Because today is the one week anniversary of when you and I decided to try dating.” Pausing, Kyle said, “It seems to me like we should celebrate that occasion.”

“Okay, I’ll admit I’m a little interested.” Gesturing towards the closed bathroom door, I said, “What about Eric? We can’t leave him alone for the evening.”

“I know; that’s why I asked Carl if he could come over and babysit.”

“I can imagine that going over real well; since his wife and Eric are adults in the bodies of children.”

“I’ve actually already mentioned it to Eric and he’s okay with it.” Sighing, Kyle said, “Frankly I think he’s getting sick of just seeing us around; so some new faces might be a nice idea.”

“Okay, I’m convinced.” Smiling, I said, “The problem is that I have nothing to wear for such a fancy evening.”

“LeAnn picked out a dress for the occasion; I picked it up from the dry cleaners this morning.” Pausing, Kyle said, “Don’t worry; it’s a maternity dress but it is quite fashionable.”
13311211121111111.title: Continue

133112111211111111.content:
After Carl arrived with his wife-turned-son, Kyle and I made sure Eric was going to behave for him. As we walked out of the condominium towards Kyle’s car, I saw my reflection in a nearby mirror and stopped in my tracks. Even though it was a dress for pregnant women, it still did a good job of making me look attractive. “Oh wow, that really is me; isn’t it?”

“Yeah, that’s really you.” Smiling, Kyle looked at me and said, “You look so beautiful right now.”

“It’s just hitting me that I used to be a teenage boy; if any of my friends saw me like this they’d probably think I’d gone insane.”

“They’re probably in similar situations; so it wouldn’t be right for them to say that.” Walking over to me, Kyle said, “Look Evan, I think what you’ve been doing the last week is incredibly brave.”

“What exactly am I doing?” as we stepped into the elevator, I said, “I’m just trying to move on with my life the best I can.”

“It’s not just that.” Pressing the button for the ground floor, Kyle said, “You’ve shown incredible strength; if I were in your position I’d probably still be an emotional wreck.”

“Believe me that was very close to happening.” Sighing, I said, “But I didn’t want to do that to you or Eric; put any more pressure on either of you.”

“I appreciate that; but I can’t help but wonder what all this is doing to you.” Stepping out of the elevator, my hand in his, Kyle said,
“You were a teenage boy before all this; now you’re not only a 24 year old pregnant woman but you’re dating the boyfriend of the body’s original owner. Some might think that is a little insane.”

“Oh, so because I gave into this body’s urges that makes me insane?” getting agitated, I said, “You and I both agreed that we
should start dating; because you loved LeAnn and I’m currently in her body. If you want to break up, just let me know.”

“Okay I see where this is going; you’re having a mood swing.” Looking at me, Kyle said, “Look Evan; I never truly loved LeAnn, I was only with her because she got pregnant and I didn’t want to leave my unborn child without a father. But I do love you...I love you more than I’ve ever loved anyone in my life.”

“Are you sure you’re not just saying that to calm me down?”

“Of course I am; but I’m also saying it because it’s true.” taking a step towards me, Kyle said, “You’re the best girlfriend a guy could ask for; you know how guys think and you understand me. I know we’re not at the point yet; but I want to spend the rest of my life with you.”

“What about LeAnn and her parents?” confused, I said, “I don’t think they’d like me taking over her life.”

“LeAnn hasn’t contacted us at all since the phone lines came back; it’s pretty obvious she wants nothing to do with me or you.” Pausing, Kyle said, “LeAnn’s parents already know about us; they want to meet you but they’re supportive. I think they see you as a better daughter then LeAnn ever was.”

“I’m sorry for snapping at you, babe.” Tearing up, my emotions all out of sorts, I said, “I’ve just been under so much stress with suddenly finding myself pregnant and losing 10 years of my life to some freak accident.”

“No need to apologize, I understand this has been hard on you.” Pulling me in for a hug, Kyle said, “That’s why you should think of tonight as way to relax as well marking the start of our physical relationship.”

“Our physical relationship?” it took a moment for me to realize what Kyle was saying. Looking at Kyle, I said, “Are you implying
that we’re going to be intimate tonight?”

“If you’re okay with that.” Sighing, Kyle said, “To be honest, I haven’t had sex with LeAnn at all while she was pregnant. I want to end my dry spell.”

“I was wondering when we’d finally do it.” As Kyle opened the car door and helped me inside, I said, “Okay; after dinner we’ll go to the hotel and have some incredibly passionate sex.”
133112111211111111.title: Continue

1331121112111111112.content:
A few days later, I was getting ready for my first meeting with LeAnn's parents. "Thanks for the shopping trip, Kyle," I said. "I swear, I get bigger every time I turn around."

"You're almost seven months along," he replied. "And the baby's not done growing yet."

I was about to groan at the thought, but the doorbell interrupted me. "They're here."

Kyle went to the front door, then brought an older couple into the room. "Good to see you again."

"Likewise, Kyle," said the woman. She looked like an older version of LeAnn. She turned to me. "Should I call you Evan or LeAnn?"

"I pretty much go by either name. You must be my body's parents."

"LeAnn hadn't seen a lot of us between her moving out and the Great Shift," said her father as he took off his cowboy hat. "I'm a bit surprised you agreed to meet with us."

"I was always close with my family before this happened," I explained. "Besides, I can't imagine you wouldn't want to see your grandson."

"Grandson?" LeAnn's mom asked. "You've had all the tests, then?"

"Not really. It's a feeling I have. I know it's a boy, just like I know where my right arm is when I wake up."

"Suddenly turning into a pregnant woman has to be strange," her dad said. "How have you held up?"

"I was plenty surprised at first. But I'm used to it now. In fact, I'm almost sad that, one day soon, I won't be pregnant anymore."

"Have you been taking birthing classes?"

"Birthing classes?"

The mom chuckled. "Dear, you may know where babies come from. You may even know where babies come out. But you aren't born knowing how to bring them into the world."
1331121112111111112.title: Meeting the parents

13311211121111111121.content:
It wasn’t long before everyone was seated in the living room; Kyle and I sitting together on the couch while LeAnn’s parents sat in the chairs across from us. It was clear from the looks on their faces that they could sense something between Kyle and me. Giving Kyle’s hand an affectionate squeeze, I took a breath and said, “I guess it’s probably best to address the elephant in the room.” Pausing, I said, “Yes, Kyle and I are romantically involved.”

“I kind of figured that.” Smiling, LeAnn’s dad said, “The way he spoke about you told me that he was in love with you.”

“I hope you don’t mind me asking this, Evan. But,” looking at me, LeAnn’s mom said, “Were you attracted to men before the Shift?”

“No I wasn’t; I guess being in a girl’s body and the hormones from being pregnant changed that aspect of who I am.” Pausing, I said, “I mean I still like girls to a certain extent; but I’m more attracted to Kyle than anyone I’ve ever been with.

“I am curious about something else.” Taking a breath, LeAnn’s mom said, “Have you two been...intimate?”

“Yes Barbara; we have.” Looking at me, Kyle said, “A few days ago would have been an anniversary for LeAnn and me; so I kept the dinner and hotel reservations and treated Evan to a romantic dinner to mark our own anniversary. It had been one week since we decided to start dating.”

“I hope you aren’t upset by all this; I mean I’m not really your daughter so it could be seen as me abusing her body.”

Barbara looked at her husband for a moment. Turning back to us, she said, “I’ll admit this entire situation is unusual. But we’re okay with you two dating.” Sighing, Barbara said, “In fact Evan, I think it’s safe to say that Kyle cares for you more than he ever did for LeAnn.”

“He’s told me that himself on several occasions.” Pausing, I said, “I hope I’m not being rude; but from everything I’ve learned over the past few weeks I get the sense that LeAnn was a selfish person. Kyle has told me that she resented him for getting her pregnant.”

“LeAnn was always very selfish growing up.” Looking at me, LeAnn’s dad said, “We were hoping that being pregnant would soften that a little bit; but since you’ve both told us how she hasn’t contacted you at all in the last two weeks, I think it’s safe to say she’s
still the same person she always was.”

“As strange as it sounds, you’re the daughter that I always wished I had.” Getting up from the chair, Barbara walked over to me.
Taking my hands in hers, she said, “As far as I’m concerned, you are LeAnn Elizabeth Conroy; and you can consider me to be your mother.”

I started to tear up when I heard that. Getting to my feet, which was no easy task, I embraced Barbara and said, “Thank you...mom.”

Both Mom and I cried for a few moments; until I broke the hug. Looking at me, Dad said, “Can I have a hug from my little girl?”

“Sure...daddy.”

After we’d all hugged and cried for a bit, Kyle suddenly said, “Oh crap, I completely forgot we have to go pick up Grace from your coworker’s house.”

As Kyle got up, Mom turned to me and said, “Whose Grace?”

“It’s a long story.” Smiling, I said, “Basically she’s a former man in his 30s shifted into the body of his 8 year old daughter; who Kyle just adopted.”
13311211121111111121.title: Continue

133112111211111111212.content:
“You adopted her? Him? Her?” asked mom, stuttering a bit, “Officially Kyle did, and like me, I don’t think Him applies anymore. She’s gone through … well, quite a lot and in this crazy new world adopting her seemed like the right thing to do,” I explained. Kyle squeezed my hand and gave one of his adoring looks. My new parents gave each other a look and chuckled a bit, “What’s so funny?” I asked.

“You are going to make a great mom, dear. You have the instinct,” said mom with a smile. All I could do was blush. “Both of you, you’re going to make great parents,” chimed dad. He continued, “LeAnn … well, she was a sweet child, but that selfish streak was always there and it only got stronger as she grew up. With all the things happening after the Shift we expected to hear from her, for her to reach out to us, but, well, we hope she’s happy in her new life and that maybe someday she’ll look to us again. As you’re learning, children change your world, but now the world has changed it’s given us a new child to love.”

I could not hold back the tears as he spoke, I rushed to them and let them envelop me in their embrace. “We have to run,” I said wiping the tears from my face, “we have to go pick up Grace.”

“Of course dear, we’d also like to meet her, if that’s okay,” said mom. I looked at Kyle and he gave a slight nod. “We’ll ask her, but I’m sure she’ll be happy to meet you guys,” I replied.
133112111211111111212.title: Reader's Choice

1331121112111111112121.content:
Kyle and I were lying in bed later that evening; having got home a short time later from an impromptu dinner at a nearby restaurant. My new parents spent most of the evening doting on Grace; despite the fact that she used to be not that much younger than them,
she was enjoying playing the role of the granddaughter.

With Grace asleep in what had been Kyle’s office but was now her bedroom, Kyle and I were having some time to ourselves.
Following mom’s advice, I was surfing the web for local hospitals that had birthing classes. I was looking at one particular hospital when Kyle said, “I thought things went well tonight; I was really worried they wouldn’t understand why we were in a relationship.”

“I’m not even sure why we’re in a relationship. But,” leaning over, I gave Kyle a kiss on the lips, “I’m glad we are; it’s given me something to focus on while I get over what happened.”

Looking at a picture of Grace and my parents on his phone, Kyle said, “It’s hard to believe Grace used to be a man in his 30s; after how she was at the restaurant I can’t see her as anything but a little girl now.”

“I think she’s putting on a brave front; but deep down she’s still uncertain about everything.” Chuckling, I said, “I’ll be honest though; given the fact that she was already a teenager once, I’m hoping she’s not a moody teenager who hates her parents.”

“I’m sure she’ll be a typical teenager; but hopefully she’ll be more mature in some ways.”

“I hope so too.” Spotting a nearby picture of LeAnn with brown hair, I turned to Kyle and said, “I have to ask you something; would you be alright with it if I went back to LeAnn...my natural hair color?”

“I won’t mind; I liked LeAnn...you better as a brunette anyway.” Kissing me, Kyle said, “I never understood why LeAnn dyed her hair in the first place.”

“That’s one of the many things I’d like to ask her if she ever contacts us again.” Turning off the laptop, I leaned over and placed it on my nightstand. After turning off the light, I turned to Kyle and said, “Goodnight babe.”
1331121112111111112121.title: Continue

13311211121111111121211.content:
I fully intended to drift off to sleep, but the sound of someone crying caught my attention. It wasn't hard to figure out who it was. I pulled myself out of bed and made my way to Grace's room.

I had a hard time seeing my feet, so I couldn't walk as fast as I wanted to. But I made it, and knocked on her door. "Grace, honey? Can I come in?"

"Okay."

I opened the door, and found that, as I expected, Grace was crying. "What's wrong, honey?"

She sighed. "After my wife died, I thought that the worst thing about someone dying was that I wouldn't see them anymore. Now,... " She started up again. "Now my little girl is dead, and I see her face every day!"

I brought her into a hug. "I can't say that I know what it's like to lose someone like you have. But I think I can see where you're coming from. LeAnn is probably still alive, in my old body, but I haven't heard from him since this whole mess started."

She sat up. "N-not at all?"

"Not at all. From everything Kyle and the Conroys have said, it sounds like she just isn't interested in this life. Somebody else is having the baby she didn't want, and working the job she hated, and that seems to be all she cares about." I gave a chuckle. "I can imagine how my mom is reacting to her antics, though. And it's not pretty."

A slight smile came to her lips. "A real technocrap, huh?"

"What's that?"

"You know, the kind who won't 'tech-no-crap' from anyone?"

I laughed. "Yep, that's my old mom. Of course, Mama Conroy isn't exactly a pushover, so I don't know if LeAnn will reform anytime soon. But I can hope."

"So can I."

I kissed her forehead. "Feeling a little better?"

"A little."

"Be right back."

I went to the bathroom, grabbed a bottle of aspirin, filled a glass with water, then returned. "When I got real upset at night, Mom would give me an aspirin, so I could get back to sleep again. Here you go."

She took the aspirin, washing it down with the water. "Thanks,... Mom."

It did my heart such good to hear Grace call me that. "You're welcome, sweetie," I said, and kissed her forehead again.

I put the empty glass back in the bathroom, and waddled back to bed.

Kyle was waiting for me. "Is she okay?"

"Getting there." I told him what she and I had talked about, right up to her calling me Mom.

"We're making quite the family, aren't we?"

"Mmm-hmm. Not how I imagined it would be. But I'm glad it's mine."

"So, since we're both still up, what do you want to do?"

I pulled my nightgown off over my head. "I can think of something."
13311211121111111121211.title: Continue

133112111211111111212111.content:
I checked my reflection in the mirror. My roots were beginning to show. By the time the baby came, I would need a short haircut. I went to the kitchen to start breakfast.

Once the cooking was started, Kyle came in. "I ought to tell you," he said, "you have an appointment with the OB/GYN in a couple days."

"Okay," I replied. "Want to come along?"

"Really?"

"Sure. I've never been to an OB/GYN before. Besides, we can ask to see how close my instinct is about this baby being a boy."

Kyle kissed me. "The old LeAnn wasn't much interested in anything to do with the baby."

"Well, I couldn't be more interested. When I'm alone, I talk to him. I'd like to hear from the doctor if he can hear me."

Grace came in. "Good morning, Grace. Feeling better this morning?"

"Uh-huh," she said. "I made up my mind."

"What about?" Kyle asked.

"I decided to go back to school."
133112111211111111212111.title: Next morning

1331121112111111112121111.content:
"Good morning," the doctor said, as she stepped into the exam room. "I'm Dr. Campbell. It says here you were part of that Great Shift?"

"That's right," I replied. "I used to be a teenage boy in Baltimore."

"I see. So, should I call you LeAnn or... ?"

"LeAnn is fine."

"Alright. And who is this fellow?"

"I'm Kyle. I'm the baby's father."

"Good to see you, Kyle. Now, LeAnn, let me start off by saying that, for the next couple of months, I will be seeing you every two weeks. This doesn't mean that there is necessarily a problem with your pregnancy, it's just that we want to get in front of anything that might happen."

"Like what?"

"Well, LeAnn, your blood pressure is elevated. It might be just a little too much stress, but we want to make sure. Ready for your first ultrasound?"

"I'm ready," I said. "I've got this feeling like it's a boy."

The doctor smeared cold goop on my belly, then rubbed a wand over it. "Chalk one up for your instincts. Looks like he's doing fine so far."

"You said my blood pressure was up. Could that hurt him?"

"Under certain circumstances. If it turns out to be preeclampsia, we'd need to be very careful. For now, let's see if you're just under too much stress."

"How do we do that?"

"I'm putting you on a strict resting policy for now. You can continue to go from here to there, but you must sit down whenever you can."

"That's going to be a problem. I'm a waitress."

"In that case, I recommend one of two things: The first is to go on maternity leave early."

"And if I can't?"

"You'll need to quit."

I wasn't looking forward to not working at the diner anymore. I was really starting to fit in there. But I didn't want to hurt the baby. I didn't want to hurt my son.
1331121112111111112121111.title: At the doctor's office

13311211121111111121211111.content:
Kyle drove me to the diner. "Hi, LeAnn," said Amelia, who had once been Kristy. "How's the baby?"

"He's doing okay," I replied. "I've got to talk to the manager." I went to her office.

I knocked on the door before entering. "Good to see you, LeAnn. How's the baby? Do you need anything?"

"I do," I said. "I've got to go on maternity leave, starting now. Doctor's orders."

"'Doctor's orders'? Is it anything serious?"

"My blood pressure's up. The doctor wants me to take it easy, and spend less time on my feet. Can't really do that as a waitress."

The manager came out from behind her desk and hugged me. "Poor dear. I'm afraid we don't have a maternity leave policy, but you're welcome to come back after the baby comes, if you want to."

"Thanks. That's something, I guess."

"The important thing is for you to look after that bundle of joy you're carrying. We'll sure miss you around here. You've been doing a great job, better than it was before."

"Thanks. Well, I'll go say goodbye to the others, then go home and get off my feet. But first, I need to use the little girl's room. He's sitting right on my bladder."

"Oh, it's a boy, is it? Well, congratulations. Take care, LeAnn."

"I will. Goodbye."
13311211121111111121211111.title: Turning in notice

133112111211111111212111111.content:
Later on that afternoon, I had the apartment to myself while Kyle and Grace were seeing a movie downtown. Since they were now father and daughter, I recommended that they at least acted the part. It gave me some time to myself; which I used to clean the apartment and do some laundry. As I walked back into the apartment carrying a hamper of clothes, I couldn’t help but think that I truly was adjusting to the role of a mother and girlfriend.
I was busy folding some of Grace’s clothes, hoping that a ketchup stain had gotten out of her soccer uniform, when I heard a ringing noise coming from Kyle’s laptop. Walking over, I saw that I was still logged into Skype from when I’d called LeAnn’s...my parents earlier in the day.

Sitting down, I was surprised to see the call was coming from my old Skype account. Wondering what was going on, I answered the call and was greeted with the face of Amber Reilly, a girl from school who was the definition of a dumb blonde. “Amber, is that you?”

“Nope.” Giggling, the girl said, “I know I like totally look like Amber; but I’m really Ryan.”

“Ryan?” confused, I said, “What are you doing in Amber’s body; I thought you ended up in Olivia’s body after the Shift?”

“There was like this aftershock thingy a few days after the Shift; and I totally found myself in this body afterwards.”

I had heard that the Baltimore area had been hit by an aftershock; but I was confused as to why Ryan was talking just like Amber did. “That explains a few things; but why are you talking like that?”

“I don’t really like know for sure; I guess it’s like because Evan, I mean LeAnn, thought it was better this way.” Giggling, Ryan said, “He’s like my boyfriend and all; so I wanted to make him happy. I’ve like been doing this for so long, I can’t stop; my parents are totally worried about it but I could care less.”

“So you’re basically just like Amber?” pausing, I said, “Wait a minute...you’re dating LeAnn, in my body?”

“Yeah; it’s been great.” Pausing, Ryan said, “She...I mean he must have this thing for blondes or something.”

“We’ll get back to that later.” Sighing, I said, “How come no ones contacted me until now? I’ve been calling for weeks without answers.”

“Evan totally told us that you didn’t want anything to do with us; but I guess I like didn’t really believe that.” pausing, Ryan said,
“Besides; I like totally miss you. It’s too bad you’re not up here; we’re both good looking girls, we could totally get boys to get us anything we wanted.”

“I don’t know if that’s going to happen; I’m in my third trimester and my doctor put me on bed rest until the baby is born.” Getting worried about the mental health of Ryan, I said, “Besides, I’ve already got myself a boyfriend and the guys in Baltimore aren’t really my type.”

“That’s too bad; I was hoping to like get to know you again.” Pouting, Ryan said, “Ever since John was shifted into a baby down the street, I’ve had like no one to hang out with besides Evan.”

“What about Corinne?”

“She’s gone totally native ever since she shifted into the body of John’s dad.” Pausing, Ryan said, “She hasn’t told anyone; but I’m like sure she’s sleeping with John’s dad now that he’s in shifted into his wife’s body.”

After talking more about what was going on at home, apparently my mom was adjusting well to being a teenage girl again, I turned my attention to a concern I’d had since Ryan called. “Ryan, I have to ask you this.” Sighing, I said, “Have you actually...gotten dumber since the shift?”

“Oh god; you totally sound like my parents now.” Frustrated, Ryan said, “Just because my grades like totally dropped to Cs doesn’t mean I’m stupid. I may talk like I’m some ditzy blonde, but I’m like totally smart still.”

“Uh huh, prove it.” Pausing, I said, “Tell me what you should do if a cop pulls you over for speeding and wants to give you a ticket?”

“Oh that’s an easy one.” Gesturing to his chest, which was barely contained in a bra that was obviously one size too small, Ryan said, “Show him my breasts and hope I can convince him to give me a warning.”

“That’s not right at all, Ryan.” Frustrated, I said, “Tell LeAnn to call me later; I would like to speak with...him about why he’s okay with you turning into a dumb bimbo.”

“Hey, I am not a bimbo.” Upset, Ryan said, “I like may not be as smart as you anymore; but I’m totally better looking than you.”

“Looks aren’t everything, Ryan.” Sighing, I said, “Come on, you’re turning into Brian’s ditzy ex-girlfriend on Family Guy.”

“I’m totally smarter than Jillian.” Getting angry, Ryan said, “You know what, I think you’re like totally jealous that I’m better looking
than you and have a much better boyfriend.”

Until now I’d been more than able to control my emotions; but hearing Ryan insult the father of my child, I couldn’t take it anymore.
“Don’t you ever insult my boyfriend; he’s better man than even you were before the Shift. He took me into his home even though he didn’t know me.”

“So he’s a better man, huh?” scoffing, Ryan said, “I guess he like didn’t tell you how he hooked up with LeAnn, did you.”

“Yeah, he did actually.” I knew I was lying, Kyle and I hadn’t talked much about our past lives since we became a couple. Looking at Ryan, I said, “He met LeAnn through a mutual friend; and they started dating.”

“That’s totally not how it happened, LeAnn told me what really happened.” Looking at me, Ryan said, “It seems your boyfriend was such a loser that no girl would ever go one more than one date with him; LeAnn decided to have pity sex with him one night. That’s why she hated being pregnant; because she regretted the decision to sleep with him in the first place.”

“I’ve had enough of this; I’m 7 months pregnant, I don’t need this kind of aggravation.” Getting up, I said, “Have LeAnn call me later; so we can settle this.”

“Fine, bitch.” Getting angry, Ryan said, “You can bet Evan won’t be happy when I tell him how you treated his girl.”

Ending the call, I let out a frustrated groan as I walked away from the computer. As I tried to calm down, I felt my son starting to move around. Placing a hand on my belly, I said, “It’s alright, sweetie.”

As I worked to calm myself down, I knew Kyle wasn’t going to be happy when I told him what LeAnn was saying about him.
133112111211111111212111111.title: Unexpected news from home

1331121112111111112121111111.content:
When Kyle got back, I told him what had happened while Grace went to her room. As I expected, he wasn't thrilled. "So she's telling people it was pity, huh? I've got to have a word with her."

The computer chirped. I turned it on. LeAnn, in my old body, glared at me. "What's the deal getting my girlfriend upset, Evan?"

Kyle turned the computer to face him. "What's the deal getting my girlfriend upset? Yours isn't pregnant yet, is she?"

"Kyle, this doesn't concern you."

"Everything that happens under my roof concerns me, LeAnn. And, by the way, why are you lying about me? About us?"

"What are you talking about?"

"Look at everyone who Shifted. They've all acquired at least some of the personality traits that went with their new bodies. And a former 14-year-old boy loves me. What does that tell you?"

LeAnn looked like he'd been punched in the gut. "Shut up!"

"No, LeAnn. We loved each other. We didn't plan on having a baby so soon, but you and I were in love. And Evan here is the proof."

I didn't know what to say. It came out of left field,... but it made so much sense at the same time. This was why I loved Kyle: because LeAnn had.

"You weren't the best girlfriend I ever had," Kyle continued. "But I overlooked your faults, because I was in love. But now I love someone who loves me back, and she doesn't come with the rest of your baggage. Even your former parents agree."

LeAnn started to cry. "M-Momma? D-Daddy?"

Kyle nodded. "They're getting along great with Evan. I've adopted a neighbor who got Shifted into his little girl, and we're making a family together. Our son is going to have a big sister."

LeAnn was crying now. "M-my son?"

"This is our life, now, LeAnn. Now, the doctor doesn't want Evan stressed any more than she has to be, so I'd appreciate it if she didn't get any more attack calls. Okay?"

"O-okay, Kyle."

"Alright. I hope you and this Amber girl find the happiness I've found. Goodbye, LeAnn."

"D-don't... "

"Huh?"

He sniffled and wiped the tears from his eyes. "D-don't call me LeAnn anymore. Please."

"Okay. Goodbye for now, Evan."

"G'bye."

Evan turned off the computer. "Let's see how long this truce lasts."

I put my arms around Kyle. "I guess this makes me LeAnn from now on, huh?"

"I guess so. How about we get something from the drive-thru for dinner tonight?"

"Works for me, babe."
1331121112111111112121111111.title: Continue

13311211121111111121211111111.content:
It had been a few hours since we returned from our impromptu family dinner. Kyle was in the shower, while I was sitting at the kitchen table going over some bills and looking for pregnancy courses to take. I’d narrowed my choices down to three different courses; and was looking at one of them when I saw Grace walk out of her bedroom.

It seemed that while Grace had accepted that she was a kid again, she had not quite accepted that she was a girl; which was why she was wearing a pair of Transformers pajamas. Turning from the laptop, I looked at her and said, “What’s up, kiddo?”

“I was thinking about Dad and you were saying in the car about how a person who was Shifted takes on the personality of the person they become.” Looking at me, she said, “Do you really believe that?”

“There’s plenty of evidence, just from seeing you and me, to see that it’s true.” Picking Grace up, which was no small task considering her size and my pregnancy; I walked over the couch and sat down. Looking at her, I said, “How else would you explain why I, a teenage boy, so quickly fell in love with an older man; and why you blush every time you see Kevin.”

“Wh-What!?” shocked, Grace said, “I-I don’t like Kevin.”

“I didn’t say you liked him.” Grinning, I said, “I said you blushed every time you saw him.”

After a moment, Grace said, “Okay maybe I do like him a little; I mean we’re both adults in the bodies of children.” Blushing a bit, Grace said, “You don’t think that’s weird, do you?”

“Not if you don’t think it’s weird that Kyle and I are dating.”

“Nah, that’s not weird.” Chuckling, Grace said, “I’ve seen how happy you guys are together; it’s clear that you’re meant to be
together.”

Just then, I looked at the clock and saw that it was getting close to 9:30. Turning to Grace, I said, “We should get you to bed, kiddo; we have orientation at school tomorrow.”

“Okay.” Leaning over, Grace kissed me on the cheek and said, “Goodnight mom.”
13311211121111111121211111111.title: Later

133112111211111111212111111111.content:
Before the Shift had occurred, I had always thought it would be a while before I was visiting an elementary school as a parent. I’d also never thought I’d be 8 months pregnant; but that’s another story entirely.

Kyle and I were walking through the school with Grace; who seemed to know where she was going. It didn’t take a genius to know her daughter had attended this school. As Kyle and I followed Grace, I turned to Kyle and said, “With everything that’s happened, I have to say this is the weirdest thing to happen in my life.”

“I’ll admit, this is pretty weird for me as well. But.” Smiling, Kyle said, “This is what Grace wanted; and we want to be supportive and loving parents.”

“That we do.” Smiling, I said, “I’m already used to Grace calling me Mom.”

It wasn’t long before we’d arrived at the auditorium. While the kids went to the front, Kyle and I joined the parents in the back. We quickly spotted Carly, formerly Carl, sitting nearby. Walking over to sit with her, I saw that she was all dressed up; wearing a figure hugging dress and boots. Looking at her, I said, “Aren’t you a little overdressed for a school orientation?”

“I’ve got a date right after this with a guy on my floor.” Pausing, Carly said, “I figured it would save time and he could meet me here.”

“What about Kevin?” confused, I said, “Are you bringing your former wife on a date?”

“No.” pausing, Carly said, “I was actually hoping you guys could watch him for a while.”

Casting a quick glance at Kyle, who nodded in agreement, I said, “We’d love to watch him; it would give Grace a chance to deal with her feelings for him.”

“So you’ve noticed that too, huh?” chuckling, Carly said, “Kevin’s talked about nothing but Grace for the last three days; he’s really hoping they’re in the same class.”

“You know; I think it’s funny how things turned out.” Pausing, I said, “Here I am; a teenage boy in the body of a pregnant woman, dating her boyfriend. I’m a mother to an 8 year old girl who used to be a grown man.”

“Maybe this is how things were meant to be.”
133112111211111111212111111111.title: Continue

1331121112111111112121111111111.content:
Kyle and I were in bed, watching TV. "Kevin and Grace seem to be getting along better," he said.

"I'm glad," I replied. "Kids ought to get along,even when they're former adults of different sexes."

"Anything else on your mind?"

"Amber, formerly Ryan. As Ryan, he was one of the brightest kids in school. As Amber, though, she's acting like a total bimbo."

"Did Amber act like that?"

"Yeah, but you'd think a bright guy wouldn't want to be a dumb blonde joke come to life."

"Maybe she can't help it."

"But you'd still think she'd try to fight it. I mean, I didn't jump right into bed with you, even when I realized that I wanted to."

"Maybe Ryan likes the popularity, and thinks that being out to lunch is worth it. Different people want different things."

"It still bothers me."

"Well, don't let it bother you too much. I don't know how Evan dealt with stress, but LeAnn's got to watch her blood pressure."

He was right. My blood pressure had gone down to acceptable levels, meaning my resting policy was doing its job, but the doctor still wanted me to take it easy until the baby boy parked on my bladder was in my arms.
1331121112111111112121111111111.title: Continue

13311211121111111121211111111112.content:
I woke up the next morning to rain pelting the bedroom window. Sitting up, I got a little worried when I did not see Kyle lying next to me; since I was typically up before him. I was about to get out of bed to look for him, when he walked into the room with a tray full of food. “Don’t you move a muscle, babe.”

So I was understandably shocked when I looked down and saw a conservative dark blue pleated skirt and a white blouse. Plus, of course, two considerable mounds where my chest used to be. I almost passed right back out.

Instead, I looked at my surroundings. I was in a rather plain classroom filled with the everyday cheap tan desks, one thick but bright window in one corner, and Christ in His Agony on the wall, above the blackboard.

However, I was more focused on the people in the room. I found a lot of confused students, with all the girls dressed like me, and boys in dress pants and a white polo. Also, there was a rather imposing ancient nun striding about the room in an attempt to restore order. I nearly laughed out loud at how dead on the Hollywood stereotype of a Woman of God was. Shock is a funny thing.

The nun realized something had to be wrong on the outside of school to cause this sort of pandemonium. She reached under her desk, and like a magician pulling a rabbit out of a hat, came a FEMA radio. This time I really did laugh. Every staion had a taped "in case of emergency" broadcast. The Lady was suddenly speaking of Armaggedon and Second Coming to the students (several of whom had already fled), which only increased the panic.

What do you do?

1352.content:
I looked on my shoulder, next to my desk, even under my feet for a purse, but there was none. There wasn't even a paper with a name on it in her pocket. Finally, I looked at a small, golden cross around my neck (It was, admittedly, still sort of nice to look down, even if I didn't like having the breasts myself) and found the name ANNA stenciled on the back. Well, at least I had a name.

The class and the ancient nun were'nt getting anywhere fast. Man, it was loud in that classroom! I just had to leave, or I might just go crazy.

If I had thought things were crazy in the classroom, it was nothing as compared to the hallways. The hallways looked just like a classroom, just without desks and made longer. Oh, and no windows, either. All there was for light were some bright, utilitarian flourescents, throwing an unforgiving light. Some people were sprinting back and forth looking for god-knows-what, others calling out for friends, some just crying. It was a madhouse. I was just contemplating re-entering the classroom and waiting for all the racket to die down when I was grabbed from behind on my upper arm. Hard, too!

I wheeled around to find a rather short, pleasant looking blonde girl staring at me. She immediatley began talking to me, obviously sure that I was who I looked like.

"Anna!" she nearly yelled, "something horrible has happened!" Before I could interrupt, she continued. "I was just in Hill's Social Studies and this-" she gestured at the crazed people in the hallway- "just started out of the blue!" I noted her deep South accent. "Do you think we'll be able to find Mellissa?"

I felt rather guilty watching her cute, hopeful face fall after I asked, "Who are you?"

"You really don't know me? I'm your best friend!" she just about whispered, crestfallen, as she withdrew her hand.

"Well, I'll suppose I'll go first. Up until about five minutes ago, I was Evan, a seventeen year-old guy. But I guess I'll go by Anna, too now. I think a lot of the people in these halls, hell, maybe everywhere, is in a similar situation."

At first, she stared at me like I was crazy, but it dawned on her slowly that yes, this was plausible. At the very least, more plausible than most therories. It fit with the clues, anyway.

Very cautiously, she introduced herself as Katherine, Anna's best friend for eight years. And of course, a good friend of Mellissa's. Even though Katherine kept a very close eye on me, we agreed we should probably stay together, because it made no sense to split up. Anyways, two heads are better than one when looking for one girl who could literally be anyone in a fairly large school like this one.

You had favored leaving the school, but Katherine had warned about leaving the school to go into Atlanta. Atlanta! Why had I been switched to Georgia?

"So what does this Mellissa girl look like?"

Katherine produced a photo from her purse. She must of had the purse in a locker before class.

It was of Katherine and two other girls that I did not recognize. She pointed at the black girl.

"That's Mel."

Looking at the picture, I saw that Katherine and Mellissa were nearly exact opposites. Katherine was a very white, short girl with a narrow nose, green eyes, and short, shoulder-cropped blonde hair. Mellissa, on the other hand, was a rather tall girl of African descent, with coffee colored skin, dark eyes, a wide nose, and neat black hair pulled back into a pony tail. The only thing they seemed to have in common is that they were both good-looking. I didn't know who the middle girl was, but she was beautiful, even though she couldn't have been more than fourteen, like the other two. Long, middle of the back, light brown hair, a pretty, innocent face, and some generous breasts.

I asked Katherine what Mel's 3rd period class was. She was certain that it was an Algebra class, but that was clear across the school.

"Let's get going then."

The scene was pretty much the same everywhere. Students, all dressed alike, even teachers, nuns, and a priest were either crying, running, shouting, or looking at themselves. A few were just walking, like me and Katherine, but we were in the minority.

In my mind, we had no chance of finding this girl unless she came to us. Katherine was either unaware of this or did not want to believe it, but Mellissa may still be near her body. I had nothing else to do anyways. Its not like I had a lot of contacts in Georgia to find! I was sort of starting to like Katherine anyways, despite our initial meeting. I still think she thought that I was crazy, though.

We had to go through the cafeteria to reach the Math hall, but it was literally packed. People must have decided that the biggest room was the safest, or had a better chance of containing friend. Either way, it wasn't easy getting through. When we finally found an empty space, I needed a rest. However, Katherine was determined to keep moving. I asked for the picture, desperate for any excuse. My eyes immediately flicked to the middle girl. She was HOT! My eyes drifted south, and right where the chest began curving, was a spot of gold standing out against the white. I pulled the photo closer. It was a small, golden cross.

It couldn't be! I felt like I needed to find a mirror or something, but Katherine was already moving. I couldn't just leave the only person I knew in the state to look at myself in the mirror!

Leaving Katherine was probably the stupidest thing I could think of doing right now. Sure, I might get to see what I looked like, but then what? I wouldn't accomplish anything alone. Besides, I'm sure I would get to see it all before too long, whether I wanted to or not.

Before I knew it, we had walked made it across the panicked, crowded school.

"I think it's this room. At least, I'm pretty sure." I had no choice but to follow her into the room.

It looked exactly like the room I had come out of, excepting the window. This classroom was, by my estimation, one room from the outer wall. There were only three students in the room, including the girl I recognized as Mellissa from the photograph. She was just sitting in a desk near the front with a listless expression. She glanced up at us when we walked in.

"Mel? is that you?" Katherine asked, having learned her lesson from her and I's first meeting. She sadly shook her head. "So who are you?" Katherine continued in a gentle voice.

"More like was. Was Austin Jones." I heard Katherine draw a quick gasp.

"From the basketball team?"

"That's the one."

"Wow"

I didn't know much of what was going on between these two, but I could sympathize with the guy (girl?). Just fifteen minutes ago, I was in the same position. Probably still would be if Katherine hadn't found me first.

As we turned for the door, Mellissa/Austin Jones shouted "Wait!" As we turned back to face her, she began to plead with us. "Please, can I come with you? I mean, I won't be any trouble. It's just that, well, I have nowhere else to go. I'll even help you find your friend. Especially if she's in my body."

I really didn't care if he came, I mean, I was in the same situation not long ago. But Katherine was enthusiastically on board with the idea. "Sure! Come with. Please, the more, the merrier!" I was begining to suspect Katherine had a little bit of a crush on Austin Jones.

Mellissa got to her feet unsteadily. "So where to now?"

Katherine didn't know. " The cafeteria's a nightmare right now, but maybe that's where she is. Where was your class when you switched?"

"Gym." They turned to me for the answer. I don't know, I've been in this school for just fifteen minutes! Oh well, someone has to make a decision.

info.brief_description: An experiment gone wrong!  Bodies switched around the world!  Based on Morpheus' stories.
info.description:
My name... well, at this point it's not really important anymore but if you want to know, it was Evan. I WAS a kind of average high school sophomore... until the Great Shift. An experiment gone wrong caused most of the world to switch bodies and I wasn't an exception. Now, well... I'm stuck in a body that's very much not my own. This is my story.

For the most part everything is alright, but there ARE rules:

1.) Be mindful of grammar. I don't expect everyone to have perfect grammar but make sure your chapter is readable. I'll delete it if it's unreadable.
2.) Follow the story. Taking the story in new directions is fine. But if you write something that obviously has no connection to the previous chapter(s), it'll get deleted.
3.) Try to keep sex to a minimum. A little bit is alright, but don't make every chapter about sex or "playing with my new hot body." If it's over the line, it's gone.
4.) Add CONTENT. One or two sentences isn't going to cut it. A paragraph only is pushing it. If it's just meaningless filler, I'm deleting it.
5.) Don't have the main character switch bodies a lot. There are "aftershocks" but only a handful for the first day or two and they effect less and less people each time so only switch the main character again if you think you've got a good story to tell.

Other than that, you can do most anything else so have fun.

I'm aware that the first chapters are meaningless fluff. I just wanted to get the "nothing more than a choice" chapters out of the way immediately so no matter what, people have something to choose.
